text: 330ml bottle at krchma horvati, zagreb.. pours clear light red-brown amber color with thin white head.. citrus, orange, topical fruits.. grapefruitty taste, caramel.. mid carbonation, mild bitterness.. very solid amber

Bottle 0.33L.
Slightly hazy, dark amber-to-copper body with an average, frothy tan head, mostly diminishing with some nice lacing, though.
Moderate malty (caramel) and hoppy (grapefruit) aroma with notes of fruits (peach).
Moderate sweet and bitter flavour with a long-lasting dry finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

Color ámbar, ligeramente turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de tres dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media. Textura acuosa. Aroma terroso, a malta caramelizada y tostada, cereal, lúpulo maduro, hierba húmeda. En boca increíble balance entre maltas y lúpulos, muy terrosa, mucho grano, a la vez mucho lúpulo, ligero contrapunto ácido casi al final del trago aportado por una dosis mínima de cítricos. Final de amargor muy ligero. Quedan grano y caramelo en boca. Balanceada, sabrosa y completa. Hacer una cerveza con tal número de maltas y lúpulos y solo 5% debe de ser una buena odisea.
bottle. attractive red color with average head. aroma is slight caramel and fruity. taste is slight caramel, light fruits and sharp hops. highly drinkable. complex for a light bodied amber.

S: hoppy, citrus A: orange, clear T: med high bitterness P: med carbonation

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color rojizo con espuma beige persistente.
Aromas a caramelo, pino, resina, lúpulo
Sabores dulces, malta, galleta, ciruelas pasas, cítricos y herbáceos.
Cuerpo medio y carbonatación ligera muy balanceada entre el dulce y amargo. 
Muy buena! Gran cerveza.

Appearance: deep reddish amber. Moderately hazy. Thin ring of tiny white bubbles
Nose: medium caramel malt with hop notes of citrus.
Taste: medium caramel sweetness with citrus hop bitters and touches of stone fruit
Body: medium and smooth
Parting thoughts: a decent red ale. Good caramel with a little fruit. Nice hops to provide contrast and bitter finish.

Birra ambrata con schiuma biege cremosa ed abbastanza persistente. Aromi di caramello frutta (ciliegia, agrumi) cioccolato ed una nota resinosa dei luppoli. Sapore fotocopia dellaroma con un finale amaro non molto aggressivo ma che pulisce bene la bocca.

Dark red. Fruity aroma, some hop bite. Cherries, Grapefruit with some roasted malts. Not bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 33 cl, de cata en Liquidos. Color rojo intenso, espuma beige moderada y burbujas finas poco abundantes. Aromas a caramelo, cítricos (naranja, pomelo) y florales. Sabor seco, caramelo, malta tostada, pomelo. Persistente y moderadamente amarga. Una red pale ale de libro.

Espuma beige-marrón que permanece como una fina capa, color rojo oscuro, algo turbia sin apreciarse el brotar de burbujas, aroma bastante intenso y dulce, sabor suave y sutil con poca carbonatación y notas dulces y amargas con final sabroso
Pours clear dark amber with a medium white foamy head. Medium carbonation. Nice lacing. Citrus, grapefruit, light resin notes, light malts, light resin.

Amber kleurig bier met een crème kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: fruitig, karamel, brood.

Smaak: fruitig, butterscotch, brood en een bittertje.

Botella en 99Cervezas.

Vierte en un bonito color ámbar-caramelo rojizo, algo velado, aunque bastante transparente y brillante para ser una Ale. Formación de espuma color vainilla de burbuja pequeña y persistencia moderada. Buena carbonatación y adherencia.

De intensidad media-alta en nariz, da de inmediato notas de lúpulo y naranja (como de mermelada de naranja amarga). También hay notas de miel muy agradables y de fruta escarchada. El lúpulo va ganando espacio conforme evoluciona en nariz, apareciendo unas notas aquesadas y resinosas muy suaves. Gran complejidad y gran placer para nuestra nariz.

De entre los sabores básicos destaca el amargo y el ácido, en forma de punto cítrico. También hay algo de salado. Curiosamente, todo el dulce que se percibía en nariz parece estar ausente en el primer trago, pero está ahí y pronto se va abriendo paso conforme la cerveza evoluciona en boca. Entonces vuelve a salir la fruta escarchada y el caramelo, dando un final muy equilibrado de dulce, amargo y cítrico muy agradable. En ese sentido, resulta sorprendente en boca.

De cuerpo medio-ligero en boca y carácter claramente refrescante. No llena totalmente la boca aunque deja una sensación bastante agradable y nada pesada. Persistencia media.

Una cerveza sorprendentemente compleja tanto en nariz como en boca. La bebo y me recuerda al dulce de calabaza que en la zona de Alcoy llaman "arrop i tallaetes". Su complejidad le permite ser una cerveza todoterreno, tanto de trago largo como parte de un aperitivo, trago medio con una buena carne o una paellita, e incluso de trago corto que permita disfrutar poco a poco de su complejidad (a pesar de no ser de gran cuerpo). Absolutamente recomendable.

Nice deep ruby appearance very easy drinking good head. Nice bitter finish and good to pair with food.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,33 l. Bottle. Amber color with beige head. Malt and fruit aroma. Sweet, bitter, citrus and toffee taste. Low carbonation. Easy to drink

20170507 HOME; 33 cl bottle; BB 30/07/17. A clear amber coloured beer with a brown good & fine foam layer. Aroma is somewhat sweet & caramel with some citrus-like hops. Taste is what sweet, malty and caramel. This stays. And a citrus-like hop bitter is coming above this. Reasonable bitter which becomes light dry. Also some tropical fruit. Body is medium-full. Overall a somewhat sweet beer with a nice hop bitter aftertaste with some fruit.

Aroma - quite a bit heavy, with dried and wet leaves, lot of caramelized malt, caramel, caramelized fruits jam, dark honey, some earthy hop notes. Taste - hops with earthy notes, wed and dried leaves, partly rotten herbs, goes then with caramelized malt, caramel, some fruits jam and dark honey, a bit of bitterness. Not bad, but quite a bit heavy.

2016 catch up - Bottles at home from borthday present case - A nice beer that was pleasant to sip. Very smooth with both malt and hops coming through nicely. The mouthfeel was the key to this and I have to say the malt was very well done for Brewdog who tend to be hop obsessed.
Bottle from Tesco, Imperial Wharf. Good amber. A little too watery for my taste.
Une très bonne rousse qui en a le gout, assez parfumée, plutôt légère et bonne amertume.
cerveza ambar lupulona, con predominio del lupulo, final dulzon y para mi gusto ligeramente insipida. Algo mas me esperaba de ella

Pours (gushed!) murky, dirty red from the bottle with frothy off-white crown. Aroma is caramel, mashed up red currant. Taste is sweet with a caramel base, and a tart red berry undertone. Noticeable cherry. Finishes dry, tart, very lightly bitter. Medium bodied. Interesting, but the flavors dont quite work for me.

330 ml bottle from Tesco, London, UK. Colour is amber with a froathy, creamy white-off head. Aroma is malts, citrus, orange, orange zest, hops. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium with soft carbonation. Very easy drinkable.

Cerveza color café rojizo corona de espuma de baja carbonatacion burbujas de baja retención. Aroma a lúpulo sutil, con toque cítrico y un sutil dulce al final. Notas al paladar muy similares al aroma, perduran poco en el retrogusto, no de mala manera tomando en cuenta el estilo de la cerveza. Consistencia suave, ligera al paladar. Excelente cerveza muy completa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Sandy coloured fluffy head stayed on a light mahogany, finely carbonated body.
Sweet malty aroma.
Pings on the palate. Medium body. Smoother and softer on the back. 
To the fore its sweet malt, caramel, berries and this is followed by a floral tanginess & hints of citrus on the back.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2017 Bottiglia comprata direttamente da Brewdog online. Bella birra, rosso ramato con una schiuma persistente ma un po? grossolana. Profumo intenso e ricco che si ritrova in bocca. Amaro mai invadente.

Dark amber color, medium body, medium head, medium carbonation, sweet pineapple aroma, grapefruit. Very delicious to drink on a warm weather. 

Bottle 330ml, Shaker glass.
Leicht trübes dunkelrot mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Karamell, leicht fruchtig, etwas Grapefruit, dunkle Beeren, sehr süffig.

herbs, very hoppy aroma, dark brown red in colour, light tan head, not very lasting, light hop bitterness (unlike what I expected), caramel notes and aftertaste, the light bitterness almost vanished instantly the beer is gulped down, no prominent sweetness, medium body, low carbonation on tongue, the finish is abrupt, but not in a bad way

Berlin, BrewdogPub, kran. Ar: bardzo dobrze, bardzo intensywny, swiezy, sporo lesnej zywicy, troche dobrych owocow tropikalnych, nieco dobrych nut kwiatowych, nieco slodowosci, ciekawie, soczyscie, bogato, wszystko czego oczekiwac po stylu. Wyg: ladny lekko czerwonawy, piana szybko redukuje do cieniutkiego ultradrobnoziaristego ringu. Sm: bardzo solidnie, wysycenie srednio-wysokie, soczyscie, bogato, troche slodko, ale dobra kontra goryczki z amerykanskich chmieli, wiele dobrych wspolgrajacych nut, swietny, bardzo pijalny. Pos: owocowosc, lekka chmielowosc, fajnie. Ov: bardzo dobre, soczyste, aromatyczne, lekkie, bardzo pijalne.

Bottle. Clear amber colour, small tan head. Aroma: caramel, resin, toffee, some butterscotch. Taste is light to medium sweet and bitter: caramel, nuts, dark fruits, oranges, toffee, light fruity tartness. Light to medium body, soft to average carbonation, dry finish, thin texture. OK.

33 cl bottle, batch #160511. Clear, deep brownish amber, thin head, low carbonation. Aroma is dark fruits and a bit sweet caramel and toffee. Mouthfeel is a bit oily and resiny, dry at the very end, not much carbonation. Taste is nutty and caramelly, a bit too sweet for my likings.

Bottle. Clear dark amber color, nice beige head. Caramel, exotic fruity aroma. Dry taste, medium bitter, light sour. Malty aftertaste, dry citrus fruits and some red berries. Low carbonation, medium texture.
Nem a kedvenc sörfajtám, de dícséretes amit a skótok kihoztak belőle. Jó komló-maláta egyensúly, számomra némi mézes háttérízzel.
Bottle 0,33L.Pours hazy amber.Small 1 finger not lasting head. Strong aromas of caramel,citrus.Very balanced taste of red fruits,caramel,citrus.Slightly sour.
Bouteille achetée chez Intercaves. Belle couleur cuivrée. Ce nest pas la meilleure de chez Brewdog mais elle se défend bien.
Kran. W aromacie chmiel i trochę karmelowej podbudowy słodowej. W smaku słód, delikatne nuty chmielowe. Fajne.

Birra di colore rosso rubino. Schiuma caffelatte, fine e persistente. Allolfatto sentori di agrumi, spezie e malto tostato. Al palato mediamente corposa con note di malto tostato, agrumi e spezie. Nel finale rimane amara e piacevolmente luppolata. Pulisce e asiuga il palato. Una birra molto particolare una fusione di stili. Ottima.
Ottima bitter, corpo medio, malti caramello e luppolatura ben fusi in un ottimo equilibrio.

Excelente! Um das melhores do mundo. Corpo médio, baixo amargor que não persiste. No retrogosto o sabor se acentua dando a certeza que você está tomando uma excelente cerveja. Dentre as minhas Top 10.
Sample at Dogtap Columbus on 2/20/17. Pours clear red with a thick beige head. Aroma of malt, toffee and pine. Malty flavor with toffee and berry accents before a citrusy finish.

33 cl. bottle. Dark copper coloured beer with a minimal and very quickly disappearing off-white head. Aroma is classic ale but really nice: caramel, toffee, tropical fruits along with citrus notes. Taste is bittersweet -- moderate sweetness and moderate bitternes, well-balanced but not very impressive. It feels like somethings missing for having a really good taste. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Somewhat bitter and dry finish, not accentuated though. It is a good beer but didnt meet my expectation.

Wygląd: Piękna czerwień, ciemny rubin, chociaż piana mogłaby być trwalsza. Dość szybko opada, nie pozostawiając nawet cienkiej warstwy.
Aromat: Cytrusy z amerykańskich chmieli, ale też kwiatowość i owocowość, nuty malinowe.
Smak: Ponownie cytrusy, maliny, być może truskawki. Piwo gładkie, praktycznie bez goryczki (delikatna na finiszu), bardzo pijalne.
Ogólnie: Jest dobrze łamane na bardzo dobrze. Pije się z przyjemnością, chociaż nie wybija się na wybitny poziom.
Achetée au Hyper U de Sierentz. Bière brune au nez résineux, fruitée et houblonnée. En bouche elle est houblonnée et resineuse. Douceur et caractère font de cette bière une belle découverte.

Dark amber colour poured from the bottle with a centimetre of thick head. Strong caramel/toffee malt aromas. Quite a complex hop character with powerful citrus/grapefruit and a slight sour aftertaste.
Bottle - pours toffee amber with a cream head. Aroma is toffee caramel and citrus. Taste is toffee up front with a building citrus malt finish.
Dark amber with medium off-white head. Nice hoppy aroma with citrus notes. Good bitterness with citrus sourness, bitterness lasts in the aftertaste. Bit watery and dusty.

Poured into a becher pint glass, the appearance was a rustic dark red color with a fingers worth of white foamy head that dies off at a decent pace. Moderate lacing.
The aroma had some caramel/toffee malts up front with a touch of grassy to resinous bitter hoppiness. Touch of earthiness. Subtle chocolate.
The flavor yields to the sweetness initially through the malts. Resin bitterness touches gracefully in the background. Slightly crisp malty to bitter hoppy aftertaste. Quick malty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fair sessionability about it. Moderate crisp carbonation feels its way out over my tongue. ABV feels appropriate.
Overall, nicely done amber ale that I would have again.
Bottle at home. A flavourful beer which would accompany red meat perfectly. A wine like character.
330 ml bottle. Dark amber colour with a creamy, off white head. Toffee aroma, caramel, strawberry and tropical fruit flavour. Long a favourite, cant believe I hadnt rated this before
Live Pint at brew dog oxford street. Pours hazy amber with little head. Sweet caramel aroma with mutty, hoppy taste.

Pours a deep mahogany red with a beige head. Nose is caramel, treacle, toffee, plums and orange peel hops. Silky smooth mouth feel. Flavour is sweet caramel, dried red fruits, pecan, walnut and some orange peel. Nicely bitter for a red ale. Absolutely fantastic stuff !
caramel, resin, butterscotch, golden, clear, medium sweetness, light-medium bitterness, medium body, anything but thin, soft carbonation, smooth-lingering finish

een amber rode getinte ale met zeepig schuim pak geurend naar grapefruit ananas karamelmout toffee en gesuikerde noten dan proef ik grapefruit en tropisch fruit zachte karamel mout aard smaak en hopblad

Kolor czerwono miedziany, brunatny, z niezbyt wysoką i mało trwałą pianą. 
Aromat to głównie owoce tak cytrusowe jak i tropikalne i żywica z przewagą tej drugiej. 
Smak podobnie jak zapach owoce tropikalne i cytrusowe i do tego intensywna żywica. Po ogrzaniu się piwa w tle pojawiają się delikatne akcenty karmelu. Dalej jednak wiodąca jest żywica i to ona jest nośnikiem goryczki w tym piwie. 
Wysycenie średnie.
Great beer, amber color, two finger white head with great lacing in glass, citrus smell and taste, caramel taste, nice carbonation, and great balance between hops and malts.
From bottle, pours a clear copper red with a medium whitish head. Aroma and taste has some caramel, biscuit, and hints of fruit. Neither bitter nor sweet. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation.

Bouteille 33 cl. Belle robe ambrée/rubis, mousse blanche. Nez fruité complexe où je trouve : prune, pêche, abricot, orange, raisin ... mais aussi le caramel. Bouche douce, fraîche, houblonnée, toujours sur le fruit et le caramel et finale amère. Superbe !

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2017 Butelka 330ml. Ciemno-bursztynowy kolor. Piana mala,lekko brudzona ,zanika natychmiast. Aromat lekko sosnowy w tle owoce suszone i tropikalne i pomarancze. W smaku sosnowe z niezla goryczka ,karmel rodzynki slody.

Dark amber auburn 

Nose orange peel hints burned toffee fruity orangey 
Up front zesty bitter sweet, on the back end a long Marmalade 
Mouthfeel fresh lively carbonation

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - Hazy orange beer with off-white head. Hi e grapefruit aroma. Decent bitterness. Citrus notes. Low carbonated.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
bottiglia 33 cl, ambrata rossa, schiuma grossolana media persistenza, al naso intensa agrumata, amaro medio, finale secco.
Классич& цвет. Отличны& аромат. Вкус немного разочар& В целом хорошо.

0,33l bottle. Amber color with medium white head. Aroma: grapefruit, pineapple, caramel. Taste: resins, citrus, juicy, caramel. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Watery palate. Nice balance between american hops and malts.
Nice beer could have been a little hopier for my pallette but would buy agaim....

Is a beer perfectly executed but does not move me.
The aroma is BrewDog, the alcohol is perfectly integrated, the feeling in palate is quite velvety and has a very good taste, but doesnt makes me feel nothing special.
Кран. бурштин& колір з маленьк& білою шапкою. Має фруктов& солодов& хмільни& аромат грейпфр& з деякими відтінк& карамел& Солодку& солодов& хмільни& смак.

I bought this bottle from Amstein, I drank it at home yesterday. In my opinion, it is a regular ale, it sounds a pale ale and the taste is close to a brewdog punk IPA. The color is a beautiful orange/red and the carbonation is a regular, thin foam. The taste is really bitter for a red ale, notes of sweetness, a bit watery, it is a good beer.

Bottle 0.33
Потряс пиво. Невероя& питкое, ароматн& общем, дайте две!
Bland sweet and a little bitter, not bad but not great either, like all brewdog regulars
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
This beer fit my mood well. Excellent amber/red color with a firm foam. Taste was delicious caramel and the finish was fruity and refreshing.

Draught
Aroma-fruits, floral
Appearance-red, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very drinkable

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 Pours dark red. Aroma of pine and dark berry fruits. Taste is burnt caramel, pine, dark fruits, pineapple. Not particularly bitter like many of Brewdogs mass commercial range. Nice but i feel the taste is too short lived, would be nice to have lingered abit longer to let some of the dank hop flavours shine through.

Beer with nice malty aroma with tropical fruits notes. Semi dry in taste with not strong grapefruit bitterness in palate with pineapple aftertaste. Almost clear amber colour body with strong long leasting white head. Overall very good beer!
Aroma herbal com toque cítrico. Densa e sabor predominante do malte no final. Muito boa.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

330 ml bottle. Pours clear ruby with fine, beige, lasting head. Lacing present, great looking beer. Hoppy aroma of toffee, gooseberry and currants. Taste is bitter/sweet, mostly currants and gooseberry with a slightly bitter hoppy finish. Low carbonation, refreshing, a bit empty. Very nice beer, small bottle went in way too fast.

Bottle from Tesco. Pours beautifully clear ruby with an off white head. Aroma of warm malt,bread,biscuit,chocolate & piney hop ,citrus & grapefruit. Taste is richly malty ,bread,biscuit,caramel with piney hop & light grapefruit. Smooth & lightish bodied with good bitterness & dryness . The finish has more malt flavours, biscuit,caramel ,pine & hop fruit. A good red ale!
Good, sweet, flowery aroma. Tasty, low carbonated beer with a sweet afterste. But it didnt really impress.

Mon Saint Graal Personnel. Brewdog est véritablement la brasserie coup de coeur pour moi: des bières sans concessions avec une véritable identité aromatique! cet red ale ne coupe pas à la tradition! elle est juste superbe
Вкусное красное элевое пиво, хороший аромат и мягкий вкус с горчинк& Похоже на IPA. Дата розлива 25.08.2016. (Bottle 0,33/ 5%)
Bottle. Caramel, citrus and herbs aroma. Its ok but other Brewdog beers are way better

The beer looks very nice. The color of the beer is a rather dark, brownish amber. The beer is quite cloudy, however, you can look trough the beer a tiny bit. On top of the beer a rough layer of slightly brownish foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses, to leave a tiny drape. The smell of the beer is nice. There is a strong hoppy aroma. The hop aromas are a bit resinous. There is also a sweet malty touch and a yeasty aroma, I dont really know how to describe it. It smells a little bit old. I dont 100% like this smell. There are also some aromas of spices. Its a complex smell. The taste of the beer is pretty much the same. I taste a nice bitterness, caused by the hops, together with a nice hoppy sour touch. There is also this malty sweetness. The beer is quite tasty. It is nice, and a bit complex. Just a good beer, like every BrewDog beer. I like the amount of hops in this beer. An Amber Ale that wishes to be more of an IPA.
caramel, bread, cereal, toast, floral, citrus, amber, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Keg @ BrewDog, Södermalm. Hazy amber, small tanned head, some lacing. Caramel and toffee aroma, toasted malt, nutty and leafy. Medium carbonated, smooth mouthfeel. Caramel taste, fudge, biscuits, grassy and leafy hops. Mild bitterness in the finish.

Copper body with a small head fading quickly, smell of caramel/toast.

On the tongue the only sensation is a slight touch of acid when I was expecting biterness.
Not tasting anything particular, pretty blend...

Not sure if its my palate or the beer too old, but as a brewdog beer I didnt had a slight feeling of the hops.

#ilostmytaste?
#totryagain

33cl. Bottle @ Home.
 - Aroma: very good aroma of tropical fruits, mango, grapefruit, passion fruit. A weird aroma i cant identify is present when the beer gets warmer or swirled and its not very pleasant, maybe barnyard aroma.
 - Appearance: very pretty dark amber-copper color with average head thickness. Beige head with above average retention and a bit of Brussels lacing. A bit of hazyness.
 - Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of tropical fruits, mango, grapefruit, hints of honey, citrus.
 - Palate: low-to-medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, long bitter-sweet finish of tropical fruits, mango, grapefruit, and hints of honey, very pleasant.
 - Overall: the weird aromas that showed up when warmed and swirled are not very pleasant. Nice appearance and quite good flavor. Very refreshing. Good long finish of tropical fruits, grapefruit, hints of honey and citrus.
Hazy red/ochre liquid, average head. Strong, fruity aroma of hops. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is bitter and sweet.

07-08-2016-0,33 L Flasche
Rötlich-braun, beiger Schaum.
Aroma: Mango, Ananas, Papaya.
Geschmack: Malzig, Zitrone, tropischer Früchtekorb. Nice!

Pint at BD Clerkenwell. Pours deep auburn, clear, dense off white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, biscuits. Good balance of sweetness and bitterness. Malt, toffee, a little chat on the taste. The beer that got me into Brewdog more than Punk tbh.

330ml bottle. Pours copper color with small off-white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, biscuit, citrus, fruits. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with dry, bitter finish.

33 cl. flaske, God bitterhed, rødlig farve, medium skum. Tropiske frugter, sødlig og let maltet
en rigtig god øl

Bottle @ home w parents. Appearance: pours clear red with good soapy off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: light barley, light caramel and grapefruit. palette: medium to strong us hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, dominated by a medium to distinct bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: nice and refreshing hoppy red/amber ale

No jak BrewDog się za coś weźmie... Kiedyś piłem z butelki. Było ok. Teraz piłem z kija i było dużo lepiej niż ok!! Ładny, bursztynowo-miedziany kolor, biała, drobna piana. W aromacie dużo karmelu i orzechów, sporo nut chmielowych. W smaku także orzechy, karmel, a także nuty kwiatowe, owocowe. Do tego świetna, żywiczna goryczka. Baaardzo przyjemne piwo!!

Data ważności:  31.07.2017 
 Kolor:  Czerwony, 100% klarowności. 
 Piana:  Żółta, puszysta, średniooczkowa. Patrząc z góry pęka do dużych oczek. 
Dłogo się utrzymuje na powierzchni. Opada do solidnej chmurki. Maluje przepiękne malunki na krawędziach.
Lacing wyborny. 
 Zapach:  Dość intensywny owocowy zapach. Kombinacja owoców cytrusowych i tropikalnych. Nie brakuje tutaj dojrzałego mango, ale także przed szereg wychodzi liczi.
W kontrze dla słodkich owoców staje iglasty, żywiczny aromat lasów tropikalnych.
Całkiem dobrze zaznacza się słodowa strona piwa z lekkim karnelem.
Na przeciwległym biegunie odrobina pikantnej woni od któregoś z 6 użytych chmieli. 
 Smak:  W smaku całe bogactwo czerwonych owoców (porzeczki, słodkie czereśnie, dojrzałe mango), poza tym sporo liczi.
Bardzo wyraźna żywiczna, leśna strona piwa.
Jest także sporo słodów z akcentami karmelu i odrobiny chleba. W dalszej perspektywie odrobine kwiatowe i ziołowe. Na języku pełne, gęste i treściwe. Wysycenie średnie.
Goryczka średniej maśni, żywiczno-owocowy umiarkowanie długi finisz.
Ciekawy Amber Ale, z pewnością smaczny i stylowy. 
 Wysycenie: Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Czerwone Ale z wyraźną słodową bazą i karmelowym bouncem.
W tym samym świecie jest także mnóstwo chmielów, który wnoszą do piwa akcenty czerwonych owoców (czerwona porzeczka, czereśnie i dojrzałe mango).
Jest także sporo żywicy, kwiatów i ziół.
Całkiem pijalne, przyjemne Amber Ale.
Dość treściwe, które w tej materii skłania się w stronę Red IPA.
Zniknęło dość szybko z firmowego BrewDog-owego Sniftera, więc o czymś to chyba świadczy.
Really nice like a mix between punk ipa and brooklyn. Could drink many of these  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is amber colored and has a cream colored head, with lots of bubbles. 
The aroma is malty, fruity and hoppy with tones of flowers and grass and a lot of tropical fruits like lychee, berries, citrus, oranges and mangos. Very nicely done.
The taste is malty and very fruity, with some notes of burnt sugar. After that comes the hops and that gives the taste fruitiness and notes of grass and flowers. 
The finish is dry and spicy with a subtle bitterness.

Cloudy reddish copper color with a moderate amount of activity. Light creamy half a finger head, lasting around 5 to 10 minutes, with average legs. Flavors of nutmeg, cinnamon, roasted sweet grains, caramel, butterscotch, tropical fruits, faint molasses, and herbal spices. Bready with a faint grassiness. Slick medium body with almost perfect crispy carbonation. Light to medium finish that lingers with burnt caramel sweetness, faint ginger and a grassy end. Lots of sweetness but with a nice bitter sharpness that makes it very fresh. A complex mix of malty, grassy, and roasted flavors that is simply delicious and highly accessible. Overall I find this one of the best BrewDog craft. You could almost drink this in the morning...like I did.
UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Bottle at Beer Zone Iasi, Ro. Dark amber colour, with medium white head. Tropical fruit, a hint of IPA, sweet and a tad malty. Drinkable. Very good.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Tropical fruits in aroma. Claudy. Dark amber in colour foam quickly dissappear. Nice bitterness in taste. General nice beer. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

5%ABV. Amber ale.

Poured out dark amber. 16ºSRM.

Nose is sweet with treacle, honey and molasses in the nose but without the sour tang. A very clean sweet aroma, like nectar. Hint of bitter pine sap aroma.

Mouthfeel is cough syrupy. Palate has an amber ales rounded fuller, nutty character. The back of the throat has that aroma-flavor of old leather which I associate with a nice amber. Hops are barely there.

Finish is clean and lightly beery.

- selten gesehene rot-braune Farbe
- ganz leichte Schaumbildung, welcher schnell zerfällt
- geruchlich eine zarte Malz-/Frucht- u. Hopfennote
- geschmacklich kommt noch eine leicht würzige Beigabe hinzu
- Kohlensäuredosierung ist sehr gut gelungen
- Minuspunkt ist, dass im Abgang das Bier dann doch etwas
 körperlos und dünn wirkt bzw. schmeckt
Fazit: Eine Spur zu dünn geratenes Ale
Aroma: fruity and hops. Amber orange color with minimal head. Middle carbonation.

Bottle, from Steamworks in Vancouver. Murky reddish-brown pour with a small light-beige head. Aroma is caramel, nutty and a little bready, some raisin, hints of citrus and tropical fruits - smells quite big for the ABV. Taste is caramel and a little nutty as well, some bread and fruit notes, lighter and less sweet than the nose. Finishes with slight citrus, dry and a little bitter, nicely balanced. Im rarely excited to try an amber ale, but for this I was - and it lived up. An outstanding example for the style.
0,33 bottle. Beer with beautiful amber-copper colour, relatively stable head. Notes of citrus. Malt and caramel in the finish.
Arômes de houblon, robe rousse. En bouche le côté agrume du houblon ressort plus fortement que le caramel du style red ale. Pas mal.

Aroma: citrus, a bit caramel.
Appearance: copper brown color with small head.
Taste: mild malt and caramel, middle carbonation.
Palate: malt in the finish.
A crisp, refreshing taste of caramel and hops. Notes of citrus dominate, has a slight wooden aftertaste of pines. Easy to drink, very pleasant.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 Dezent englischlastiger Smell. Ein an Beeren & Cognac erinnernder Duft. Der Trunk trocken, schlank und auch hier kommt Wein b.z.w. Alkoholaromatik ins Spiel. Säuerlich malzig von hinten. Der Nachhall dann leider viel zu kurz. Zwar gentlemanlike unaufdringlich, aber eben überhaupt nicht zwingend. 0,25 vom Hahn in der BREWDOG BAR Barcelona. Aus der Flasche riecht es ein wenig kräftiger, hauptsächlich hoppy. Weiterhin ist aber alles andere nicht gerade spannend.

Strong aroma of apples and cherries. Even as you are about to sip, the you are immediately struck by the aroma. The flavor is very different. Figs, prunes, caramel and pine. 

Its probably fantastic... I am just so happy with the aroma, I find the actual flavor disappointing.

Aroma : pine, berry light toffee 
Appearance: Deep amber color thin head which does not last long
Taste : light toffe caramel light citrus sweetness
Palate : Light body
From British Brewdog

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Easily drunk. Nice looker. Red hue and rocky head. Tbh a bit musky on the nose but very nice in mouth. Citrus notes are in there before bitternes. Definitely red berries too. Sour ending

Deep amber colour, thin but pretty dense off-white head, some lacing. Smell shows caramel and red fruits/stone fruit among a vivid but not at all aggressive resinous feel. Taste has sweet entrypoint with a caramel malts foundation, then resinous and citric notes in the bitter finish. Some notes of stone fruit can be detected as well. Overall in good balance. Light to medium body, low to average crispness, decently smooth. Interesting aroma profile, but not impressive in terms of mouthfeel and overall feeling.

Piwo lekko metne w kolorze ciemny bursztyn z niezbyt obfita biala piana ktora bardzo szybko sie redukuje. W aromacie czuc karmel, owoce tropikalne, troche kwiatow i nuty lesne. Naprawde sie dzieje. W smaku raczej wytrawne, czuc chmiele i pomarancze. Goryczka raczej słaba troche grejpfrutowa z wysyceniem na srednim poziomie. Bardzo gladkie i naprawde dobrze ulozone. Sporo ciala i dosc orzezwiajace jak na swoj styl. Polecam!

Pours a dark amber reddish colour with a foamy white head. The smell is sweet and malty. The taste is sweet and malty upfront finishing bitter. The herbal side of hops are definitely the foreground. Lingering taste of thin caramel malt, firm fruity character backed up by barley sugar. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. A very good representation of the style. Very tasty.

330 ml bottle. Dark red/brown color, small beige head, soft carbonation. Toffee and hints of honey in the nose, taste is sweetish, caramel, nice mouthfeel. Medium bitterness in the aftertaste. A good one!

Amber with a small white head. Lively carbonation. Aroma of malt, pine and citrus. Taste sweet and a bit sour. Medium bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kirkas selvästi punaiseen päin kallellaan oleva punertavanruskea olut kohtalaisella, hieman rusehtavalla vaahdolla. Tuoksu jopa kermainen, samalla kertaa pihkaisen havuinen, hieman hedelmäinen sekä karamellinen. Maku on aika erikoinen sekoitus mäntystä havuisuutta ja toisaalta humalan mukanaan tuomaa luumuista hedelmäisyyttä sekä pientä savuisuutta. Karpaloa ja muuta marjaisuutta havaittavissa varsinkin loppupuolella ja jälkimaussa. Hieman ohut suutuntuma. Tuntuu että tähän on yritetty ympätä vähän turhan paljon kaikkea.

0,33 bottle.
Appearance: Pours a deep amber colour with thin, soapy off-white head which does not last long.
Aroma: Notes of pine, resin, blackberry, stone fruit, red berry, elderflower, light toffee, caramel and bready malt.
Taste: Light toffee and caramel sweetness with some light citrus bitterness when swallow. Overall, the taste is not as pronounce as the aroma.
Palate: The body is too light for an amber ale. The texture is also too thinned watery. A little bit over-carbonated in my opinion. Mild stone fruit, pine and citrus aftertaste, but not long-lasting
Overall: It is a decent and easy-going session amber ale. However, I was expecting more complexity in its taste and palate , which are a bit weak. But this may probably due to the freshness of the bottle. I was hoping to have more depth from Brewdog, but maybe a session amber is just what they want to brew. I will give it another chance in the future though.
Bottle - clear red-bronze color, stable head - Taste is very malty, old red berries. A bit sour. Slightly bitter finish. I expected it to be better.

Yeah, drinkable. Grapefruit and hops. Long aftertaste. Bit too carbonated and not that smooth, but alright

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark red. Malty aroma with some light pine and grapefruit. Malty taste with some light hop bitterness. Yep its decent as usual from brewdog.
Schiuma pannosa, odore complesso di erba, fieno, pompelmo, a naso e in bocca domina la lunga lista di luppoli. Beverina, agrumata, buon amaro finale che ripulisce la bocca ma la lascia acquosa.
Bottle brougt in scotland. Dark amer colour small head disappears fast. Nose is hoppy fruity. Taste is low bitterness low sweetness. Medium carbonation. Nice red overall.
A really pleasant session ale. Has a malty, caramel, cereal and biscuit taste.

From Brewdog Brussels >> Bière ambrée fort aromatique au nez avec une belle longueur caramélisée en bouche. Fort maltée au palais, torréfiée livrant des arômes biscuitées avec un arrière goût vague de chocolat à la noisettes grillée, en même temps sirupeuse pesante en caramel, voire un peu écurante. Bien amère sur des notes argileuses aromatiques fleuries et dagrumes avec une très belle longueur.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 330ml bitter, chilled and poured at home. Cloudy amber red with minimal off white head. Malty, circus nose with tropical fruits and some caramel. Lovely hoppy, bitter sweet taste; fine carbonation; freshness on the palate with great citrus punch possibly lemon and orange with slight caramel finish. Superb. Much tastier than many of its red/amber ale contemporaries. 
Footnote - Ive tried Saint on tap at BD Liverpool, Birmingham and Clerkenwell and its rather dull, missing the zingy freshness which makes the bottled version stand out.
This is probably my favorite hoppy beer. A perfect blend of hops and citrus in this one.

330ml bottle with a BB of 25/3/16

Didnt get any oxidized character in the nose though.

Poured red-brown with a good head.

The initial bitterness quickly disappears - not much body and a bit thin on the palate.

Also maybe a touch sour but this is prob due to the age of the bottle.

Served in a tulip from a 330ml bottle. Pours clear ruby-red with a thin off-white head. Aroma is citrus hops, caramel and some malts. Taste is very similar to the nose - citrus hop and caramel, subtle bitter short-lived aftertaste. Slightly watery body with medium carbonation. Quite a simple hoppy brew, nice and refreshing!
En meget sød øl der har en en del underlig syrlighed i slutningen af øllen. Ellers god.
Surprisingly simple beer. Refreshing clear and some aroma but no deepness here! I was a bit disappointed but thats my problem!

Dark transparent red with a little white head. Nice to look at. Intensive aroma of flowers and fruits. Light body. Starts moderatly sweet and gets overwhelmed by a very pleasant bitterness towards the end. Incredible drinkable. One of the beers that stands up to the hype that surrounds them.

Aroma: elderberry, citrus, floral, grass, tropical fruits, some caramel. As always the aroma of this beer is amazing.
Appearance: amber, slightly hazy, white head, ok retention. 
Taste: similar to aroma but with more malt presence that takes on caramel, gentle bread. light sweetness, light-medium bitterness.
light body, slick feel, slightly oily feel, average carbonation. Finish is long and smooth. 
Overall: Hard to beat after a few years of drinking all sorts of beer. Nicely balanced, drinkable, great aroma, taste. This one started it all for me. Thanks Brewdog

Pours clear red with an off white head. Love the aroma, slightly malty, pine and grapefruit. Perfect balance of malty sweetness, bitterness. Hoppy taste with blood orange taste. Low carbonation. Really like this beer and would happily have more!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Teljesen átlátszatlan, mélyvörös színű. Habja kicsi, és az is gyorsan eltűnik. Illata nagyon hasonlít a Dead Pony-ra, kifejezetten cideres. Rögtön a keserűssége vág mellbe, kortyérzete malátásan, lecsengése pörkölt jelleggel, pici citromos mellékzöngével. Utóíze stout-os, hosszan tartó. Közepesen telt érzetű. Némileg módosított, kicsit erősebbre készített Dead Pony, de az jobban ízlett.
Clear amber color with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, pine, hops and grapefruits. Taste is malty sweet with good amount of hops. Leaves quite thin. Herbs and citrus in aftertaste. Decent
Excelente red ale, fresca y aromática para degustar con algo picoso explotan sabores en el paladar

330 ml bottel. Pours red-brown with an off-white head. Aroma of light malt (bread) and moderate hops (grapefruit). Light to medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Starts moderately sweet and bitter with an surprising flavor of mild coffee and hints of fruit acids. Not overly complex.
From bottle. Pours clear brown-red. Nose of sweet malts, pine resin, roses. Brown sugar, coffee cake, medium body, bitter and dry on the palate.

Tap at brewdog
Big disappointment. Pours bright copper hue with a small soapy white head and sparse lacing. Nose is musty sweet and pretty boring. Seems old. Flavors are caramel sweetness lite hops. Sort of dull.
Caramel, clove and weed. Clear amber. Not too strong bitterness, the aftertaste is really pleasant. Ideal carbonation, could be a bit thicker though. Very enjoyable.

Barwa ciemnobursztynowa, trochę rubinowa, piwo jest mętne. Piana drobna, niezbyt obfita, ładnie zdobi szkło. Intensywny aromat owoców tropikalnych, karmelu, cytrusów. W smaku jest dość wytrawne, lekkie, orzeźwiające. Oprócz karmelu i cytrusów, są również nuty leśne, sosnowe. Goryczka średnia, trochę zalegająca.
Amber with thick and lasting head. Strong aroma, rose, candy. Sweet, hops develop, smoky in the finish. Very drinkable and refreshing, lasting aftertaste.

Bottle from Drinks of the World Zurich. Lots and lots of grassy hops aroma. Spring-like. A little more malts than a pale ale making this a tad amber, but really not so much different. Sweet, medium body, good carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Five AM Saint by BrewDog at BrewDog WarszawaBardzo fajnie poukladany, i z chmielowej i ze slodowej strony, disc slodkawy, choc zarazem chcialoby sie wiecej mocniej...Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Dark red light-bodied ale, with a fruity and lightly malty aroma. Mild malt flavour with a bit of spicy hops, and a somewhat dry and lightly bitter taste. Overall, this beer is just too mild and not very tasty. Nothing really tickles my tastebuds.
Pours a nice hazy orange. Aromas of caramel, hint of fruit and hops. Nice creamy malt taste with a nice hop bitterness.
A very drinkable take on the hoppy but not crazy hoppy amber style. I like it and would happily down several.

Appearance- clear ruby chestnut with light brown medium foam, Aromas- strong hops, goji berries, banana/tropical flavours, and caramel, Palate: light in the mouth, almost foamy with medium body, taste: strong but refreshing hops with a orange pip bitter taste. Overall: a good session ruby ale, would have again.

Clear nice deep amber color with medium tan foam. Aromas initialy of fruity hops, pineapple, sweet grass, sweet light malt and hint of carmel. Palate, medium/lightish body with thin light texture and high carbonation leaving nice grapefruit hoppy finish. Taste is sweet of hops, grapefruits, pinapple and hit of lemon. Overall, nice refreshing light abmer ale, very fruity and fun. Give it a try!

330ml bottle from Asda. Pours amber-red with a small off white head. Aroma is very hoppy, hints of pine, pink grapefruit, cut grass, quite sharp. Flavor is similar, but more balanced, a bit bitter and a bit sweet.

Tap @BrewDog Bristol.
Medium off-white head, amber/red colour, clear, nice lacing. Strong hoppy aroma, grapefruit, lemon, pine. Very bitter taste, long finish, medium body. Very nice!
01/05/06 330 bottle from Tesco. a lovely red ale. very smooth with hints of fruit/berries, hops. a very nice tasting balanced beer.
Pleasing aroma of peaches. Fairly hoppy. Good but too malty. A bit disappointing.

330ml bottle: Pours a cloudy deep copper with no real head to note. Caramel, toasty and fruity on the nose. Medium bitterness, low carbonation, medium body that finished reasonably sweet. Slight honey on the taste with a good malt backbone. A decent red ale.
Very nice, light beer with hint of red fruits. Not too bitter, not too sweet - just perfect for me.

330ml bottle from Sainsburys. Pours orange-reddy brown, clear with pale orange head. Aroma amazingly complex with pine, resin, apple, tropical fruits, iron, caramel and spices. Hops and malts both distinctive and strong. Overall a very tasty but well balanced beer.

Pours clear red with medium golden head. Aroma is fruity, apple, some caramel, brass oxide, sweet notes, floral, tropical fruits, citrus. Taste is also very fruity, tropical fruits and citrus, light caramel, bitterness, metal. Very nice beer!

Aus der Flasche vom Händler des Vertrauens. Das versprochene Bitter sweet Chaos stellte sich genau auch in dieser Reihenfolge ein. Interessant damit in der Machart und Wirkung, aber kein "Top-10"-Bier.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 330ml bottle. Clear dark amber colour with a small beige head. Aroma is malty, spicy hops, pine, citrus. Taste is malty, caramel, fruity spicy hops, pine. Bittersweet but more on the bitter side, especially in the finish.
Draft at Brew Dog Södermalm, Stockholm. A bit on the soapy side for my taste, could do with more malt and less intrusive hops.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 0.33l bottle from coop in basel, 3.20 fr.
pours an almost clear amber with a steady off-white head and a nice lacing. aroma of tropical fruity hops. flavour of spruce, caraway, tangerine. dry and medium bitter. nice.

33 cl bottle. Red color, slighly hazed, thin but compact offwhite head, persistent, smell of american hops. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, resin, light soapy with burnt malts and wood, hints of ginger and roots maybe. Taste quite bitter. Light body, well carbonated, dry finish. Feels raw.
Bottled. Nice copper color, slightly carbonated. aroma: notes of grapefruity hops let the bitterness appear less pronounced although very bitter finish. Like you bite in an unripe grapefruit
Tap at BrewDog Camden. Seemed pretty average amber to me -- good with my burger, but I probably wouldnt choose it to drink by itself. lively.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2016 Ambrata con riflessi caramello, limpida, schiuma ocra non molto persistente.
Aroma citrico, floreale, leggermente resinosa, biscottata, durian leggero, tè e caramello, in secondo piano note di ananas e mango.
Al palato non si discosta molto dalle note olfattive, biscottata, leggera crosta di pane, finale vagamente tostato dove prevalgono comunque note di tè ed erbaceo miste a leggero citrico, leggerissimo cacao finale.
Corpo medio-leggero, non troppo carbonata rispetto agli standard, texture watery.
Bottle on the way home from PNE v QPR. Aroma is piney, caramel, citrus, malty. Taste is piney, malty, caramel, slight biscuit, dry finish.

Aroma of yeast, leather and malt. Pours a clear bright red brown. Tan head disipated quickly. Malty tastes with undertones of sweet. Pretty subtle and well made. Oily mouthfeel with low carbonation and a soft sour finish. Seems to hold back the hops until the very end. Very drinkable.
Clear reddish/brown pour. Creamy, off white head. Lots of caramel malt and spicy hops in the nose. Flavor is creamy and hoppy. Nice spicy and citrus hops. Really a well done beer. Nice stuff.
Bottle @ the guild... small to no head... clear dark orange to brown colour... smell roasted malts some herbs and sweetness. Taste has a bitter roasted malts thin body...
Amber pour with thin white head. Robust and interesting. Roasted malts and fruity with a great bitter finish. A wonderful beer!

Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi amberkleurig bier. Aroma is kruidig en hoppig. De smaak is kruidig en hoppig, licht bitter, wat zoetig en toch fris. Ik vind hem iets te dun van body, had wat voller kunnen zijn gezien de geur die best wel aanwezig was na het uitschenken. Maar al met al een lekkere amber ale.

Pours amber with a medium white head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt, some fruits, pine, peach, caramel, hops. Light bitter finish.
Excellent. Lovely. Delecate. Balanced. Very simple but rich after work beer.

Butelka 330ml. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, rubinowe przeswity. Piwo klarowne, piana nietrwala, slabo zdobi szklo. Aromat karmelowy, slodowy, nuty owocowe. Smak: karmel, lekkie nuty lasu, lekkie cytrusy, owocowy. Goryczka srednia, nie pozostajaca na jezyku. Dobry, lekki, latwopijalny amber ale.

Bottle. Smell fruity. Taste of some citrus and very little bitter. Medium to full bodied. Mix feeling about this however this is my first red ale, so maybe I dont know wat to expect from it.

Somehow refreshing..

Hmm maybe 3.5?
330ml bottle. Hoppy, fruity, caramel. Quite sweet, and very refreshing. Might be a good beer for a warm summers day.

This is a very attractive beer with a ruby red hue and a thick, creamy, white head. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, bread, and light spices (caraway and white pepper). Has a complex flavor with light bitterness and fruity notes, some butterscotch, pine, citrus, lively on the tongue and goes down easy. Lots of character and way better than your average red ale. Recommended.

Une ptite red dominée par les malts, notamment avec des notes de caramel. Les houblons se font assez discrets avec une amertume pas trop violente, à la différence de la plupart des autres bières de Brewdog. Bizarrement je la trouve assez proche de la Hardcore IPA en terme de goûts, bien quelle soit plus légère.

Bouteille de 33cl. Belle couleur ambrée avec un col de mousse de couleur crème - blanche. Amertume contenue mais excellentes saveurs des houblons aromatiques utilisés : pas mal d'agrumes sont reconnaissables. L'apport du malt caramel apporte sa petite touche également. Bière qui se déguste sans la moindre peine.
Amber coloured beer with off-white head. Hoppy aroma, citrus and a little pine. Taste is malty, caramel and a little menthol.

330ml bottle from alko. Small white head, deep red or ruby colour. Aroma has mostly hops and fruitiness, but there is some caramel notes from the malts too. Light to medium bitterness and sweetness. NICE!!!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 Thick creamy head, dark bronze color. Floral hops in the aroma along with some mead. Medium body with almost no taste. Cannot really nail palate and taste down. Some bitter/tart aftertaste notes. Empty for me. 0.33 bottle with expiry date in 9 months
Una red muy bien hecha y con un sabor muy original marcando los frutos rojos, sin duda poca gente podrá decir que no le gusta esta cervecita.

Amber with a small beige head. Aroma is lots of caramel and citric/yellow fruits (apricot, peaches, passion fruit, grapefruit), some bread too. Taste is caramel, lemongrass, honey, oranges, grapefruit. Bitter aftertaste.

Pours copper brown with medium white head and good lacing and soft carbonation.

Aroma is restrained considering what theyve chucked at this. Fruity with tangerine, caramel, orange, lime. Taste is bitter, sweet, earthy, a hint of sourness with a medium slightly metallic finish. Quite thin.

Improved when it warmed up, but a little disappointed with this one. Brewdog - stop over-hyping your beers!
330ml bottle. Hoppy, fruity, caramel. Quite sweet, and very refreshing. Might be a good beer for a warm summers day.
On tap. Lighter clear brown. Sweet hoppy caramel aroma. Malty and fruity hop taste. Honey sweetness matched with bran, rye, toast. Really tasty and smooth.

Från vissa håll förväntar man sig starkare leverans än från andra. För vissa kan förväntningarna vara ett ok, andra levererar på högsta nivå när pressen är som störst. Den här drycken kommer inte Brew dog att åminnas för. Aromen är traditionell red ale-karamelliserad, utseendet är regelmässigt djuprött men smaken är en besvikelse. "Fadd" är ordet som sammanfattar den slutliga upplevelsen. Ett bedrövligt resultat för ett så meriterat bryggeri.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 On tap. Dark amber/scarlet colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Red berries, yeast, basement, wine. Very interesting. Taste: medium bitter start but doesnt turns into ipa like bitterness. Very hoppy but well balanced. Light carbonation, medium body. Very pleasent bitter finish but a bit dry. Very good one.
330 ml bottle. Hazy red semidark colour. Aroma of caramel, herbs. Taste of berries, tropical fruits, caramel, light bitter aftertaste. Good drinkable beer.

330ml bottle from alko. Small white head, deep red or ruby colour. Aroma has mostly hops and fruitiness, but there is some caramel notes from the malts too. Light to medium bitterness and sweetness. Bit watery, but solid brew nonetheless.
Caramel, grass, a bit of nuts, nicely balanced, just not as intense as I have hoped after reading the ingredients. Overall good idea but maybe stronger execution could be in order.

Well, quite interesting and easy drinkable refreshing fruity, light hoppy brew. A bit too watery, almost like super watery barley wine. But overall I liked this brew, as I said, very good for summer, drinking at the beach.

Bottle. Clear red orange beer. Aroma of berries and grassy hops. Taste has bready malts with spicy flavours. Medium-bodied. Smooth finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear sepia with a fairly thick and rather persistent light tan head. Aroma presents notes of woody hops, toasted malt, and a snip of caramel. Woody hops dominate the flavor, but share the stage with malt, resin and caramel tones for a very drinkable ale. Body is firm, though fizz is not overly strong; finish has hay and hoppy notes. Early in the morning or late at night, a worthy drink.

Aroma is toffee / caramel, pours red brown. 
Nice medium mouthfeel, average carbonation. 
Taste is sweet fruity toffee but with subtle bitter notes. 
Overall pretty good!
Fresh hoppy aroma with notes of malt and herbs. Ruby color and a bit hazy liquid. Fine head. Medium-high bitterness and medium sweetness for the style. Soft carbonation, medium-full body.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur ambrée foncée, mousse assez faible, peu de tenue. Une palette aromatique subtile : caramel, du fruit, quelque chose de boisé ou résineux. Carbonnation assez faible. Trouvée à la braserie Delneste - Froidmont.
0,33l Flasche. Braune leicht trübe Farbe mit beigem Schaum. Angenehm bitterer Antrunk. Es duftet nach Malz, Kräuter, Nüssen, Muskat und Marone. Runder Geschmack.

Shared bottle at my sisters. Pours dark reddish amber with off-white head. Aroma of caramel, pine needles, raspberries, coffee; some spicy-peppery notes. Tastes bitter, thin bodied. Dry mouth feel, some astringency.
33cl bottle from Chez Alain, Rennes. Amber with a thin head. Tropical fruits, caramel, nuts, hops. Dry with a good hoppy bitter kick. Medium bodied. Fresh and tasty.

Pours a chestnut red, very clear, with one-finger coarse white head that is extremely persistent. Aroma is mango, ripe nectarines, resin, grass, basically Robinsons tropical fruit juice drink with hints of mint or menthol. Impressive. In comparison the taste seems slightly thin. Finish is neither sweet nor dry but somehow neutral. A bit disappointing, even for a low gravity beer. Many boring brown beers have more malt action going on in the back than this. Still a very good session beer though.
sour and has a dense smell. Has a bronze appearance and gives you a differet feeling

Bottle from Brewdog online. Red amber colour with off-white head. Well balanced in the aroma and taste, pine, citrus, tropical fruit, malts, caramel. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Very nice.
33 cl Bottle at Huis place. Amber with big white head. Light, sweet, hoppy nice beer! Backlog from 2014/11/01.

330ml Bottle.

Pours reddish brown with a very thin, bubbly, light tan head. The aroma is largely dry with pine, orange and mango tones. The flavour has loads of piney hop, a little resin and a candied, sugary-sweetness to the finish. Okay but a little disappointing from BrewDog.

Bottle. Interesting citrus and caramel aroma. Pours dark red in colour with a frothy off-white head and good carbonation. Well hopped with lemon citrus flavours together with some biscuit and toffee notes. Well balanced. Medium bodied with some sweetness in the finish. Excellent red ale.
Plutôt mince et presque sans mousse... La couleur est superbe mais le reste est moyen selon mes goûts. Je goûte du caramel et des prunes. Lamalgame des divers houblons est vraiment très bien fait.

Pours a very dark ruby red/copper color with mahogany edges and a one finger, pillowy off-white head that slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Very good retention with streaks if soapy lacing left behind. 

Earthy, resinous hop aroma with subtle vinous fruit and a strong dark malt presence. Floral with grassy pine needle and spruce tip followed by prominent caramel malt, toffee, biscuit and subtle dark fruit.

Medium body with dry, earthy hop bitterness up front that lingers over the sweet malt backbone into a dry finish. Aggressively hopped with spicy pine needle, soil-y grass and sticky, resinous oils followed by a very strong malt backbone. Slightly toasty with lots of caramel sweetness, toffee, hazelnut and cocoa. Complex and well balanced with lots of flavor. Its kind of heavy so I dont think I could drink many of them in one sitting but they managed to pack a lot of flavor into a 5% "session" beer. Ill most likely be picking up more single bottles of this again, especially in the colder winter months.
Trüb braune Farbe schöner Schaum, Geruch fruchtig mit trockenfrüchten, kräftiger Geschmack würzig fruchtig mit ordentlich herbem Abgang

Unfortunately, my experience with this beer has not been the same as that of most people.
Red amber, pale tan head. Very pungent aroma, with fennel, algae, resin and slightly ammonia-like... not especially appetising. The flavours are just a continuation of this although in a more balanced way, with hops coming in too, but the pungent lye-like background was not expected.
Bottle. This is the best red ale I have ever had hands down. The rich malts and subtle hopping are incredible.

Dark amber with reddish hue. Small tan head which quickly disappear. Aroma is highlight of this beer therefore the high rating. Other than that a bit of one trick pony. Heavy floral notes with grapes, gooseberries, finishing with pine resin and earthy spicyness. Palate watery, carbonation medium. taste of grapefruit and pine resin, finishing with very subtle caramel body and bergamot. No disappointment with this one and my favourite from the common brewdogs.
At Sal Gorda. With chaps. My favourite Brewdog brew so far. Tasty and very drinkable.

Rødbrun og ufiltreret skotsk Amber Ale med mindre offwhite skumtop på 1-2 cm, som svinder til kant og overflade. 
Skøn aroma af appelsin, humlenuancer af citrus og harpiks samt maltnuancer af korn. 
Bitter domineret smag, og første indtryk er en ganske tynd konsistens. Men øllet vokser med opgaven og opleves fyldigere. Balanceret med mindre sødme, men slet ikke toneangivende. 
Kroppen er let, og karboneringen på et middel niveau. Tynd til olieret konsistens. Ganske tør og bitter afslutning. 
Let drikkelig Ale i den bitre ende af smagsspectret. Dejlig meget smag sammenholdt med indholdet af ABV.

pours red with tan head. strong hop aromas which is the first sign that this aint your grandmas typical red ale. body is medium to heavy. strong grassy hops on the tongue that stays in the finish. Could this actually be a red bitter? In any case, a solid offering.

Taste starts with mild berry and citrus notes and resolves into a mild hoppy bitterness. This all rides over a powerful grainy malt backbone. The backend is a meld of hops and malt. Fruit and hops are skewed to the front, leaving the beer a bit unbalanced. Still, a unique and very drinkable red ale. I would drink this again.

Âmbar avermelhada, espuma irregular e inconsistente, ao servir varias bolhas nas paredes do copo, que somem com o tempo. Aroma intenso de lúpulos, adocicada, caramelo, muito atraente. Com o aumento da temperatura e agitação do copo exalou leves tons metálicos, vegetais cozidos, menos agradáveis que o inicial. Paladar bastante refrescante, amargor médio e dulçor leve muito bem equilibrados. Corpo leve, carbonação média. Aftertaste segue as notas do paladar inicial, tendendo mais para o amargor, persistência média, ao final uma sensação de agua na boca, suco de lúpulo. Uma ótima cerveja para tomar um dias quentes, de preferência em um churrasco.

One very good Amber Ale. It has a very nice light taste and a hoppy and malty aroma. Very lively.
Bottle 33cl from le Barboteur, Schaerbeek. I was expecting more from this one, it lacks a bit of everything. Not bad for a red ale though.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tropical and sort of a Rummy fruit. I'm not normally a red beer fan but this is a great alternative to someone that wants great full flavor without being hoppy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours clear amber with beige head. Aroma is malty, toasty subtle fruits, subtle hops. Taste is malty, slight toast and subtle fruity hops. Kind of bready. Light body, slight bitter with some dry toasty malts in finish. NOT MUCH CHAOS!
Reddish amber, medium sized off white head. Aroma is pretty malty, pretty hoppy, slight caramel, slight berry fuityness.. Taste is malty, but with a bitter finish. Average body, average carbonation.

Genuine russet red. Thin head. Smells sharp and fruity. Really sweet caramel malt cut through but a light acidity and some hops. Some marzipan and cherry like a Dr Pepper. Getting some cocoa and cut grass. Loads going on with this and its good for the style...but I just dont like it that much.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy red amber colour with small beige head. Average carbonation. Aroma of fruit, citrus with hint of caramel. Taste is fruity, citrusy, medium bitter with some sour notes. Overal excellent, refreshing red ale.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 Pourtant pas fan des bières amères de ce genre, celle-ci m?a vraiment surpris.Au nez, un arôme de litchee est incroyablement présent avec des arrières notes de fruits rouges.En bouche, l?amertume attaque de suite et choque totalement par rapport au nez. Le litchee revient pour laisser en toute fin de bouche un arôme caféiné qui sort d?on ne sait où ! Une bière très surprenante et intéressante. Finalement sucrée et plutôt ronde étant donné son houblonnage. Beaucoup de fruits tropicaux avec fort goût de mangue ! Vraiment superbe.
EDIT : regoûtée, ont-ils changé la recette ? Nez insipide, très aqueuse, aucun corps, peu de goût... Agréable mais sans intérêt.
REPONSE : Oui ! Jai regoûté lancienne version, avant quils ne changent les étiquettes (et apparemment la recette). Bien plus présenté, houblonnée et maltée. Rien à voir.
Pours dark amber. Aroma is mostly honey, with a hint of dandelion. Taste is watery and bittersweet. Finish isnt long.

Amber ale, présentée par son brasseur comme une « hoppy red ale », dun niveau abv de 5 % .
5 malts et 6 houblons dans la composition !!!
Couleur entre roux tendre et ambre moyen, avec un tout léger voile.
Bulles fines en colonne unique qui serpente.
Mousse beige claire, qui nappe à 1 mm, avec plus de bulles que de savon, pardon texture.
Arômes de cassonade, sirop de Liège, miel de tournesol, poires cuites.
1ère bouche au curieux mélange de bonbon à lanis et cassonade gamin.
Arrière-bouche sans aucun relief mémorable.
2ème comme une pale ale avec des copeaux de bois.
Arrière-bouche bizarre et très courte.
3ème sur malt grillé, houblon de 1er niveau ( tout un paradoxe quand on voit la liste !!), quelques épices (qui viennent probablement des mêmes houblons ...). Manque dharmonie.
Arrière-bouche irrégulière, sans complexité (encore un fameux paradoxe).
Longueur mieux que les 1ères bouches, plus intégrée, plus équilibrée.
Jambes peu marquées.
Levure douce, mais assez faible.
Alcool correct pour le style, bien progressif.
Finale qui descend à nouveau, sans aucunement nous surprendre...
CONCLUSION : une telle débauche dingrédients pour un résultat aussi moyen .
Il y a vraiment des bières « paradox...ales » : celle-ci en est une 
Heureusement, le brasseur en a dautres qui nous plaisent !!!

Appearance: pours with a medium beige head, the beer is a very hazy bronze color that isn't transparent
Aroma: strong caramel malt, spicy rye perhaps hard to pick up much else
Taste: lightly toasted caramel malt sweetness with that gentle Scottish taste to it, has a very slight bitterness on the finish, very faint grain
Palate: has a light mouthfeel, minimal caramel and bitter aftertaste, lively carbonation 
Overall: not a bad beer, has that Scottish feel to it throughout, sessionable

Tried in bottle. Colour is slightly hazy red amber. Aroma is red fruit, caramel and citrus. Taste is caramel and citrus, well balanced hops and malts. Slight bitter finish.

Cor rubi, brilhante. Espuma boa, persistente e encantadora pelas rendas formadas no copo. Aroma de grãos e caramelo. No paladar forte herbal do lúpulo e retrogosto marcante e amargo. Única e espetacular!!!
Deep red with white head... malty, fruity, dry... Nice red ale, but maybe lacking a bit of body. Decent enough though.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Tumbler. Supplier: Redland Stores (Bristol). Mild fruitiness.
Light roasted aroma, coffee. Appear red/Brown. With a small White head. Taste medium / light bitter. Soft carbonation lightbodied but creamy

Bottle. Ruby clear with small white head. Aroma of red fruits, citrusy, caramel. Taste is medium bitter with some sour notes, all good, citrusy, fruity, fresh. Light bitter finish. Nice and fresh red ale.

Excelente red Ale. Tem um aroma excelente por parecer ter mais lupulo. É como se fosse uma Ipa red ale. Vale muito tomar novamente

Pour a clear shinny copper/ red color with an offwhite head. Aroma is caramels and some citrus. Same clean caramel and citrus on the flavor. Medium to light palate, ok and balanced but rather unidimensional.
Onesta ma niente fi speciale. Ricorda la hardcore ipa,con meno impatto. Caramello e spremuta di luppoli in bocca, liscia e scorrevole con carbonatazione meDia. Buona birra ma niente di straordinario

Pours a cloudy copper color without much head, minimal carbination. Aroma of malt and fruit, with hints strawberry. Taste of malt, fruit, hops and strawberry. Surprisingly dry feel with a clean finish.

Poured from a bottle. Murky copper color, large amounts of sediment, small white head. Tangy fruit and strawberry aroma. Medium body with a strong malt flavor with nice hops accents and medium finish.

good amber ale with fruity aroma, a clear orange appearance, medium bitter and medium palate

0,33 bottle. Pours copper color with thin white head. Tropical fruits, citrus, fruit bubble gum aroma. Expected more from the taste after nice aroma. Grapefruit taste with medium bitterness with Hoppy background. Creamy texture.

33cl bottle. Nice copper-red color with thin white head. Fantastic smell of oranges and grapefruit. Unfortunately taste doesnt follow. Body is thin and bitterness takes over pretty quickly. Nice bitterish and citrusy aftertaste.
Bottle. Amber color with a white head. Hoppy crispy and fresh amber ale. Caramel notes and nnice malt amount. Not a fan of this one, but is ok.
Bottle, bb 9.01.16. Copper, clear beer with whitish head, nice lacing. Resin and fruity notes of hops and caramel notes of malts. Low to medium bitterness, medium bodied. Very enjoyable!

Keg at Brewdog Manchester. A clear deep ruby copper colour with a thin white head. Aroma of pineapple, red berries, apple, pine and caramel. Taste of red berries, apple, grapefruit, sweet caramel, earthy bitterness and a little coffee. Light bodied, moderate carbonation and a watery texture. A pleasant hop bitterness in the finish. A flavourful, hoppy, easy drinking beer. Little thin but still decent.

Bottle. Big off-white head with a very good retention. Clear reddish brown colour. Aroma is rich and intense, hoppy floral with some toasted malts notes and fruity hints. Flavours are citrus, some malty caramel notes and fruity bitter finish. Creamy full body with high carbonation. A great hoppy beer!

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 10B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 166. AROMA: moderate hop aromas of a floral and piny nature, balanced with a sweet and caramelized malt background. APPEARANCE: reddish color with orange highlights and very clear. thin beige head with below average retention. TASTE: slight sweet flavour with floral and piny notes. medium-low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. PALATE: medium-low body with average carbonation. OVERALL: a very enjoyable amber ale.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Bottle from Tesco. Clear amber. Nose is citrus, lots of hops and dry hops, caramel. Taste is caramel maltiness, pine, hops, resin. Good amber ale with loads of hops, especially dry ones.
Aroma: caramel, roasty, honey. Appearance: red hazy liquid with frothy head. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish,
Aroma has a hint of floral, spruce and herbs. Nice golden color, beer is clear with medium bitterness. Palate is full body, slick feel, fizzy, long finish. Overall very enjoyable red ale.
Pours redish, slightly brown, with medium head. Smell is very aromatic, taste is quite good, but lacks the finish, you would expect from the smell. A very nice beer.

Ambrée foncée, petite carbonisation, nez houblon fruité, amertume en bouche, arôme caramel, final léger malt torréfié, petite pointe sèche, alcool léger. Arômes un peu perdus en longueur. Bouteille 33cl achetée chez Intercaves, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 18/03/2015.

This ale is an amber ale brewed with 5 malts at 5% ABV. Pours a copper colour with light head but average carbonation. Aroma is notable citrus with a bit grassiness. Its taste is still citrus and finishes with bitterness likes orange peel and roastiness. Even though the beer was brewed with 5 types of malts, I think its still quite hoppy.

330 ml bottle. Light copper, perfectly clear, with a nice, fluffy and persistent yellowish head. Very pleasent aroma, quite hoppy (piney, resiny, earthy), lots of toffee/caramel notes, a hint of mint bubblegum, overall quite fruity and herbal. Yup, pretty much the same in the mouth, no surprises. Solid and lingering bitterness, quite watery but extremely drinkable, toffee and raspberries in the taste, very clean aftertaste. Average carbonation, light body, creamy texture. Not the perfect mouthfeel and nothing moundblowing, but its a pleasent beer, I enjoyed it.

Tomada el Cerveceria KRAKEN . Oviedo.

Cerveza ambarina. Roja, con espuma blanca. Ligeramente lupulada. Lo que le da ese toque amargo.

Cerveza de trago facil. Largo. Refrescante.
Muy recomendable.
Clear crimson, medium white head. Vague faded US hop aroma. Medium bitterness, some sweet notes, some roastiness. Finishes bitter. Okay, my sample seems faded, yet within date.

Mallty nose with some caramel and burnt sugar. Pours a medium-dark amber with a rocky head. Sweetish with a bitterness that comes from roasted malts rather than hops. Body is lighter than would be expected from the heavy malty nose. Slightly astringent finish. Good effort. Packs a lot of flavor and body into a 5% beer.

Une belle couleur ambrée,une mousse beige, cette bière dégage un arôme fruité, houblonné, voir le caramel, Au goût on ressent la levure, le houblon, une finale plus sèche, un bon équilibre. Bouteille 33 Cl V&B Langueux

Pours red/amber with a blast of hops on the nose. The head reduces fast with some lacing left on the side of the glass. Taste is hop forward with grapefruit mostly noticeable however the malt characteristics are fairly limited. The mouth feel is medium to thin and well carbonated. Overall this is a fine example of an amber ale and is instantly recognizable as a BrewDog beer.

Ruby copper colored, small off white head. Aroma is the best part, strong in the way of the hops; citrus, passionfruit, floral aroma. Taste is sweet malt, low toffee, citrus, fruit and flowery hoppiness. Medium but lingering bitterness. Light bodied and refreshing.
What an aroma. Lots of floral hops. The taste is a bit thin, but still a very good red ale.

Bardzo ładny, słodki, owocowy aromat. Dojrzałe owoce tropikalne, karmel, lekko ziołowe. Wprost bucha aromatem. Piana raczej niewielka, ale ładny lacing. Barwa rubinowa, jest opalizacja. W smaku niestety już nie tak dobrze jak w aromacie, jest owocowo, ale bardziej cytrusowo, a nawet... arbuzowo, wodniście, lekka słodycz goryczka raczej niska, wysycenie też. Jest bardzo pijalne, ale po takim aromacie wielki niedosyt w smaku. Warka do 9.04.2015r.
Magnifique couleur rouge pour cette bière aux gout herbacé, légèrement fumé. Se déguste plus quelle ne se boit. Un Regal.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass. Pours a hazy reddish amber, with a moderate beige head that quickly fades. Nose is very faint hops. Taste is all hops. Grossly over-hopped with no real flavor other than astringent bitterness. Disappointing.
Super Nase, tropisch, fruchtig, schön. Am Gaumen sehr trocken, leichte Malznoten. Gut gemacht, aber nicht ganz mein Stil. Okay.

Bottle from Soho Wine at home. Ruby copper pour with slightly tan head. Aroma is very malty but pierced by several hops notes - sharp, banana, pine, a bit plasticky. Taste is a bit empty and palate too thin/empty but flavors are nice. Some passion fruit hoppiness, pine, good amount of malts. Not great.
Fľaa z Metra za výpredajových 30 centov. Tmavia farba, parádna pena, nádherná, kvetinová vôňa. Bohatá chuť, vyia horkosť. Pre mňa pochúťka.
Great beer to drink In any time. With a long taest and very good look with a red style
On tap at Brewdog barcelona. Amber colour with whit head. Malt, grain, floral aroma. Sweet, bread, grain, hoppy, floral, bitter taste. Medium body.

Amber colour with a nice head.
Aroma is malty, caramel and nice floral and herbal hops, very present.
Taste is malty with a nice bitterness higher than usual but very tasteful.
Very nice beer only 5% ABV.

Wyglad bardzo w porzadku, kolor bursztynowy, dobra piana, delikatnie opalizuj?ce. W aromacie ca?kowicie dominuje karmel, tak ?e a? skojarzenia z mase?kiem przechodz? przez g?ow?. Goryczka umiarkowana, ale przyjemna, cytrusowa. W porz?dku.
Bottle from tesco. Lovely red appearance and good maintaining head. Aroma of fudge and plenty of hoppy taste.
0.5l on tap. Aroma as complicated as some relations these days. Roasted black bread, down to the burn. Hops come along and beer aftertaste leaves with that bitter. Interestingue
Aroma: caramel, roasty, honey. Appearance: red, hazy, frothy. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter,

Lidea di cinuqe malti e cinque luppoli un po mi spaventa. Mi ricorda la birra degli avanzi. In compenso questa birra è ben lontana dallo stereotipo. Un ale ammaliante. Il profumo di agrumi è netto al primo impatto. Nel bicchiere si presente ambrata con una bella schiuma. In bocca è piacevolmente bilanciata Lamaro si sente nel retrogusto.

Brown with an intensive reddish shine and a little hazy. Medium head with a nice lacing. 
Aroma of hopfs and resins, grapefruit, strawberry, vanilla, grapes and sweetish. Wow!
Medium-bitter taste, fruity, a bit phenolic at the end. Bitter finish, a bit medicinic, full and long lasting taste.

Ciemno miedziana barwa z genialna bialo-zolta piana ladnie oblepiajaca szklo. Aromat bardzo delikatny, slodowy, swiezy. W smaku lekkie, aksamitne, slodkawe, slodowe, goryczki jako takiej nie czulem. Dlugi przyjemny posmak slodkosci na koncu. Bardzo dobrze pijalne.

Robe ambre, belle mousse. Nez puissant sur le miel, le malt caramelisé, le pain dépices, sur un fond de houblon. Bouche à lattaque épicée et caramelisée, belle rondeur, rétro de miel, finale raffraîchissante sur une belle amertume. Une bière typée, longue et équilibrée.

Draught at Ginger Man. Hazy copper red with small beige creamy head, crisp malt aroma, light caramel taste, hint of citrus, thin body, medium carbonation, medium finish with alcohol aftertaste that surfaces rather late. Very interesting brew.
Aroma of sweet and nutty malt. Color of clear deep copper. Fruity and sharp initial flavor with lingering hop bitterness. So many nuanced favors. Really well executed
Arômes de malts caramélisés et de houblons. Le tout reviens en bouche suivis par des brèves effluves florales et une finale houblonnée.

Ungewöhnlich, wie alle Biere der Brewdog Company. Unglaublich intensiver Geruch nach Citrus Früchten. Ungewöhnlich kräftiger, intensiver Geschmack nach Citrus und weihnachtlichen Gewürzen. Ein tolles Bier wenn man experimentierfreudig ist!

Bottle. Tea-like browny color with cmall head. Very complex aroma of somewhat like beriies (cranberry?), citrus and something roasted. Taste is lightly sweet with bunch of hops bitternes in the finish. Tasty and interesting beer.

Bottle. Pours darkish copper with low creamy head. Aroma is like walking into a coniferous forest after rain, with hints of blueberries and scents of hops and malts. Palate is full and balanced. Taste is sweet and again hoppy, malty and foresty.
UPDATED: FEB 14, 2015 Surprisingly good taste. One of the best red ales i have tasted so far for sure.red, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter,
330ml into glass. Lemon/grapefruit nose. Hazy red ale with thin scummy head. Light easy drinking, short hop then malt finish. Every mouthful is preceded by a nose full of citric fruit. Excellent.
(bottle - 330 ml) Copper pour with a fluffy tan head. Light malts and a nice hop aroma. Flavor is a good strong hop presence with a smooth and lightly sweet malt backbone. Smooth and easy to drink.
How: Bottle Appearance: clear amber, white head. Aroma: fruits, nuts, spice, mild honey tones. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation.

Pours clear amber with a nice, thick, stable off-white head. Beautiful looks. Aroma is floral hoppy with some sugars, caramel and yellow fruits. Something woody as well. Cant get my fingers behind it. Yet, quite a good nose. Taste is mildly bitter with a nice sweet and hoppy kick. Clear note of the fruits, the sugars, some hidden roastiness as well. Finish is predominantly bitter and dry. Yet there is some sweetnees that overarches pretty well, giving it a nice, refreshing end. Medium bodied and on the thinner side of the palate, Could have been a bit thicker and fuller, yet for the quencher that this brew tends to be, it works out really well. Good brew. Well-balanced, easy to drink quencher for the warmer days.

BB 30/06/15. Poured a hazy coppery red colour with a one-finger light beige foamy head that retained OK and laced poorly. Carbonation high with fine to medium bubbles. Aroma really nice fruits and hops - fresh citrus and hint of pine. Taste of slight sweetness and slight bitterness; unfortunately the nice full aroma does not transfer to the taste. Light body with a thin mouthfeel; not watery. Smooth finish. OK.
Really nice with beef burger and bourbon sauce....brewdog rules...nice amber ale for sure

Aroma: honey, raisins, flowers
Appearance: brownish red, bit cloudy
Taste: really balanced, alcohol, malts
Palate: quick
Bottle - cloudy rust red with a small head. Dry earthy hop taste with hints of syrup. malts and maybe even some honey. Easy drinkin. Has an aftertaste of tea.
Combines the red ale taste with the dry hoppy and citrus flavour of IPA. Easy to drink, but not an average beer.

Bottle from Brewdog.

Dark copper with single finger off white head. Malty on the nose with caramel and citrus. Flowery on the taste with those malts again, light bitterness.
Beautiful hoppy and floral smell, taste is very round with a low bitterness, some red fruits. Overally good but maybe a bit low in alcohol content. Lacks a bit of balance.

At the 1st tasting of 2015 in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours amber-copper filtered, golden like off-white head. Nose: caramel, hops, smoked malts. Mouth: easy drinking, in style with a high carbonation. Ok
