Dark amber to reddish color. Off-white head. Pure hops In taste and nose. Bitter, dry. Carbonated. Nice IPA. Good stuff
Good light amber ale. Pleasant bitterness, slightly floral and fruity fragrance. Ok.

citrus, brown, clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, 
not a great drink in my opinion to much going on for a nice drink

Pours dark copper to pale brown with beige, off white soapy top. Aroma- sourish malty, caramel with intense citrus, flowery and winey hop hints. Taste is medium sweet with moderate to light bitter with some malt-sour notes in background. Medium body, average to average+ carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 Dark amber beer with a white head that disappears quickly, medium carbonation.
Taste is fruity, raspberry, grapefruit and a mix of other flavors.
Good beer especially for only 5% alc, nice.

Uggg. Bad flavor. Redeeming hop qualities then back to bad malt. You can make "red" without making a ugly sweet malt. Interesting that Anchor is involved in importing this - those dudes who bought out, I mean, let Maytag retire on a tropical island, are venturing out. Interesting, but a fail.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 With the new designed label, this beer is with the subtitle bitter sweet chaos. Very modern, but anyway pretty much correct name to describe this beer. Fruity caramel notes are dominant. Lovely carbonation. One of the best rusty dark red colors. Hops almost extreme. And, yes, some pines, which is also nice. From the tap is even better,

Heet niet meer 5 AM saint, maar 5 AM red ale. Flesje 33cl van de Sligro, tht okt 2015 op 9°C. Zoete fruitige bubblegum achtige aroma's van grapefruit en framboos. Schenkt robijnkleurig met wit schuim. Volle verfrissende smaak die overeenkomt met de aroma's met een bittere afdronk die medium lang blijft hangen. Knap bier, zeker gezien de slechts 5% ABV.

On tap, u2p. Dark amber nutty body with high creamy head. Aroma is malty, grainy, touch of caramel. Taste has high caramel fruity sweetness, earthy bitterness. Balanced towards the sweetness with a full body and high carbonation. Different taste from the bottle.
Mooie donkere kleur. Schuimkraag verdwijnt gelijk als je hem inschenkt. Zachte smaak maar niks speciaals.

[6399-20140628] Tap. Mild celery soup aroma. Clear, red amber body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Malty bitter grains flavour has quite a bitter celery burlap note. Medium-full body. Good. (7/4/7/4/15) 3.7
(@ BrewDog, Glasgow, Scotland)
Clear amber body. Off-white creamy head. Lightly citric, flowery, malty (toffee. caramel) aroma. Moderately bitter, moderately sweet flavour. Well balanced.
Pours clear amber. aroma is caramel and some hops, i expexted more hops... Taste has a full body and some bitterness.

Bottle from Waitrose. Poured a clear, bright amber, with a dense off white head. Aroma of spice, berries and malt. Caramel in the flavour, with some light woody notes and grassy hop. Finish was toffee, peal and straw.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Hazy dark amber brown, beige head cover, dots of lace. Taste is caramel malt with a slightly bitter edge that grows significantly into the palate, adding hops and carbonation on the swallow, then drifting through a lingering bittersweet finish. A huge brew for 5% abv, well-balanced, solid. Recommended. NOTE: the label now describes this as a "Hoppy Red Ale".
Geruch hopfig, zitrusartig, malzröstig, erdig. Antrunk malzröstig, Zitrus. Malzige Mitte, süßlich, Karamell, bitter. Abgang Kaffee und Schokolade, Zitrus, trockenbitter. Gefällt.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 Clear amber color with big head. Aroma is fruity-hoppy, really, a hint of berries, and pines as well as caramel malt. Taste is typical red ale, earthy and caramely, but the hops are also very present and with a pleasant bitter finish. Medium carbonation, rather light body. A good hoppy red ale!
dark red color, off white head. very fruity / hoppy smell of cherries and mango. light body, light fruity notes, hoppy note / bitterness is becoming apparent quite quickly and overlays the rest.

Hazy brown/reddish color with fluffy beige head. Aroma is fruity (red fruits such as strawberry and cherries are the most predominant) and resiny, with caramel. Taste is earthy, with also red fruits, caramel and a strong malty presence. Aftertaste is dry and bitter.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear ruby color with medium creamy tan-like head and good lacing. Aroma of berries, orange peel, spices, pine, caramel malt and burnt sugar. Taste starts moderate sweet and rich malt, follows by fruity acidity with some citric notes and moderate bitter finish. Medium body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Pleasant and enjoyable session beer...

Quite a strong sweet hoppy aroma. Gorgeous red colour. Strong hoppy aroma. Quite moreish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours gorgeous red with no head. Nose is oranges, hops, red fruit, strawberries. Taste is bitter at first, goes into a smooth sweetness that drinks away extremely well. Fantastic red ale.

Kinda similar to the punk IPA (theres a definite house style to brewdog Im starting to realise) but with a maltier base and better rounded. This one should really be their "flagship" instead of the punk.

TAP. Dark ruby colour with off white head. Sweet sherbet on the nose. Big sweet orange flavour through, with slight malty bitterness to finish. Went down very easy!
Sourced Fire Station Busselton

Belle robe cuivrée.
Les sensations sont assez anarchiques. On a les saveurs du malt, du houblon et de la levure qui nous parviennent en même temps. Arrière goût assez étrange de chocolat. Longue en bouche.
Excellente bière.

Bottle at home. I found berry bouncing off marmalade clashing with caramel cosying up to chocolate buzzing off spice sizzling with toast laced with lychee and colliding with biscuit. As malty as it is hoppy. As anarchic as it is structured. Bitterness and sweetness, all neatly messed up in a triumph of pure chaos. Yes i copied the description from the bottle. Hehehe :D

bottle from plonk. Pours amber, creamy head, attractive appearance. Big hoppy aroma, reminiscent of an imperial IPA for some reason (the extensive dry hopping?). Big hoppy flavours with mild bitterness. body is a little thin. at 5% ABV it?s rare for a beer of this relatively mild strength to carry such flavour. good stuff.
Pours a clear ruby color, topped with an average white head. Mild fruity aroma, some caramel in there too. Malty sweet taste, notes of caramel, some medium bitterness. Gentle but nice.
1dl Erzbierschof Tab. Sehr schöne Kupferrot, guter Schaum. Cassisbeeren und etwas grapiges in der Luft. Wenig bitter, schön malzig, nicht zu süss. Rutsch gut runter. Sehr feines Amber Ale.
Dark ruby colour with short head that almost disapears. herbs, citrus, some spices. Nice hoppy ale.

Pours a murky dark ruby colour with a average size frothy head. Has a nice aroma balance between caramel, biscuit, resin, and pine. Tastes of caramel, pine, nuts, and herbs. Has a nice medium body with lower carbonation and a dry finish. Overall quite well done amber with good hopping and malt balance.
Bottle @ Naiiv. Pours red with white head. Good hoppy aroma, with citrus, grass, litch and caramel. Taste was medium bitter with some sweetness, bready, citrus.Good beer.
Hop herbal spice aroma. Deep dark brown red colour great head and lacing. Malt floral spice herbal flavour. Smooth lingering palate.
East of Everything ontap (20-Nov-2014)Light herbal&malt aroma.Dark amber, ok head&suds lace.Big herbal biscuit roast malt flavour.Bitter herbal fruit finish&biscuit aftertaste.
o,33 l bottle. Red color. White head disappears fast. Aroma: caramel, hops malts, litch fruit. Taste Rye bread, hops, malts,citrus. Nice bucket of tastes. Light to medium body.

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought at Malting Pot, Brussels. Very drinkable hoppy red ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bardzo oryginalny posmak i piękna czerwona barwa. Nie kojarzę póki co żadnego innego piwa o podobnym smaku, szkoda że nie umiem go poprawnie nazwać.

Clear ruby color with short tan head and coarse bubbles. First aroma is strong and fruity (dark fruit like plums and cherries). Then come some pine and caramel. Thin oily texture. Not as flavorful as what the aromas would make you think but still very interesting. Good bitterness that disappears quickly. After that, lingering notes of coffee and dark fruit. That was interesting.
Duft av frukter, Citrus, karamell og krydder. Fin rødbrun gyllen farge. Dekkende brunt skum, ring langs kant. God smak av frukter, kryder og noe karamell med en fin ettersmak av citrus..
Pours a mahogany colour with some haze. Has a micro head and some lacing. Taste is of pine and citrus but nothing too bold. We get some middle level bitterness. Great beer.
Strong sweet fruity hoppy aroma. Really bitter finish which hangs around in the back of the mouth. Taste is rather different from its odour.
Très bonne odeur fruité et de houblon. Goût léger, le palais est décevant. larrière goût de houblon permet de revenir sur une note plus positive.
A good red aie. Very good, straight forward flavor, not overly complex but tasty. Just a touch of hops. Nice drink.

No retention and very light lacing. Smells of brown sugar, dark fruits and burnt sugar. Tastes of dark fruits, brown sugar and booze. No aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ambrée - rouge, fruitée, douce et houblonnée, équiibrée. Très bonne surprise.
the aroma of pine, grapefruits and spicy grasses with hints of caramel... the taste is fruity and hoppy, with notes of citrus, pine, passionfruits and pepper... dry sweet and bitter aftertaste...

330ml bottle. Aroma is light apple-ish hops, sweet, dark fruits, some malt. Appearance is cloudy brown with a fine brown-ish foam. Taste is light bitter, very light sweet. A bit watery when drunk very cold, better a bit warmer. Low carbonation, a little alcoholic. A long lasting, dry mouth-feel. Overall a very good Amber Ale.
Aromas of white wine, pepper, caramel, bread, tea and toasted seeds. Copper red color long lasting head. Medium body and carbonation. Pine, caramel and bread in the taste. Very nice red.

33cl bottle @ home from Csak a Jó Sör, Budapest.
Body is clear, deep amber,
Head is medium, creamy, beige, mostly lasting, excellent lacing.
Nose is citric,
Aroma is earl grey tea, honey, light licorice, orange peel, parfume, herbs.
Taste is medium sweet, medium hoppy bitter, light fruity sourness.
Finish is moderated hoppy bitter, light fruity sweet, medium duration.
Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Easy dessert beer, good one.
Bottle. Amber with big white head. Lots of aromatic hops, nice sweet malts with caramel and some roasted nuts, some grass and nice herbs. Light feel. Nice stuff.

Appearance: amber color and nice beige head.
Aroma of herbal hops and a bit of roasted malt. 
On the palate, it is bitter and has a dry finish. 
An excellent Amber Ale.

Good Reds are hard to come by, ones that stack up in flavour with their more sought after brethren, the Pales and IPAs. Thank God for the 5A.M. Saint. Tis beer does it all right; the appearance is a rusty orangey red with a lacing off white head. Notes of caramel, honey, butterscotch, leather and some mild barnyard dance with fresh smelling resin and herbal hops. The resulting taste is a blend of all those smells held together with a pleasing mid body and a fine bitter aftertaste.

Poured from bottle, reddish amber with medium creamy head. Aroma strong with notes of citrus and bread. Taste is bitter but well balanced and backed up with a nice malt body. Notes of citrus, bread, fruit. Nice lingering bitterness in the finish.
With its fruity, hoppy aroma and a taste from dry red fruits, caramels, and a slight nutty finish; this one emerges as an amber I could actually drink.

12oz bottle marked down at Bishops Cellar. Pours a transparent reddish amber with a thin beige head. Vibrant nose with caramel, toffee malts, a bit of hoppiness (touch of grapefruit?). Rich malty flavour with a rising bitterness at the finish. Kinda sticky on the palate. Wish it lived up to its aroma, but still very pleasant.
Not my favorite at all. Way too sweet in my opinion. I could barely drink it.

Pours a dark amber with cream head. Lovely big grapefruit and caramel aroma with floral elements. The flavour is sweet and hoppy, reinforcing the caramel and grapefruit aromas, with some grassy notes and a dry finish.

Brune rouge, assez translucide. Petite mousse beige claire disparaissant assez rapidement. 
Aromatique très portée sur lhoublonnage fruité agrumes et légèrement résineux. Pour le maltage plutôt sur le toastage un peu caramel. 
En bouche similaire avec peu de côté sucré, une forte sensation dhoublonnage fruité-agrumes mais avec une petite amertume - dry hop.
Longueur en bouche ... petite amertume de lhoublon, toastage léger et sécheresse. Bonne fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen. 
Balancée, portée sur laromatique dhoublon et sèche en fin de bouche.

Wow what an aroma. Cherries and alco pops sub siding to grapefruit and orange. Nice pour with a head that lasts. Very bitter with a malty depth not often felt in mainstream ale. Lovely mouthfeel. I could have brewed this myself. Fresh!
Bottle 0.33ltr: Amber colored brew with an dry bitter taste and hints of citrus and caramel.

[On tap at Cerveteca Lisboa] Dark amber color, with a small initial head in beige. Medium to thin body, low to medium carbonation. Aroma is grassy, toasted malt and very strong to exotic fruits (mainly passion fruit). Taste is in accordance and is floral, grassy, low sweetness and very hoppy. Aftertaste is long, bitter and dry.

Pours an amber brown color with an off white head. Malt,hop, caramel, toffee, toast and malt aroma. Toffee, caramel, malt, hop, biscuit and toast flavors. Medium body and average carbonation. Malt, toffee and hop finish.
Irre Mischung aus Fruchtigkeit und Malz, wunderschöne rote Farbe. Sehr bekömmlich.

Poured from 11.2 oz bottle, bought in a 4 pack at Trader Joes. Date on this is best by 2-26-15, so I thought it would be worth a shot. Poured a cloudy muddy reddish brown, with a light tan medium sized head. Sweet malty nose, faint citrus. Taste starts sweet, with a bitter finish. Medium bodied with a mostly oil texture. Not as fresh as Id like it as there is a bit of staleness to it.
Pours a ruby colour without a head. It has a fruity scent with hints of passionfruit and citrus. A balanced mild beer but the carbonation is a bit excessive. Overall a good brewdog beer.
Riktigt smakrik och maltig röd ale från allas vårt systembolag. Klart bättre än många av de andra ölen från Bre Dog.

Like literally the most carbonated beverage I have ever put in my mouth. The beer is extremely balanced. Like perfectly. It?s crazy. That being said I?m not really a fan of marris otter malts... That?s kind of a personal thing... That being said, this is like sprite carbonated. But like way more. It?s way too carbonated. If you like burping and not really being able to taste much, this is your dream beer. If you?re normal, this is worth a try, brew dogs are mavericks and deserve to be revered... So yeah...
Very carbonated. Id say too carbonated. It tastes like a red ale but barely. Its hard to taste over the intense carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a clear Amber red body under a one finger frothy beige head that left a bit of lace. The nose is mostly husky and toasty malt with some citrusy hops. The flavor is a little bland though, fairly dry roasted maltiness with a little husky grain on the back end. Theres a light snap to the finish from the hops at least. Light to medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Meh, not the most interesting beer, but its drinkable enough to have one bottle.

W aromacie jest karmel, czerwone owoce, lekkie przyprawy, pachnie raczej słodko i bardzo przyjemnie. W smaku za to jest raczej wytrawnie, sporo przypraw, lekki iglak, brakuje nieco kontry. Przypomina gruit tudzież sahti, posmak ziołowy zalega zbyt długo, nieco męczy. Zdecydowanie lepiej pachnie niż smakuje.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 330ml bottle served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a beautiful amber color forming a medium thin bubbled beige head. Good retention and some lingering thin lacings left in the glass. 
S: Sweet caramel malts mixed with a delicious grassy, flowery and a bit pinny American style hops. Sweet biscuit. Toffee. Fruity notes, mainly plums and dates. 
T: Slight sweet upfront. Very biscuity. Caramel malts, toffee followed by a mild hoppy bitterness. Again, very flowery and grassy with some notes of pine. 
M: Light body and good carbonation. Aftertaste is a mix of caramel malts and grassy hops
O: Great drinkability. Lovely Amber Ale. 
[ BA Review @ 5/7/2014 ]

Julie says it is a Andy beer very hoppy. She it is very dismayed she read it is a 25 ibu she gives a 1.5. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really easy to drink red ale. Malty start with a nice bitter hoppy finish. Had a bottle pour at home. Pours a deep amber color with a tan head

Piana dosc slaba, szybko sie redukuje do obwodki i w koncu do zera. Kolor jasna miedz, przejrzyste, zmetnione. W aromacie owoce tropikalne, lekki nuty cidteczkowr oraz chlebowe. W smaku troche krotkie slodowe, goryczka niska, wysycenie srednie do niskiego. Piwo ogolnie rzecz bioroac piwo dobre ale dupy nie urywa.
UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 Nie do pokonania dla mnie. Zbyt maślano-goryczkowy posmak. Cała treść piwa opiera się właściwie o te dwie rzeczy.
11.2 bottle. Dark amber color with one finger head. Caramel and slight citrus aroma. Flavor is similar. Not a big fan.

Bottle. 
Hazy Dark amber pour, small White head.
Malty Nose, with a roasted nutty hint. Fairly balanced taste, smooth.
Was hoping for more hops. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Dark translucent amber-red, minimal toffee head. Beautiful colour. Smells of bready sticky malt, caramel, a bit of resiny floral hop, metallic/vegetal bite. Sweet and malt forward but crisp. Tastes of bitter resinous hop, crisp malt. Body is medium with slick finish. Enjoyable hoppy red ale.
Bottle 33cl. Pours dark amber with off white head. Aroma - Grapefruit, caramel and citrus. Strong bitter taste.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 The red fruit aroma filled the room when I opened the bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a dark amber with a moderate off-white head. Feel nice on the palate with a medium body. I would like a more bitter finish on this one, but otherwise, its ideal.

33cl bottle. Dark hazy amber with a creamy off-white head. Red fruits, caramel, grassy and hoppy aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is quite balanced with a more bitter finish. Overall, a nice brew but far from the best I had from BrewDog.
Yet another beautiful beer from Brewdog. Like homebrew beer. Hazy redish color. Nice aroma, very fruity, like taste. I liked it.

Bottle pour. Dark cloudy Amber. Very poor palate, decent but light Amber taste

"surprised to see this one so high - it gave me high expectations that werent met. 2 months short of the stamped best by date, but it tasted a little stale. biscuit malt forward, with nice bittering hops, but little on the aromatic side. looks and feels average. meh."

Lätt brunröd färg. Doftar fruktig/citrig humle med en riktigt bra smak som passar mig perfekt. Ölet har en precis lagom beska. Flaska från Systembolaget.

Bottle. Dark amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, beige head. Aroma of citrus, berries, peach, grass, caramel, roast. Taste with about the same aromas, also some tea. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a moderate carbonation and it finishes bitter, citric, fruity and a bit roasty. Tasty! Lovely berry aromas, just the right amount of sweetness and bitterness and really refreshing and sessionable. Pretty much how I imagine a perfect beer of this style!
Really nice hoppy beer! Fudge, pine in the aroma. Havent tried this brewery in a while but this was solid. Its even old but good

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 33cl bottle from "cerveteca" bar in Lisbon. It pours a dark amber color with a moderate and non-persistent beige head. Aroma is of hops, fruits (specially berries and other red fruits) and some floral notes.Taste is of course sweet hoppy, but with toasted malts, caramel and later it builds up some bitterness at the end. It is moderately carbonated with a medium body and a dry finish. Overall a very nice and enjoyable Amber Ale from BrewDog. I would drink it again.

Aroma: intense citrus and red fruit; Appearance: pale orange-reddish; Taste: medium bitterness, medium sourness, slight sweetness; Palate: abrupt finish, oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation

Pleasant buttery notes, the intense hop aroma doesnt mean intense bitterness. Well-rounded, sessionable.
Bottle. Pours dark reddish amber with a great head. Aroma of intense citrus hops and malty notes. Very drinkable with a pleasent lasting bitterness.

Pours dark brown with slight red tint. Aroma is grapefruity hops. Flavors are pure red ale off the start: slight sourness from darker malts but pretty light. Hops come next and last to the finish. Interesting that its not a red IPA like I was expecting, but an actual red ale that has been hopped up.
Bottled sample from MLCC(?). Pours cloudy reddish colour. Very bubbly. Very hoppy. Ruby liquid is a good way to describe it
Yep, its red alright. Its not super bold but medium-bodied. Iconoclastic is pushing it, but its tasty.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- Has a sugary smell with some citrus 
Appearance- This is a cloudy amber beer with a thick tannish colored head.
Taste- Has a hoppy citrus flavor
Palate-. Medium bodied with a bitter aftertaste bite.
Overall- Not a bad American Amber/Red Ale, I would drink this beer again.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Brown colour, moderate head. Nice lacing. A: herbs, caramel, butterscotch, some fruity notes. Medium body & carbonation. Rather dry taste with notes of caramel, roast, floral hops. Well-balanced. Hoppy finish & aftertaste. Good
Tap, amber pour, off white head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, some toffee, sweet.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 On tap @ Brewdog Camden, London, UK. Pours with a clear red colour, small white head. Aroma is medium malty, moderately hoppy, with notes of resin and herbs, additional slight notes of citrus; quite good. Taste is medium sweet, moderately bitter, slightly sour, surprisingly balanced for a Brewdog. Soft to medium body, watery texture, average carbonation. A very good, very enjoyable balanced beer, with a hint of Brewdog in it. Great.
Smak złożony i ciekawy, zaskakujący. Lekko karmelowe. Pijalne, ale piwo się degustuje a nie pije.
Clear dark amber red color with a beige head. Fresh flower sweet aroma. Taste is very well balanced sweet, bitter, caramel with a hint of elderberry juice.
Bottle from Fenwicks Newcastle. Slightly metallic aroma, but a much more complex dark flavour

Pours a ruby/brown colour with a doughy looking head. The smell has hints of banana bread and reminds me a lot of the Talisker distillery. The initial taste has a hint of cut grass leading into a citrusy hoppy after tatse.

33cl bottle poured into a sniffer glass. Bought in Singapore, and I think manufactured in 2013 (equity for punks logo) but drunk in 2014. Hoppy and caramel aroma - also floral notes and citrus. Small head which disappears rather quickly. Beautiful reddish amber colour. Slight sweet taste with citrus and caramel tones. Medium level of bitterness in the aftertaste. Very nice - good session beer.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a red colour with a small head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity citrus. Nice strong flavour of bitter hops and barley.

Clear dark amber red colour with a thin beige head. Aroma is caramel malt, hoppy citrus, grapefruit, peach, passion fruit. Taste is medium to heavy sweet with medium bitterness, sweet fruity finish.

Cor ambar e espuma bege baixa e não persistente.

Aroma frutado forte, maracujá e herbal.

Sabor de lúpulo e malte tostado, gosto doce no começo e com pequeno amargor residual. Corpo médio e seco.

Boa amber ale.

Pours a near clear browish red with a big creamy white head and good lacing. Fresh hop aroma: floral, fruity, musky, berries, but also caramelly and very slightly spicy. Taste is grassy malts and caramel first, then builds up some moderate hop bitterness, but not overpowering the malts. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, slightly watery palate. Very enjoyable stuff - subtle, civilized, and definitely sessionable.

caramel, bread, fruits, citrus and a floral note in the aroma. Amber with a white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall a nice hoppy Amber Ale with some character.
This is everything a red ale should be. Great brown bread and caramel aromas. Flavors are hoppy and bready. Everything is balanced and smooth. Great stuff.
Mildly fruity aroma and taste. Medium carbonation. Amber colour. Kinda like a mild IPA.
0,33l fles gedeeld met remco, robijnrood met een witte kraag. Geur citrus, bloedsinasappel. Smaak is droog met grapefruit. Body is medium.
Pours a bit hazy dark amber with medium tan head. There is some mild bitterness in taste. Aroma is mostly hoppy, a bit citrusy, some caramel. Nice.
A great mild taste with a bit of bitterness. A lot lighter than the Red IPAs I normally drink.
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Red colour, tiny head. Hoppy and fruity citrus aroma. Nice strong flavour of bitter hops and barley. Nice!
Caramel, hay aroma, not very strong. Clear, red, foamy cream coloured head. Light sweetness, lightly bitter, umami. Lively, full body, long finish. Nice beer.
How: tap /// Where: dikkenek café, Lyon, France /// Appearance: amber /// Aroma: caramel, grapefruit, prune /// Body: light /// Taste: sweet with a bitter finish
Floral aromas with citrus and tropical fruits, great fruity flavours with a mild bitter aftertaste, excellent red ale and looking forward to my next 5AM

Bottle. Appearance is burnt amber, a little bit of haze/cloud. A small off white foamy head which clings to the glass. Aroma- lots of hops, caramel hints, fruity, bit of raisin, floral hints. Taste- pronounced hop bitterness, medium to full in the mouth, fruits, hint of blackberry, grassy notes, firm malt profile, biscuity towards the finish, which is bitter. Tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Clear and currant-like appearence, with a strong and gross head, agrumate and sweet aroma with some traits of marsala, strong malted taste (raisin, ginger-like features - sort of a light syrup trait) and a bitter palate. Overall, a very enjoyable red ale

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2015 Dark brown body, small tan head. Fresh maltty aroma with a lot of pine notes. and grass. Very soft and well-rounded taste with a slight bitter bite to it towards the end. Soft carbonation, not that lively. Nice beer overall nevertheless.
Bottle. Im a big fan of hoppy red ales so this is right up my alley. I know its not meant to be an IRA but a bit more of everything would have made me really happy.
Sehr carbonisiert, hopfig mit einer guten malzigen süße. Citrusnoten mit karamell, allerdings auch rech wässrig was den nachgeschmack sehr beinträchtigt.
Nice hoppy citrus aroma with the distinct Amarillo hop aroma coming through. Taste is of hoppy flavours similar aroma and caramel sweetness.
Bottle, pours a reddish amber with a thin a beige head, aroma is citrus and caramel, taste is sweet with caramel, malt, and then has some hoppy bitterness, dry bitter finish, good beer

Bottle. Amber red in colour, white head. In aroma very nice hoppy aroma - citrus fruits, mango with some caramel background. In taste solid bitterness - grapefruit-like and malty base very nicely mixed, bitterness could be weaker. Medium carbonation and body. Very nice one.
Ruby red, medium head. Grapefruit, caramel, spruce. Semi-light palate, medium bitterness. Enjoyable, not special though.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2017 pronounced hoppy aroma, fruity and fresh. nice reddish amber color, clear. persistent white head. nice hop bitterness. average carbonation, very pleasant mouthfeel. very good ale, i like it very much.
Amber (duh). Aroma is biscuity and caramel - sweet. Taste is the same with toffee malt bitterness at end. Overall, pretty good, but I just dont dig amber ales.

I en tid då filosofer och vetenskapsmän inte ens kan enas om huruvida verkligheten existerar oberoende av sinnen som filtrerar den, känns det lite futtigt att sitta och dividera över om BrewDog 5 A.M. Saint förtjänar en åtta eller nia i betyg på totalen. För tusan, den kanske inte ens existerar, och så sitter jag och recenserar en icke-vara som utgått ur sortimentet och kanske aldrig ens ingått i det. Bäst att jag tar en till öl och ser om någonting av det här klarnar för mig.
33cl bottle at home. poured dark amber with off white head. Aroma is grapefruit and citrus from hops. Taste is caramel and malt - with hoppy bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. Good stuff
Nice ruby coloured beer, malty and hopy taste with a bitter ending. Noce body and ok carbonatation.
Small head. Clear, redd-ish, neatly-looking beer. Aroma is that of caramel malts, slightly hoppy. Strong bitterness in the taste, very grapefruit-like (rather than herbal and grassy). Very good.

Inte bäst i stan men sitter man på ett ställe i Edinburgh och käkar musslor så funkar det fint

From a bottle. Pours a cloudy deep red, tiny head, big balanced malt hop aroma, smooth malty palate and a delicious with hop aftertaste.

wspaniały zapach - słodki, owocowy, ziołowy z lekkimi nutami słodowymi. ananas, mango, winogrona, marakuja, grapefruit i inne tym podobne z lekką ziołową goryczką i karmelową nutą. kolor czerwony, głęboki, zmętniony. piana niezbyt obfita, ale za to ładna, w beżowym kolorze. w smaku dość lekki, wytrawny. mało słodowości z początku, bardziej przypomina kompot. goryczka wyraźna, ale dość niska (zwłaszcza jak się porówna do zapachu) krótka i przyjemna. posmak lekko malinowy. niskie nasycenie. bardzo pijalne i orzeźwiające. pomimo krótkiej goryczki dość ściągające.

Pours a somewhat murky amber red with a thin off white head. Aroma is a little muted; citrus and pine. Pine and resinous taste, not overbearing though. Weak and watery aftertaste with a slight bitterness. Reasonable mouth feel, a little light on but good coat and good carbonation.

Pours clear dark brown with small head. Fresh hoppy aroma with grass and some caramel. Taste is caramel, malty, a bit of fruit, medium bitterness. Its a well-balanced and well-hopped red ale at a very reasonable ABV. Clean and refreshing - another winner from BrewDog!
Bottle from Tesco. Amber red with a thin head. Lots of hops but also a plenty of sweet fruits and a great balance of the two.

On tap at BrewDog Leeds. The saint starts off with hop aromas of tropical fruits and is dark red amber colored with a fine frothy but fast vanishing slightly red head. The flavor is dominated by fruity hoppiness with passion fruit and citrus and some malt in the background. The taste is unsurprisingly bitter with a strong hoppy finish. Very good amber ale!

33cl. Bbe somewhere in 04/15. Pours thick dark clear amber with nice reddish creamy head. High IBU drink. Caramel, vanilla, brown sugar/ molasses in taste. Very thick and fulfilling drink. Served rather cold, but wormed up during hot summer day and was refreshing for the whole time. Beautiful example of amber ale.

duft: citrus. lime. svag duft af gran. appelisn.
smag. citrus. grapefrugt. appelsin. lidt skarp. lidt malt karamel.
33 cl bottle. Pours red with a small white head. Hoppy aroma and a bitter finish. Refreshing brew in the summer.
Bottle, Bangkok, HOBS aree. レッドエール

330 ml bottle at home. Almost clear red-copper color with nice off-white to beige head. Very nice hoppy aroma, piney, fruity (grapefruit), a little grassy-floral, sweet caramelish malty. Taste begins bittersweet malty with caramel notes and it becomes more bitter and fruity. Light to medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, very nice roasted bitter finish.

Bottle 33cl
Pours copper with a thin creamy persistent head.
Aroma is sweet caramel, floreal, black cherry and some citrusy.
Taste is a little watery, subtle caramel, minty and a moderate bitterness that remains in the aftertaste... not for so long actually
Light body with medium carbonation.

330ml bottle 5%. Pours dark red with high head. Lovely ripe red berry and hoppy aroma. Medium carbonation flavour is ripe berrys with a hoppy finish that is not overpowering. A good drink I would have again.
big and nice foam and a lovely scent of American hops. great amber ale (or pale ale if you like). Lovely dark hoppy still easy-drinking.

Une belle couleur ruby une mousse légère 
Un nez fruité suivie d une amertume élégante
Ronde en bouche accentuée par un houblonnage massivement présente

Schiuma non abbondante e di rapida dissoluzione, colore ambrato scuro, aroma di malti tostati, erbaceo e con note resina di pino, al palato corpo medio e media carbonazione, le note erbace e restinose amare dei luppoli si ripropongono in bocca equilibrando il dolce dei malti in cui prevale il caramello, alla fine e una birra abbastanza piacevole ma non facile e complessa.

Fruity, bit of plum throughout. Dark melon in the middle, easy mouthfeel before bitter end. Red ale with kick. 5%. 330ml. 1.3Std drinks.

2014-06-28. Crisp dark copper amber body with a small creamy beige head and lace. 3+ Aroma of dusty caramel malt has a dunkel meets ESB like quality to it. Flavour is malty up front, dryish tangy biscuity caramel malt, moderate green hops with bit of an herbal/celery like quality to it. Mineral undertones, it leaves the palate a bit dry. Smooth average plus bodied palate, carbonation. Decent but not for me. On tap at BrewDog, Glasgow

smells like freshly sawed wood (?) cherries, and spices, dark golden red, thick foamy white head. swift bitterness, corriander and cherries hint of kelp (?!?!) really nice and enigmatic beer, would have been better if id had it cold.

330 ml bottle in turkey... very warm sourcherry flavour welcomes you when you open the bottle and strong bittersweet / sourcherry explosions follow you until you see end of the beer very quickly! long lasting finish reminds me my childhood years wasted with cough syrup (!) but anyway, very charismatic ale...

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Gall & Gall, Doorn.
Dark amber with an off-white head. Malty hoppy aroma. The combination of citrus hops and malts is a good one, making this beer light but very satisfying.

Color ambar intenso con notas cobrizas. Limpia y de buena formación de espuma pero baja estabilidad. Aroma combinado de lúpulos cítricos y tropicales (notas de piña y maracuja), la malta suavemente tostada aporta las notas de caramelo. El sabor tiene buena correspondencia con el aroma pero el lúpulo se hace mucho más fuerte y deja las notas más maltosas en un segundo plano. Su cuerpo es leve y su carbonatación es media. En el retrogusto la sensación es levemente astringente, amarga pero con un suave dulzor residual. Muy rica aunque para mi gusto la excesivamente lupulada.
Clear ruby red pour with a single finger head. Caramel aroma. Very sugary. Mouth is medium bodied. Taste is full of caramel. Lots of nice flavors going on here. Nuts, grapefruit. Very juicy.
Humalan tuoksu vahvahko, ei kovin hedelmäinen. Ehkä hieman jopa leipäinen? Sivumakuna häivähdys rautaa. Suutuntuma miellyttävä.
33 cl @ enoteca. Buona ambrata per la casa scozzese anche se stufa un pochetto.

The nose is hop forward - grapefruit, citrus, and tropical fruit. A cloudy Texas tea hued pour with an ivory ring and no lacing. The palate follows the nose. Tropical fruit, florals. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, easy to drink no matter the time of day.
Lite dimmig och brun-orange med ett orange skum. Doft: Humle, malt, kanderat socker, lite barley wine sött och fat. Smak: Humle, citrus, malt, kanderat socker, maris otter, sockerdricka.
Starter rolig på smak, men det åpenbarer seg en nøtteaktig ettersmak som redder helhetsinntrykket.

Pompázatos és nem mindennapi színben, sötét borostyán árnyalatban tündöklő főzet fakéreg, akác és gyanta, valamint fűszeres komló illatjegyeivel. Meghatározhatatlanul sokrétű ízvilága a komló markáns nyomvonala mentén halad, mely érezhetően összetett és dús, a gyümölcsös vonulat helyett azonban leginkább fás, kissé mogyorós színezetű. Szokatlan és rendkívül különleges ízvilággal rendelkező darab.
Amber brown-ish color, quickly dissipating foam - very hoppy, citrus, flowers - bitter taste - light body, rather thin - bitter, lightly sour finish with citrus.

Light brown, red-ish colour. Whitebrown head. Smells like hops, coffee, grass, basement aroma.
Taste of hops, citrus, some herbs. Bitter ending.
Bottle. Red brown colour with a small white head. Hoppy and citrus, fruity aroma. Fresh taste which have a hint of flowers and citrus. Mild bitterness.

Bottle from systembolaget. Smell if hops, flowers, citrus and dry fruits. Pours an dark amber color with a medium white head. A thin but fresh taste which have a hint of flowers and citrus. Very thin palate. The drink dosent stay very long and leaves you wishing for more. An okay beer for summer and barbecue occasions.
Bottle at home. Pours copper amber, juicy fruit, dry and bitter, burnt toffee.

Bottle from Systemet. 
Red brown clear colour with a weak beige head. Hoppy and fruity aroma and a very flowery citrus and resin taste but rather mild bitterness. Good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@Klostervägen 19/6-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Hops, caramel. Taste: Dito + medium bitterness. Body is medium.
Bottle. Dark amber with small head. Hoppy aroma with some malts. Same with the flavour as well as some grapefruit to balance it out. More red/amber ales should taste like this!
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Ihan hyvältä maistuu tuo humalaisen Jumalan käsi. Ei liikaa. Ehkä siihen tottuu. Sports academy Tuomon kanssa. semmonen futis-olut.
Bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma: malt, rye, caramel. Taste follows aroma with added light citrus. Medium body, medium sweet and bitterness. Interesting, well balanced beer.
For an Amber ale, this is a winner. Usually lackluster in taste, this Amber ale exceeds them all. Almost like a pale ale, but not as much of a kick. Love it.

Bottled sample. Dark amber in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas arr of sticky pale and caramel malts, along with a hit of orange liqueur. Malt forward in the mouth as well and quite sweet. Vague citrus and astringent grain on the back end. Heavy bodied and chewy, but with a bit of hop bitterness in there too.
Bottle from house of trembling madness in York. Great hoppy aroma, like the good tastey IPAs but darker. Another top brew dog
Bottle. Amber pour with a small foam head, floral malty aroma. Taste is bitter, loads of hops, caramel, balanced. Nice

Tap at Brewdog, Leeds. Clear, reddy amber. Off white, bubbly head. Light toffee. Light grapefruit. Taste is pink grapefruit bitter. A little sweetness, too. Light, oily palate. Bitter, and fruity dry finish.
Very intresting flavors of oak & nuts.. A i nice hop bitternes well hidden and a liquer aroma in the backround.. Good job!
malty aroma. red in color with a good head. taste is full with a good balance of malt and hops

Medium body, vastly bubbly, quick alcohol and flavor feel. 2 words. Malt and mud. Flavor is muddy, caramel, thick, brown, nuts, oak, hop, chocolate and obviously malt. Lots of it. Very unique! First BD.
Dark orange. Clear. Off-white head. Hoppy, fruity, sweet notes. Bitter finish.

Nice dark, ruby-red colored beer with a slightly brown layer of foam. A strong, fruity, sour aroma of apples, and apricot or peach. The sour bit surely moves on into the taste, but the bitterness has the upper hand. Sadly, not much of an aftertaste.

Mooi donker, robijnrood kleurig bier met een lichtbruine kraag. Sterk, fruitig aroma van appels en abrikoos of perzik. Ook in de smaak zit het zurige verwerkt, maar op de voorgrond licht de bitterheid. Helaas niet veel nasmaak.
I love red ales. Roma is stunningly good for this type of beer, the taste should be more intense.
Bottle, 330 ml, into a glass tulip. Pours a deep reddish copper amber. Aroma is fruity hops, citric fruit, passion fruit, peach, caramel. Great malt palate in the end. Fine red ale beer.

33cl bottle. Deep cloudy amber, fine off white head. Smells of sweet malts, caramel, sweet fruits (plums, cherries, raisins, dates). Taste is malts, some yeast, light vegetal note, still some light fruitiness. Medium carbonation, a bit too watery.

Typical malty flavour, off-white head and red colour that suggests a very good red ale. And it is one indeed. Perfectly round beer with no nasty side taste or whatsoever. The clear hop twist in this beer makes it stand out just a little from other great red ales. My absolute favorite in the red ale category.

Bottle at home. Pours a reddish, coppery amber with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity hops; citrus, peach, caramel, malts. Sweet, fruity hoppy flavor, malts, caramel. Dry, slightly bitter hoppy aftertaste. Very nice.

Bottle 330 ml at home, into a tulip glass. ABV 5%
Deep red colou on the body, clear, with a good sized tan head, good density, good retention. Light lacing on the glass.
Very hoppy aroma, lots of citrus and grapefruit, a bit of caramel malts.
Taste is a very refreshing one, with a bit of caramel, very fruity, orange. Nothing as spectacular as the aroma though. Bitterness is also nothing out of the ordinary.
A bit watery mouthfeel, thin body and okay carbonation.
Overall a quite nice beer for the style, wouldnt be my first choice in a bar.

Bottle @home. Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is fruity, peach, hoppy. Taste is fruity, peach, hoppy. Medium body and medium carbonation. Dry and fruity (peach) finish. Very refreshing and nice one.
Gyllen farge. Lukter malt, humle og noe sitrus. Også ganske fruktig i smak. Noe karamell også. Medium karbonert og medium pluss fylde.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours a deep reddish amber with a half finger of tan head. Rather earthen, foresty aroma, notes of pine resin, grass and perhaps orange, though less potent than in the Hardcore IPA. Taste is a little watery initially, but some earthen, floral and perhaps even vegetable notes (specifically carrots) coming through quite strongly further towards the back end. Not really sweet as such but a decent amount of bitterness is present. Quite refreshing and mild, yet also decently flavorsome. Carbonation helps in this regard, and also balances out the somewhat watery and thin body. Would most likely be better on a hot day, rather than a dismally rainy and grim one such as this!

Bottle. Pours a crisp clear amber with a thin head. Aroma not too pronounced but lovely nonetheless, floral and hoppy. Taste is awesome. Loads of hops but nothing overdone, medium carbonation, nicely balanced. Loved it.

Nem ájultam el ettől a vöröskétől. Savanykás ugyan, de valahogy nem hagyott mély nyomot bennem. Érettségi után kóstoltam először, azóta nem ittam, úgyhogy ez jelent valamit. A Brew Dog ráadásul árban sem tutkó...

Poured from 330 ml bottle. 

Lightly hazy, rusty red with a small khaki head and good lacing. 

Aroma of a strong whiff of floral perfume initially upon open the bottle and pouring into a glass. That aroma dissipated quickly leaving aromas of raisins, grapes, citrus and caramel.

Taste of caramel, floral and herbal hops, grass, raisins and citrus. 

Medium/light body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur ambrée, mousse qui disparaît vite. Très fort nez houblon fruité (raisin) note de caramel . Gout doux amer de caramel légèrement grillé, légèrement fuité. Fin amère houblonée longue, note de baton de réglisse. Pas commune

Bottle. Murky ruby amber, thick off white head and some lacing. Drunk a little cold which may have muted the aroma, but some nice citrus and stone fruit hops with a caramel backdrop. Fantastic grapefruit and grassy hops, with earthy caramel malt. Pleasant strong bitterness throughout the beer with a solid richness to place it in the red ale sphere.
Pours a clear amber with off-white head. Aroma is strong citrus,roses,some herbs. Taste is malty,somewhat nutty,caramel.

helder rood met minimale kaki kraag. Aroma is zoet hoppigheid met wat graan, en den.
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, redelijk bitter, matig qua sterkte, zwak fruitig, redelijk stevig moutig, matig tot redelijk kruidig, caramel. hoppig
zwakke body, dun en waterig, afdronk zoet en iets droog. 
tja wat zal ik er van zeggen, een topper is het niet, en ik zou er ook geen kratje van in willen slaan.

Very interesting beer. Grape, citrus and decent hoppiness but with a very distinct caramel-like and nearly nutty maltiness. Like the punk IPA it has a very long aftertaste - seems to keep going for ever
This beer is an absolute cracker! Great colour and aroma with such a great full flavour for the percentage, I could drink this all day!

Golden-amber color with small off-white head.
Aroma is distinctively grapefruit and hoppy with some notes of caramel. Smooth texture. Moderate dry with qiute bitter hoppy finish.

Aroma is the best thing here- floral & a bit exotic. Appearance is average. Flavor on the malty side; body chewy. Overall decent n drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Looks attractive red with a modest off- white head. No big flavors on this one. A nice subtle grassy flavor with some caramel and hops. Very accessible.

Nice strong frothy light beige head of creamy bubbles with minimal carbonation. Aromatic hops aroma with some dried leaves, raosted malts and light spruce. Color is a crystal clear dark mahagony brown. Easy drinking with a lingering hops bitterness and tea leaves. A decent and somewhat hoppy amber ale.

Bottle. Pours a fairly hazy dark amber color with a moderate light tan head on there. Nose has some bread in there, as well as just a bit of nuttiness. Taste is actually quite nutty and only slightly sweet. Remarkably pleasant beer!

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a medium head. Aroma of American hops, little malty and caramel. Taste is sweet, hint of caramel, bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation. Good example of american amber ale.

Bottle - pours copper with a light brown rocky head, good retention and some thin lacing. Aroma of orange peel, grapefruit, malts, earthy, floral and grassy hops. Taste is earthy and grassy hops with some berries and burnt toffee flavour - quite tarte, medium bitter, low to medium sweetness. Medium to heavy body with a low carbonation.
Amberine colour with medium yelowhish head. Aromatic aromas with herbal citric hops. Bitter tastes with toasty sensations. Very nice!
In fles 33cl. Koper kleurig met een mooie schuimkop. Zoetig/karamel achtig van smaak met een mooie afstemming van de hop en bitterje.
33cl fles. Donkere kleur. Witte volle schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : kruidig, banaan, fruitig.

On tap at Tapwerks! Pours a clear deep amber with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of bread and grass with a bit of musty grain underlying. Flavor has a bit more grass with earthy grain and a bit of bread.

Fantastic amber ale. Pours a deep, dark amber-ruby colour with a very slight beige head that descends into a ring. Very handsome. Aromas are beautifully hoppy and sweet, with notes of caramel, resin and spruce. The taste is mostly malty at the beginning with hoppy bitterness kicking in halfway through and riding a medium-high carbonation to a nice bitter finish. Very characteristic body without overwhelming the classic "amber" taste with too robust hops.

Pours a hazy reddish amber. Aroma of Berries and that distinct aroma of British/scotch ales. Taste is mild with a smooth start and a hoppy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Nice ruby looking beer. Aroma of caramel and hops and pine. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Bitter finish. Caramel, pine, floral hops. Light fruit. Pretty solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Booths, Ripon. Pours deep amber with frothy cream head. Loads of pine hop flavour, but some quite sweet caramel in there too. Quite light, but that makes it very drinkable. Good beer.

Maltig doft med knäcktoner och en friskhet från humlen. 
Rödbrun färg med lite ljusbrun krona. 
Smaken är lätt och ganska torr. Ganska liten i kroppen.
För tunn för min smak.
Ingen toppöl i mitt tycke.

Draft at Farmers Cabinet. Hazy red pour with a white foamy head. Mix of hops and malt that only semi-comfortably mix. Earthy spice floral hops. Chocolate toffee caramels. The result is smooth but unfocused. Not unpleasant, but the theory feels unsound despite the execution.

Pours clear red / amber color with a minimal head. Aroma is citrussy, grapefruity, hoppy. Taste ist quite floral and red fruity with a hint of orange and minimal bitterness. Also minimal carbonation. Not my favourite one from Brewdog.

Clear amber with tanned head that dissappears quickly. Smell is all about hops, floral, grapefruit and dried fruit scents. Taste is very hoppy, but with a nice malt sweetness. Dry floral hoppy finish.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours reddish brown with off white head. Aroma is fruity, red berries, malty. Taste is light medium bitter, malty, fruity, slightly sour. Aftertaste has a balanced bitterness and hints of fruit. Not as intensive as an IPA but with a good balance of bitterness and fruit. Very good.

Draught @ BrewDog Manchester. 
Aroma of some citra hops, caramel, fruit. Pours red with tiny white head, which is lasting.
Starts moderate sweet, light bitterness.
Finish is slightly bitter and caramel sweet. Soapy texture. Average carbonation.
Beautiful garnet red appearence, a overally sweet but hoppy beer, drinkable and very tasty and lasting aftertaste.
Amber color, minimal head, white foam, clear, Aroma of tiramisu and hops, lightly bitter, hoppy taste.
Nice Amber beer with a flowery aroma. Fruity bitterness and nice mouth feeling. The aftertaste is not as bitter as many IPAs, but very pleasant. Nice beer to drink on a hot summers day.
Clear reddish brown body. Citric and red fruits on the nose . Medium length.
notes from a week ago. Brown to orange. Quick dissipitating head. lightly carbed. Sweet tasting - caramel. Strong hop aroma.

33cl bottle; tan fluffy head, network lacings, clear red-brown body, brighter than copper, darker than amber.
Citric hops and modest malts to the nose.
Fruity taste with a bouquet of ripe plums, grapes, malts, cheese, herbal hops.
Somewhat dry on palate, feels well bodied.
Finishes fruity, hops playing the bitter role under it all, sappy stuff this brew.
