Bottle, 33cL. A dark brown to orange beer. Just a few bubbles. Medium white head. Poor persistence. Fruity (lemon, exotic fruits) and floral aroma, resin, roasty malt. First light sweet, then heavy dry bitter. Simple but intense. Thin body, medium rough texture, soft carbonation, long dry bitter finish. Refreshing. Nice bitterness. Easy to drink. Just enough at 5 a.m. after a long New Years Eve, I guess.

Bottle @ Bunker Trieste.
Dark amber,crystal clear. Big foam,quickly disappearing. metallic fruity hop aroma .
Metallic and grassy hops also in the taste,caramelized malts sweetness . Bitter dry finish. Smooth and light body.
On tap brewdog Sheffield. Red colour slight head. Aroma is tropical. Taste is red fruits tropical good bitter hop finish. Medium body prickly carbonated. Good stuff
330ml botte direct from BrewDog. Red colour, white head that disappears quickly. Hoppy and fruity aromas. Smooth on palate, hint of bitterness. Great beer.
Citrusy aroma, deep amber colour, brownish thick head. I love this brew. Its molty with lemons.

330ml bottle [Thanx, Klaus!]. Reddish amber/copper colour with average to huge, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Fruity and earthy hoppy aroma, hints of red and dark berries, some pine, coniferes. Taste reproduces identical flavours, moderate bitterness.

Finally a chance to try out some BrewDog brews in spite of having spent so many weeks in Scotland last year... but that was all about the scotch, no time for beer!
So this pours with a charming foggy body and a modest bit of head on top. Very strong sweet hop aroma, no layering of hops so it lacks complexity on the nose. Flavour is a strong floral hops note with a hint of caramel on the back end. Medium finish. Its a solid and reliable hoppy ale, nothing more, but its not like thats a bad thing.
Caña en Dublin. Color rojo ámbar. Espuma fina. Aromas florales, cítricos y ligero dulzor maltoso. Cuerpo medio. Final ligeramente amargo. Refrescante y sabrosa.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 27.4.2015: (8/4/7/5/16) From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 28/11/15 Pours almost clear dark rubby red liquid, medium frothy to soapy tan head, Aroma: beautiful maltiness - peat, citrusy, lemon grass, litchi, pomelo, grapefruit, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, citrus, lemon grass, light malty, bit hopy, nice, but some egg and metal off tastes appeares, Palate: medium body, slick to creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, long citrus hopy aftertaste. Overall: fair to very good, nice drinkability, nice maltiness, very harmonic, enjoyed.   21.04.2014: (8/4/7/5/16) From tap. Pours clear intensive dark red-amber liquid, big white to tan head. Aroma: intensive hoppy, litchi, american hops, resin, Taste: light body, heavy bitter, light sour, hops, light sweet, Palate: average to lively carbonation, long bitter aftertaste, Overall: very good, aromatic, bitter amber ale, only perhaps... would expect more in taste.

Nice clear red colour that has a nice white foam but disappears fairly quickly. Aromas of loads of hops, fruity and slightly tropical. Pineapple jumps out from the aromas and other tropical fruits follow. Smooth taste, just a hint of bitterness followed by some fruit sweetness then a little malt sweetness. Lovely

On the nose I get the floral notes of the hops, some pine as well. Palate, has the feel of a typical amber, pretty smooth, some caramel malt but more hoppy than most reds. Overall, a great example of the style.
Floral aroma and complex hop character with grapefruit and grassy notes. Medium carbonation and citrus bite.

0,33L bottle, BB 16.08.2014. Pours slightly hazy red copper with off white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is fruity, acidic, malt, slight diacetyl.Taste is sour, fruits, berries, grapefruit bitterness, but also some diacetyl. Overall: ok, but nothing special.
Drank with Rik 17/4/2014. Brown amber color. Smells really nice, hoppy. Taste also begins this way but finishes watery, it lacks depth.
Bottle from BrewDog online store. Dark ruby-copper, small white head, crystal malts, caramel, complex floral, fruity, citrusy hops, well balanced, medium body, dry but sweet finish. Really nice.
Amber rood/ bruin kleurig bier met een crème kleurige schuimkraag. Geur citrus en caramel. Smaak droog , mix van citrus caramel ,drop en tomaat .
Bruine kleur (amber?), troebel, amper schuim , ruikt naar wijn, metalig en hoppig. Smaak bevalt me niet. Niet zoet, niet fris, weinig bitter. Niet mijn ding.
Red amber color, not 100% clear. Poor white head, no co2 at the sight. The aroma is citrus, hoppy and astringent. Body is watery, light. Bitter taste, surprisingly refreshing and clean aftertaste.

(Flasche) Es hazt ein kupferne Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit winzigen floaties und mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr fruchtig, hopfig, Mandarine, Nektar und etwas Quitte. Der Geschmack ist schlank, recht bitter, etwas wie Herbstlaub riecht und retronasal fruchtig.
Bottle. Amber red color, little creamy head. Refreshing aroma of herbs with caramel tones. Taste was quite hoppy. Long bitter finish.

Quite possibly my favourite Brewdog Beer a lovely ruby red colour, not great head retention, a medium finish with a lovely fruity aftertaste I get plums. All in all a beer really worth seeking out, slightly better on draught than in the bottle.

On tap @ Brewdog Camden (Greater London). Almost clear amber with a medium beige head and heavy lacing. Aroma is hoppy and floral with caramel and fruity notes. Taste is floral with caramel, fruity notes, mint and no bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Petty good Amber Ale. Well balanced, tasty and drinkable.
A beautiful red ale. Aroma of tomatoes, sweet caramel, and fresh fruit. Taste of old toffee, caramelized cardboard, and tea.

Ruby red with cream orange head. Pleasant balance between rounded mal tines and aromatic hops, which give the beer a refreshing bitter note, but without being too invasive. A saint sinner for a warm midday.
Bue en bouteille de 33 cl. Belle couleur ambrée. Malts, caramel sans sucre. Pointe de citron en fin.
Not very red. Low head. Fresh fragrance. Bitterweet maltiness, restrained toffee flavor and some citrus in the finish.

Rich red colour with a slightly beige had that disappears quickly. The beer doesnt disappoint though with a flavour as rich as the colour. Pleasantly hoppy with a citrus tinge in the aftertaste. Up to the standard of the other brewdog beers!
Pours a deep red amber with a foamy yellowish head. Sweet and nose with a hint of flowers. Tastes a bit of copper and coffee. A quite short nice bitter aftertaste.

BrewDog 5 am Saint has a thick, soapy, cream-colored head, a very hazy, rust red/brown appearance, and some splotchy lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweet, pungent, tea-like malt, hop oil, and a bit of citrus. Taste is of those elements, with an overriding tannic character, bread crust, and a pleasant and noticeable, but not harsh, hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and BrewDog 5 am Saint finishes semi-dry and easy going. RJT
8/17/2010. From bottle. Amber color with a white head. Caramel aromas with a floral nose. Caramel flavors, but with so much hops on the finish. This is awesome.

Liquid is clear, color of light mahogany. Very nice color. Minimal head, average carbonation. Bitterness medium to heavy. Smells like elderflower and herbs, a hint of elderflower and grapefruit in aroma.
Faktiskt inte så latjo tycker jag. Ganska rå i smaken, ingen finess. Delvis tillhör det väl typen, men det finns väl bättre i klassen?

Gylden rødbrun i fargen med kremete beige skum. Humlelukten dominerer men kjenner også rosiner, mango, og en nøtteaktig lukt. Bitter søt smak, kjenner også den nøtteaktige smaken som jeg luktet. Kort lett bitter ettersmak.

Pours a dark coppery red. Small white head. Wonderful aroma of red berries, hops and malts. Taste is malty and caramel and some citrus. Mouthfeel has decent bitterness and carbonation, though especially the latter could be a little higher. But all together a wonderful beer.

- with thirst, Niklas

Pours a copper color. Very fruity aroma, like opening a bag of citrus fruits. Taste is full of hops with a little sweetness. Bitterness and lemongrass fill the mouth, leaving a bitter aftertaste. Great beer.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangegoldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, fruchtig, würzig. Geschmack malzig, fruchtig herb, leicht würzig.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, lupulo, suave.
bottle. amber with one finger head. moderate malt body with some depth. nice hoppy finish. about as good as an amber can get.
One of these at the end of a long night certainly is divine. Red brown pour. Hoppy taste leads into a nice balance with malts, dry bitter finish.
Underbar röd färg med lite skum. Fyllig fruktig doft. Fina tropiska aromer med understöd av Echinea och lakritsrot och en lätt frisk beska.
Härlig röd värg, doften var ingen hit i min mening. Mycket humlig men ej besk. Fint skum, inget större fel på ölet.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Tried this at BrewDog Nottingham. A really nice amber ale. Good balance of hop and malt. Love it.

From a bottle at home. Pour is interesting dark brown and cloudy. Taste is full of malts but not quite over the top. Yes, quite dull and more than average slight bitterness. It seems to have this slight tartness to it but it never really becomes apparent. A little medicinal for a lager lover. For an amber ale, IMHO, could use a few more manners. Not impressed. I have yet to find a brewdog that I can appreciate, my taste buds are not refined enough to enjoy these beers. Spent nearly $4 for this bottle, way too much.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 5am saint is a brilliant session beer with maximum mouth flavour without strong alcohol or burning out your palate a true craft beer amber ale
user_location: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, ENGLAND

text: 0.33l bottle. Pours clear reddish brown color with small beige head.. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, hops.. really great aroma. Taste is citrus, some other tropical fruits, caramel, biscuit, bready and grassy notes. Medium carbonation. One of best beers!
Coloração marrom, boa formação de espuma, com baixa persistência. Forte sabor de caramelo.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2014 Clear reddish brown color, medium sized head. Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation. Aroma is full of hops, pine, citrus and herbs with sweet malty caramel underneath. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Slightly dry finish. Very good.

Poured from 330mL bottle. Copper brown with tan head. Aroma of caramel malt with a hint of roasted malt, some hops and nuttiness. Lighter body, light bitterness. Something tells me this isnt necessarily indicative of this beer based on the other reviews. Ill re-rate in the future. For reference, this was batch 113 (best before 20-05-14).

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 Nice slightly hoppy aroma. Golden red copper color with orange yellow head. Great freshness taste with a slight hoppy feeling and slightly fresh bitterness of aftertaste. Have I found my all new favorite?? Need to try again and maybe rerate!
As promised, I rerate this. 
Increase the appearence to 5 as the red copper colour is really cool. On the other hand I decrease the overall to 17 and taste to 8. Still one of my favourites, still this nice citric aftertaste, but it lacks a bit of alcohol in the taste. 2 or 3 % more would make it just perfect. Excellent overall anyway!!

together with Yves at my home amber colored body with a white head and a spicy yeast hops aroma a spicy bitter hop dry taste with a dry bitter finishEarlier Rating: 7/24/2011 Total Score: 2.6amber coloured body with a off white head a spicy hoppy bitter aroma a hoppy bitter herby taste with a herby bitter finish

Flaska från SB. 
Vackert rödbrun i färgen med lite skum. 
Pga förkylning har jag svårt att sätta dofterna rättvist men söt och frisk. 
En bra röding som saknar lite kropp men ger en fin fräsch känsla i munnen.
I love lychees, so I love this beer. It smells like lychees, tastes like lychees and looks (and is) an excellent pint of red ale.
Redbrown color with no head. Grassy aroma from hops. The taste is similar, grassy but with a sweet malt body.
UPDATED: APR 17, 2014 Very nice fruity aroma. Could be more fullness in taste. Slight sweet-bitter interesting aroma. Woody

Bottle.
Amber with a beige head, no retention.
Aroma is spicy, sweet malty with some citrus/tangerine/grapefruit.
Taste has herbal (Nelson?) and citrus hops, well balanced with the caramel malt.
Medium body, high carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Dry herbal after taste.
On tap at Zubaty Pes, Prague. Pours amber with white head. Hoppy fruit aroma and flavor. Bitter dry finish.
Backlog. Tried the bottled version a number of times. Always love myself a red-ale, this is average though.

A dark reddish brown ale with a thick brown head, very nice. In aroma, nice burned caramel malt with catty and resinous hops, light point s of funky sulfur, still very solid. In mouth, a nice quasi vinous caramel malt with light peated character, oxidation which is actually nice with the the taste, faint sulfur, olde ale like. BB 16-05-12.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Very maltbased, tastes of caramel, with some resiny hop input. Light body, very high drink-ability.
Flaska från systembolaget. Brunröd färg med ljusgult skum. Blöt humlig doft med godistoner. Lätt frisk och blommig smak. Relativt lätt men bra beska
Bottle. Redbrown with pale brown head. Aroma hoppy floral notes and some notes of nuts. Taste initially bitter, then some nutty malt takes over. A nice beer.

5 AM saint, en röd ale med kraftigt skum som avtar ganska snabbt. Mer arom än smak och kropp. Trevlig!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Shared with Wim at his home. Amber colored beer with small white head and only few carbonation. Hopped malty hinted aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is bitter hopped. Saaz hop? A soft bitter hop.
Red color, small head. Aroma of hops. Some citrus. Taste of hops. Bitterness. Medium body.
Mums! Mycket god öl jag längtat efter hela dagen sedan jag läste om den på jobbet!

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 Dark red color with no head. Great fruity and herbal nose. Fruity, citrus and heavy hop aroma. Really long medium to heavy bitter finish and medium sweet. Full body (Pivkan; Vrutak 0,33l bottle)

Bottle 0,33l. Cherry juice like, red color. Clear. Medium-big head, which didnt exist very long. Lot of lacing. Aroma: smells beautiful: grapefruit, honey even some dark fruits. In flavour: for me something is missing. It is not so complex how would you expect. There is lemon, some grass. Hoppy. Maybe too dry for my taste. Overall: Good beer. Very refreshing.

Flaska från Systembolaget. Klar mörk bärnstensfärgad vätska med lågt tjockt skum. Blommig citrus med kåda. Smaken följer doften till punkt å pricka. Lite klen kropp men som en öl man bara ska dricka så är den riktigt trevlig. + för att den är riktigt snygg
Bottled. Reddish brown pour. Nice little aroma of earthy hops and malts and and some citrus. SImilar taste. Not a bad red ale, nothing amazing though.

Aroma: Fantastic notes if bright pine and citrus. Floral and sharp, I want this as a cologne it smells so good

Appearance: Orange almost red with an off white head

Taste: Bright highly floral with a slightly bitter finish

Palate: Thick almost milk like with carbonation that is present yet subtle

Overall:10/10 would drink again

Beige foamy full lasting head. Ruby mahogany colour. Aroma is hoppy with fruity (tangerine and grapefruit) with light spicy notes. Flavor is hoppy too with fruity (grapefruit, apricot and orange) tones, ending in a moderately hoppy finish. Light bodied.

330ml bottle. Amber/mahogany body with a medium white head. Caramel, pine, herbs and a bit floral notes lingering in the background. Quite nicely balanced.

//Rated via Beer Buddy
This is a beautiful amber ale. Deep flavour, great hops, lovely malt and just a fantastic brew:

Bottle from SATELLITE Bar- Dark amber color, decent beige head - Aroma is fruity, malty, red fruits, grapefruits and caramel - flavor of pine, resinous hops, citrusy, malty - Light body, medium bitterness, good carbonation, dry, long citrusy dry bitter finish - easy drinkable, easily findable in Switzerland
Aroma of hops and malts. Drinking out of the bottle. Nice balance of hops and malts here, not an outstanding amber but still definitely worth drinking!
Bottle 33cl. Brown with a light beige head. Aroma is green, fresh hops, taste is a bit sour,, citrus which undoubtly is from the hops. Relative short finish.

On draft @ McSorleys. Deep reddish mahogany color, small off white head that dissipates quickly. Nose is juicy aromatic hops, bready caramel malts, almost a rye characteristic. Taste is floral and hop resin with a strong malt backbone. Nice amber ale but after three, which I had many more of, it became a little trying.
From a plastic cup in Seoul. The smell is mild but the taste suprises with its fruitu hoppiness and medium bitterness. Great beer with pulled pork sandwich.

Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a dark caramel color with orange highlights and a medium sized creamy orange-white head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was some what rough fruity hops, caramel and a bit of crystal malt. The flavor was smooth and malty with notes of caramel, crisp fruity hops, a bit of tartness, bitterness and hints of bread and crystal malts. Medium length finish. Medium body. Pleasant.

Bottle from P&M-Getränke. Medium, foamy beige head with an amber, cherry color. Surprisingly intense hoppy aromas, containing orange, peach, apricot, hints of fig and malt undertones.

Very refreshing, bitter, fruity hops from the beginning, going along with a high, metallic carbonation. Malt plays only a secondary role, aggressive, edgy hops define this ale. Nevertheless the malts belt both, hop and flashy carbonation, together. The end is a bit too watery, with no bitter-, nor fruitiness left, just the metallic taste of the carbonation is still on the palate. A light-bodied beer with a chewy, sparkling mouthfeel, and just a short moment, of warm, earthy amber ale feeling, after the first impression is settled. This adds a pleasant complexity to the beer and lets it stand out from a usual IPA.

Bottle. Pour a clear RED with a thin tan head. Mild malt aroma. Taste is bitter, notes of grass, with floral. Warms to a malty undertone of cereal. Finish is a grassy bitterness. Warming mouthfeel. Very good! Probably one of the best amber ales Ive ever had.
A fine beer for this style with lots of the pine taste from the hops but the malt evens this one out pretty good.

Nice example of this style, quite hoppy, but earthy notes are too strong,good touch of fruitness and malts,  four great kinds of hops make their job and summing up - it is obligatory for everyone who like Amber Ale style.

Bottle - Reddish Amber in colour. Very Hoppy; resinous piney hops. Fruity; grapefruit citrus and some tropical fruit. Malty; sweet malts, caramel. Bitter very hoppy citrus fruity throughout. Very dry hoppy finish. Mega-Hoppy. Terrific beer!
Pours a browny red, white head with a high carbonation. Not much to it in the Jose, sought hoppy smell but overcome by the carared malt. Nice taste but the malt ruins the potential of the beer.

330ml Bottle. Amber colour beer with a tint of brown. Small light brown/cream coloured head, well laced. Aromas of pine and citrus with strong notes of caramel malts and passion fruit. Hints of pomegranate. Flavour is very malty with an initial caramel/toffee sweetness, which gives way to a bitter citrus tatse. Finish is dry and bitter, with notes of grapefruit and pine.
Murky amber,creamy beige head.Vague nose of malt/citrus hop. Bland malt palate with a vague hop finish. Great lacing

Rated on 4-21-2010 (Batch 30 - Best before 03/03/11) This beer forms a medium sized ivory head with a short retention, transparent orange body, soft carbonation, and spotty lacing. The aroma is caramel malt, earthy, pine, and citrus hops. The taste is bitter, citrus, pine, and earthy. The malt takes a backseat in the flavor. The palate is lightly carbonated and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, there is a definite hop presence in this beer. This beer is quaffable and worth trying.
A little heavy on the piney simco for my taste, but overall a good red ale. pleasant bitterness
Coloração vermelha bem bonita com boa formação de espuma.Aroma lupulado herbáceo e cítrico.Sabor caramelado do malte, com final seco e amargo.Ótimo drinkabillity.
Pours a reddish brown. Smells like grapefruit and a little like pine. Tastes of grapefruit and malts. Finishes with a slight bitterness.

Fruity, hoppy aromas; mango, passion fruit and pommegranate. Clear amber-red with tiny foam, taste is similar - first its very fruity, then comes the bitterness and nice, dry, hoppy finish. OK beer overall.

Un classico di Brewdog, la si trova ormai un po ovunque ma non per questo perde di valore. Amber ale superluppolata, che fa mostra di note fruttate, maltate e naturalmente di un amaro davvero irresistibile che accompagna il palato per tutta la bevuta. Ottima!
33CL bottle at home, red/amber beer with a small head, aroma is hops, taste is hoppy, bitter, malty. OK beer

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2014 Amber colour with lasting white head. Aroma is a little hoppy and fruity. Taste is malty with hints of caramel, medium bitterness, light sweetness. Medium bodied. I like the maltiness of it but there?s still some hoppiness to it which makes it even better.
330 mil bottle from low buy Lilydale aroma is hoppy fruity colour is red deep red taste is malty hoppy a little bit of caramel very nice could use more hops
This one poured a lighter red color with a beige head. aroma was of metal, caramel, and oxidation. Flavor was oxidation, grassy hops, or stale malt. Not too great.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 Très belle couleur rouge; arômes et goûts houblonnés (comme une IPA); un peu de fruits rouges; finale moyennement amère; une très bonne bière
Really hoppy aroma! IPA like! The taste is also very hoppy with some caramel and bread in the background. Bitter finish. A fairly low abv beer with a lot of taste!

Feb 2013. Bottle. Deep amber with high, lasting off-white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, mango, pine with some ripe apples and caramel. Good blance between caramel maltiness and hop bitterness. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Very good, sessionable beer.

Half pint @ mr foleys Leeds . Dark red in colour . Sting hop nose, mango, passion fruit, orange, very fruity indeed. Taste is fantastic, with a long bitter finish. An easy drinking 5% beer. Served too cold for my liking though. Had to wait for it yo warm for the aromas and flavour.
500m bottle, Dublin. 5%. Dark amber with minimal head. Decent ale. good balance of malt and hop flavours Tasty and light. Very drinkable, and says give me another one of those!

33cl cap bottle
Appearance: Pours a Dark amber with
Aroma: Citrus Hops, some caramel, Finish is a bit light.
Taste: Starts with citrus hops followed by caramel an a hint of bread. Finish is a bit light.and the carbonation just gives it a to spritzy feeling.

creamy texture, soft to medium carbonation
bottle, Great amber ale, well balanced hop and malt flavors. Deep red color, character and complexity in this brew.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Bottle Cape Town. Pours clear coke redbrown amber with small head and medium carbonation, slight lace. Amazing fruity lichi hoppy citrus aroma right away. Caramel and molasses after. Taste is slight bitter. Overall very enjoyable the body after the intial taste could be improved.
Red Ale sulla carta ma luppolata al pari di una IPA coi controcazzi, bei profumi e un corpo bilanciato,molto beverina

Cerveja lupulada com toques frutados. Aroma muito semelhante às IPAs, coloração bem avermelhada, algo de caramelo no sabor. Retrogosto amargo mas balanceado. Cerveja saborosa, com belo corpo e boa espuma. Simplesmente sensacional.

DWG; Pours hazy amber to cobber with frothy, lasting and lacing off-white to tan head. To, to. Nose fills with fruity pee, malt, caramell and citrus. Taste mirrors. Medium body, crispy texture and avarage to soft carbonation. To. Lasting dry, fruity finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DWS Amber colour with nice foam.
Sugary and citrusy aroma with a hint of sewage.
Taste is hoppy, fruity and bittersweet. Crispy carbonation.
Interresting :)

Bottle, well chilled. Fantastic fruity, dry hopped aroma, initial sweet fruits give way to the classic brewdog dry hop hit. Have had this before, but cant remember it being this good. Would be a great introduction for a non beer drinker into the wonderful world of craft.

Bottle. Dark amber pour with red tinge and pillowy cream colored head. Aroma of malts, earthy, and hops. Taste of caramel malts, faint hops and slight fruitiness. Medium bodied, higher carbonation and quick crisp end to the flavors after sipping. Very good beer for the style, very drinkable.
A: Dark amber to brown, small head. S: Hops, hops, floral, citrus. Tint of malt. T: Herbal, grassy, goes into bitterness aftertaste. M: Medium to thin, not too dry. O: Hoppy ale.
I am not a big fan of super hoppy beer, but this delicious red ale goes down smooth with just the right amount of hop flavor. A new favorite for me.
Bottle. Aroma is intensive, sweet, of citrus fruit (orange, red grapefruit), yeast, a little bit of resin. Brown colour. Light bitterness. Medium body. Very good one.
Bottle. Pours dark amber with off white head. Aroma is malty sweet with notes of raisins. Flavour is malty with caramel, toffee and dried fruits and some bitterness.

Aroma: malty, sugar, hint of spice cookies. Color: ruby red with a tan head. Lite carbonation. Coating mouth feel, smooth and even beer. Gentle hop flavors, definitely leans to the malty flavor side. Even consistent flavor throughout. Nice lingering finish.

Caña en el lupulo 08-01-14 a los 5 días de pinchado y botella (julio de 2012). Aromas especiados y hervaceos. Color ambar oscuro con poca espuma blanca. Cuerpo ligero bastante fácil de beber. Sabor también ligero, maltoso y hervaceo con cierto amargor final. Buena y refrescante.
Not as fresh as it should be but it seems like a really solid beer. Simcoe hops all around will win me over most of the time.
It pours with a deep amber color with a light tan pillow head. There are some decent malt notes, but nothing that is overly striking. It rather smooth on the way down which is good to the palate.
A excellent beer that provides a nice change from the more popular Anglo pale ales styles. Complex and balanced - and not too strong to boot (which allows one to safely enjoy another).

2012-05-08
Honungstonad, humlearomatisk doft. Lätt friskhet, aning metal. Fruktpuré.
Sur brygd. Kantig och förvånansvärt smaklös. Hö. Mycket blaskig och med en torr avslutning. Är det månne en bakissmak kl 5 på morgonen som försöker efterliknas?
caramel, citrus, amber, red, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, medium body, lively, long finish,
Köpt på systembolaget i ett fyrpack med tre andra brewdog öl. Kommer inte riktigt ihåg denna öl vilket borde ge den lite lägre betyg.
Mørkerød med blød humlearoma. Lav carb. Markant frugtig humle som balanceres godt af malt. Tør. God og letdrikkelig.
Velmi pitelné polotmavé pivko. Chuťově jako kdy IPA potká porter, hodně příjemná kombinace. U se těím na dalí BrewDogy. Lahváč z Pivoňky.
Floral hops dominate the malt, a little thin, too much hop for the malt to take. The Hardcore IPA pulls it off, this one doesnt have enough strength of body to fight the fierce hops back.
Amber/red, white head. Pine hop aroma, nutty caramel malt character. Oily texture low-medium carbonation. Good beer.
Bottle @ Mother-in-laws. Pours Amber/red, big white head. Nice is pine and hops. Huge grapefruit bitterness/tartness, a touch grassy and with some toffee sweetness at the end.

Bottle. Pours a hazy red with a white head. Lovely, big hoppy aroma with pear, lemon and melon. Light body, medium to full carbonation. Rye bread, a little caramel, lemon, orange. Pretty tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark amber with medium light beige head. Aroma of hops, caramel, black currant juice. Taste of caramel, coffee, grapefruit bitterness. Finish is bit odd (earthy, or leaves, smt like that), but its still pretty drinkable.
on tap. clear medium to dark amber with medium head. aroma is mostly citrusy hops along with biscuity notes. taste is similar. moderate dry finish.

Aroma: biscuit malts, hops very noticeable. Appearance: dark amber, reddish-white head. Taste: pleasantly sweet. Palate: medium fizz, sweetness turns bitter quite quickly. Overall: great Amber Ale - the hops add a nice kick. Pint at the Brew Dog Shoreditch, London

330ml bottle. Deep red colour, no issues in the appearance. Lots of hops in the taste and smell, but the malt holds up. Nice balance of hop qualities. I can see how this really is one of the archetypes of the hopsy amber ales.
330 ml bottles. Pours a red/brown with light head. Aromas of red fruit and pine. Flavors of dried red berries, malts, hibiscus, and red licorice. Quite dry. Nice.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Bottle. Aroma has hops, tropical fruits and some caramel. Bitter start but sweetness comes trough in nice a bit hoppy aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, coffee, hops, fruits.
Pours a clearish dark brownish-red with a small beige head. Aroma: Hops, grass, slight hints of peach. Palate: Thick bodied, smooth, long finish. Taste: Slightly bitter. Nice balance. Slow drinking.
Clear red beer with a thin head. Aroma is malt mixed with grassy, citrusy hop. Taste has an initial tangy hit with a dry mix of hop and malt. Finish is light, fruity and a bit dry/sour.
12 oz bottle, poured a nice reddish amber. Good malty taste with a mild hop finish. Taste was pretty mild. Decent for an amber.
Étiquette stylé et moderne, belle couleur, bon arôme, goût de fruit, très oublonné.... Tes bonne bière.
Bottle shared by Frahmo clear redish amber. Small tan head. Papery malty aroma Remarkably little hop aroma. Thin papery flavor with pale malt notes. Lite bodied and a little IBU bite at the end.

Continuing my acquaintance with Brewdogs masterpieces. 
True amber-reddish colored body topped by a proper heavy beige head.
An amazing combination of ripe pineapple, fresh squeezed lime and caramel malty notes, a bit piney also.
Taste is completely unbalanced towards bitterness, but I like it. Some toffee behind this curtain of bitterness, and also there is a correct earthy tartness that suits to red ale style. Medium-to-almost-full body, lively carbonation. Lingering bitter finish, pretty drinkable though..

I picked one up in my local Sainsburys, mainly because I havent tried it before and didnt really know what to expect from an amber ale (having not knowingly tried one before).

Appearence: It looks decent enough, certainly more interesting than a standard bitter.

Smell: Hoppy and malty, didnt blow me away but then I tried it at below room temperature.

Taste: Powerful hop bitterness straight away, reminding me slightly of Punk IPA. Pine like and citrusy which then subsides and the maltyness comes through. Certainly more interesting than I was expecting!

Palate: The sharp bitterness of the hops at the start prevent it from being watery or bland. Mildish carbonation.

Overall: A surprising beer, one which I wasnt really expecting much from. I am pleased I took the plunge and although not overly complex taste wise I could imagine this being a very nice session beer.

Couleur : cuivrée. Nez : très fruité, caramel, sève de pin, des fruits rouges qui la rendent assez originale, pêche et un côté exotique (ananas). Bouche : très fruitée, une très belle amertume (qui fait plus que 25 ibu je trouve) la rend très désaltérante. On a toujours la sève de pin, des fruits rouges, du pamplemousse et de la mangue. Finale : longue, sur lamertume, le caramel et le pamplemousse, elle nest pas trop asséchante, et désaltère bien.

Tap at the Beer House Paddington, amber-brown with a lacing fine beige head, toasty seville orange and grapefruit nose, pine and marmalade hops on the palate followed by caramel toffee and a juicy bitterness. The only spoiler is the slight cloying sweetness in the finish.
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur ambrée forte et une mousse qui tombe vite. Une excellent bière très houblonné racé avec une grosse pointe de litchi et citronné, excellent produit.

Cerveza ámbar con capa de espuma ligera. Sabor dulce y lupulado con final semi-amargo. Se notan los lúpulos de adición última con poco hervido y dry-hop. Apta para lúpulo-adictos. De lo mejor en su estilo.
Ruby red color with low white head. Aroma of malts, caramel and some hops. Taste is malty and caramel with medium bitterness and fruity from hops. Very drinkable

Looks great but was a little disappointed. Ruby red with an off white head that sticks around awhile. Light malty and hop aroma and light caramel, hops, flavor. Unexpectedly light body, with a slight metallic aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Color ámbar claro, media capa de espuma perdurando unos mms, buenos aromas a lúpulo fruta y madera, en boca trago con amargor medio que desaparece en el posgusto, sabor a té rojo y matices salados.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 My favourite amber ale!! 
Très équilibré, pas trop amère, juste comme il faut
J adore son gout de houblon avec un once de rouille

Roodachtig bier met medium schuimkraag, fruitig zoet en niet al te sterk bier. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark red color, light golden head. Roasted malt nose, dried fruit. Liqourice taste, coffee, caramel malt, hops. Medium body.
One of the most balanced beer from Brewdog. Amber color. Nutty and malty. Recognizable flavor from Brewdogs hop-mix with Nelson Sauvin.
Good aroma, caramel and hops. I like the darker reddish amber color. Good balance between hops, malt and the relatively low bitterness. Very easy to drink. Recommended!
UPDATED: JUL 12, 2014 Pours a dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of fruits, grains, orange peel, caramel, a number of hops. Dry medium bitter finish. This is quite a tasty thirst-quencher.
Clear amber reddish appearance with medium low head. Citric aroma with hay and grassy notes. Low sweetness, medium high bitterness. Very satisfying aroma and taste, decent palate, great Amber Ale.

Smells really good, hoppy and fruity. 
Looks good, clear red with no saturation. Light brown head, foamy texture and stable.
Tastes good, light bitternes, bit sweet. The taste is rather subtle, a little bit malty also. 
Feels good in the mouth, light bitter aftertaste that lingers for a while.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je velmi příjemné chmelové s nádechem oříků. Pěna je lehce nahnědlé barvy, jemná, středně vysoká a průměrně drící. Barva samotného piva je opálová. Chuť je sladová s lehkým kávovým nádechem. okraje jsou příjemně sladové, fini je jemně hořký s lehkým nádechem jahod a drící. Jedná se o chuťové velmi zajímavé pivo, dobré pitelnosti.

The complex aroma of this beer is distinctive. The variety of hops give a definite characteristics to the beer. Amber color and a nice head adds to the value of the beer. The carbonation level is great but the texture could be a little bit more creamy. Though the long finish makes me love this beer. A must try beer.

Red-brown color, thin white head. Aroma of caramel, notes of grass and herbs mixed with citral notes. Taste is very complex, on the one hand youve got the caramel and chocolate notes of the dark malts, on the other hand the citral and earthy hop notes. Very interesting! What I dont like is the low carbonation.

On the nose: bread/caramel/biscuits and slight pine. Really pleasant array of aromas. 

Appearance: deep ruby color, very inviting.

Taste: Pretty similar to the nose, the caramel really comes through, not really a huge hop presence, but theres a lovely bready aftertaste. 

The only weak point of this beer for me is the mouthfeel; itd be so much better if it were a bit thicker. Its an awesome tasting beer and if it was just a bit more syrupy I feel thatd go great with the caramel taste thats so abundant in this beer. 

Overall this is a great beer and one of my go to beers for a session. Could drink this all night. Great chilled on a summer evening and great at room temperature during the colder months. I love this beer.

11.2oz bottle from Manahawkin Spirits. Pours a slightly hazy dark amber color with a finger of fast fading foamy tan head. Aroma of sweet grapefruit, tangerine, and caramel malt. Taste is similar to the nose. Lots of grapefruit and tangerine up front, toasted and caramel malts follow, and grassy/piney notes in the finish.

Butelka 0.3L. Brunatne z plywajacymi niewielkimi klaczkami. Piana bujna, ciemnokremowa drobno- i sredniopecherzykowa. W aromacie glownie zapachy amarykanskich chemili: slodkie owoce jak mango oraz cytrusy. Dodatkowo wyczuwalne toffe i aromaty chlebowe. 
W smaku podobnie do aromatow ale bardziej w strone ciemnego pieczywa, brazowych slodow i chleba.
Goryczka na poziomie srednim polaczona z owocowymi posmakami na finishu, bardzo przyjemna. 
Cialo srednie, moze lekko wodniste, wysycenie srednie.
Bardzo dobrze zbalansowane i pijalne piwo ale chyba blizej mu do brown niz amber ale.

Bottle from Canals. Pours out an attractive ruby red color with a small white head. Aroma is of caramel, piney/citrusy hops, mild floral notes and lingering sweetness. Taste is complex and rather well balanced. Sweet caramel, light toast, pine/citrus/lightly floral hop bitterness, bread crust and a touch of bitterness in the finish. Solid.
Bottle @ home. En fin overraskelse! Blev denne efter at smidt den inden ud. Fin frugtig duft af humlen. Frugtig humlet smag uden det bitre slut. Fin ravrød farve med lidt skum. God øl!

Cerveja punk. Aroma frutado excelente. Amargor marcante do lúpulo, sabor gostoso, desce fácil, pois tem um graduação alcoólica boa. Recomendo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber with a small white head.Sweet fresh aroma, peaches, mango. taste is slightly bitter, reasonable lot of carbo, some tannines.Sweetish fruit, apricot and mango. Nice freshness, lots of taste for a beer with that low abv!

Color caramelo filtrada con espuma color marfil de buena formación. Aromas lupulados suaves con ligeros toques de azúcar moreno. En boca es ligera con un dulzor inicial muy leve que acaba con un amargor resinoso y seco muy equilibrado. Muy agradable y fácil de beber

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Beautiful dark red with yellow head. Aroma is red fruit, herbs, white wine, caramel malt, pine, earth, citrus and floral hops. round, fruity and slick mouth feel. aftertaste is dry white wine, bitter floral hops, some sweet caramel and lasting dry fruit finish. Overall: Amazing! incredible well composed session beer.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2013 Bottle 330ml @ home from Polet. Pours red with big fluffy head. Aroma is hops and caramel. Herbs. Fruit as well. Tropical, peach? Not too fond of the aroma actually. Maybe it?s the peach I don?t dig. The herbs? ResinDon?t know. Fortunately the taste is much better. Hops, caramel, fruits and a fine bitterness to round things up. Not deeply impressed, but ok.

Aroma: Herbal, caramel, hints of spice and liquorice.
Appearance: Amber, tinged with red. Hazy with minimal head.
Taste: Slightly sour, liquorice start moving to a distinct biscuity, dank finish
Palate: Light and slightly oily, strong carbonation and a sharp bitter finish.
Overall: Good, solid amber ale. Remarkably English characteristics given the hop list.
Fantastic. Just what an Amber should be, beautiful rich colour, perfect balance

Appearance: Clear amber/ruby with a short lived ivory head.
Aroma: Grapefruit, pine, lychee, black-currant and toast.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium/high bitterness and low/medium sourness.
Palate: Thick rough texture, light/medium body, prickly carbonation, astringent lingering finish of fruity bitterness.
Comments: Very tasty. No glass lace.
Awesome looking, perfect head. Dark amber body. Balanced sweet malt, nice bitterness. Really nice amber.

Great citrus aroma, which maybe doesnt stay in your nose forever, but pleasantly caresses your nostrils. Beautiful deep red amber color with ideal lasting head. Very tasty, hoppy with a very good malty backbone. The finish is not long and could be more bitter. It lacked just this last extreme moment to be my favorite beer. Still, pure class from BrewDog!

Bottle @ home. Colore giallo ambrato carico, velata, con schiuma beige chiaro finissima abbastanza persistente. Profumo di malti torrefatti, chicchi di caffè e verdura cotta. Di corpo medo/forse un po debole in booca accentua lamarognolo che ricorda il radicchio.Gusto intenso non molto persistente. Nonostante il dry hopping in realtà è armonica, non troppo luppolata al naso e nemmeno troppo in bocca. Retrolfattivo di noce fresca.
Pours dark amber, straw head. Fruity aroma, slight citrus. Fairly bitter, tastes quite malty too. Fairly dry palate. Would be a nice beer to drink a lot of, if it wasnt for the price.

Aroma muito bom, frutado, um pouco adocicado. Cor vermelha nao muito escura. Gosto cítrico, lembrando maracujá. Uma amber ale para ser apreciada.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Creamy aroma with notes of berries and grapefruit. Taste is light but pleasant. Fresh fruit with some malty sweetness balanced by a healthy hop presence. Finish is light. A great session beer.

Pours a deep red with small off white lacy head. Aroma is hops with a thick overlay of sweet caramel. Taste is smooth and well rounded. The forward taste of hops is followed by caramel, before coming to a drawn out slightly dry end. A superbly drinkable beer.

Is everybody drinking the same 5 a.m. Saint as I am? I love reds, and the claim that this is the god of reds is a joke. I like many brews from the dog, but this is awful. It has zero body and is watery and bland yet sour too. I'm very disappointed in this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark amber in colour with an off white head. Mild scent of hops. Smooth taste with hints of caramel, and a pleasant bitter finish.
Amber pour with creamy off white head and lace. Sweet caramel and resiny hops. Sweet caramel and a good resiny bitter finish. Medium bodied but a bit fizzy.

12oz bottle, sampled at the request of lizardville staff, the dry hopping is what makes this beer a 3+ for me, without that it would be a boring amber. Long live the hops.

Consumed while watching the Cleveland Browns, in a factory of sadness.

33 cl bottle @ home, from Geers Oostakker; orange coloured with medium head; medium carbo; smell is exotic fruits, wood, hoppy; taste is wood, little dryness, medium bitterness, hoppy. Interesting and quite nice, but the aroma is more pronounced than the taste.

This beer is always worth getting back to it. Very aromatic - American hops, we all know them very well already. However these guys managed to find a perfect balance between amazing aroma and bitterness. The effect is powerful but not overwhelming. The head could be more foamy, but lets not be too picky, the tap version is perfect, the bottle version is good. Quite dry on palate however it can be just me tasting many Belgians recently. The finish is mainly roasty, caramely and bitter which builds into quite complex show. 
Overal 5 AM? Anytime, even if its 5 AM in the morning.

Bottle 
Pours amber 
Good white foam 
Hoppy smell
Good carbo . Typical brewdog hops , with some walnuts in the background . Intresting stuff !
Bottle. Pours clear amber with a lacy off-white head. Aroma is caramel, bread, leather, floral and cereal. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Medium body and quite fizzy.
Bottle 33 cl. Amber, clear with a nice foamy orange head. Aroma of malt, peach, hops and some caramel sences. Light bittersweet taste with a soft hoppy end. Ok
Bottle. Pours dark amber with a slight layer of off white head. Aroma of malts. Nice smooth taste with hints of malts and a slight bitterness.

Açık maun renkte, kırık beyaz köpük. Köpük çok yoğun değil,bardakta gazlılık da yüksek değil. Koku kompleks, tatlı, şerbetçiotu ve karamel kokuları hakim.. Tadım yine kompleks, şerbetçiotu acılığının yanında tatlı ve kavrulmuş malt hissediliyor, damakta açıklık kalıcı.. Net, kompleks, başarılı..

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 Bottle. Dark amber with off-white head. Aroma of malts and hops. Very hoppy with hints of malt. Bitter and tangy aftertaste

Nice dark mahogany colour, tanned head. Smells quite sweet and fruity. Taste is lovely roasted nutty caramel type thing again with some tangy frutiness and a nice bitter/sweet balance. Quite a lot going on with this beer. Another fine beer from Brew Dog

Herrlich frisches Citrus Aroma, leich orangener Schaum der schnell zerfällt. Leicht hopfig, wenig malzig, ausgewogen.

Garrafa 330ml. Cor âmbar, vermelho cereja. Pouca espuma, não branca. Aroma lupulado e maltado, com notas de frutas vermelhas. Gaseificada, paladar é maltado em equilíbrio com torrefação. Final amargo e refrescante.

330ml bottle at home. Pours clear light red-brown with a pillowy white head, good lacing. Big piney and spicy aromas, some grass, fruit and nuts. A lot of hop bitterness, then dark sugar-sweet, maybe toffee. Bitter finish. Good.
33cl bottle at home. Clear amber/red with a medium white head. Medium body with ditto carbonation. Great balance between malts and hops. A very decent ale.

(Bottle): Pours amber with a small off white head. Aroma of hay, grapefruit, peaches, tropical fruit juice and caramalts. Hoppy flavour with the citrus and tropical fruit notes following. Some malt and caramel elements but mostly a nice hop bitterness dominates, but not overpowering at all.
330ml bottle - Dark rich bronze amber colour, aroma of hay and autumn wheat. One of the weaker of the Brew Dog offering

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2016 Amber color with medium and long head. Really nice aspect.aromas: Peach, pine, black fruits and a bit of caramel. Medium body and pleasant carbonation. Nice bitterness and slightly sweet. Dry and long finish. One great beer for the summet. I love it.

Filip
Good amber IPA. Nice combination of hops, fruits and a bit caramalt. And the Nelson Sauvin is amazing as always.
Bottle->shaker at RFD. Amber with small offwhite head. Caramel and malt with some light citrus hops. Brighter than most amber ales I have had, and pretty good overall.
Dunkel brun farve med beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell og kaffe. Smak av malt, sjokolade, karmell, honning og kaffe. Patriks.

Pours medium brown with a small tan head. Aroma is peach, honey, passionfruit, caramel. Taste is caramel, honey, peach, hay.

Full peppery hops, fills the nose completely. When poured it has a light brown, watery appearance. Classic, clean, pure hoppy brown bitter. Nice and full palette.

Sweet bitter full bodied aroma. You can really smell the red. Its a hazy medium red with a lil bit of white head. It has a sharp bitter taste at first and a very malty flavor. Its almost like a sour tart and bitter taste all at once. Very complex.the aftertaste is sweet and slimy. Not a horrible red but not for me

Donker amber. hoppig, grapefruit aroma. Smaakt naar citrusfruit, hoppig. Bittere afdronk die smaakt naar meer.

Im more of an IPA fan than one of red/amber ales. So this is pretty much as good as a red ale can get for me. Theyve taken a traditional style with delicious biscuit, caramel flavour in the malts and added a lot of new world hops to freshen it up. Not at all stale like all the Smithwicks I used to drink. Thanks BrewDog.
Deep chestnut color with nice off-white head. Aroma of grapefruity hops. Taste of mid-caramels with a hoppy finish. Not a typical American amber, but a very good one.
Good beer, not complex, very hoppy balanced, easliy drinkable, a beer for all the day!
Outstanding creation from Brewdog. Fruity and hoppy on the nose, bittersweet on the tongue and doesnt hurt that it looks gorgeous in the glass. The king of beers.
Vrij weinig maar mooi schuim en goede kleur. Geur is typisch IPA en smaak ook, lekker dus!
0,33l bottle. Amber color. Aroma is fruits, hops and citrus notes. Taste is similar to the aroma with distinctive hops and citrus notes. Very nice bitterness. Overall its great beer.

Nose caramel, toffee, brown sugar, slight mint and some tropical notes from the NS hops. Lovely Nose. Taste is caramel leading to burnt sugar with a the hops emerging in the finish to give, peach apple with a dry finish. Mouthfeel is a touch thin. 

A really nice subtle beer with a lovely nose.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Tap. Chmielarnia, Warsaw. Very dark amber beer (without strong lights i would think thats stout). Aroma: Sweety floral and resin. Taste is very intensive: from medium bitter to light wild cherry. Nice, but its not unforgiving beer ;)

Appearance:caramel, nose: caramel, flowers, booze. The palate is full of bitterness, citrus flavors. There is a pretty pronounced caramel aftertaste again. Overall a very nice ale that is more a nose beer than a mouth beer. Its anyway a lot about caramel here...

bottle. clear red with a large, whipped, beige head. toffee with hints of toast and dough with some citrusy hops in aroma. a robust english inspired malt profile with nutty, peanut-like notes and a span of crystal malts but with a mean average in the 75-80 range maybe. i get an herbal hop note in the finish and some lemony, citrus as well. medium body and sweetness. been a long long time since ive had a brewdog brew.
Great beer. Amber reddish. Tastes like celery and pepper. Hoppy nose. Cascade? Had at BrewDog Bristol. Great place. On tap.
I love this beer. Beautiful color, floral aroma, full of pleasant taste. Beer for every occasion.
Good beer. Amber colour, medium head. In aroma citrus, malts and hops. A little bit sweet, but this will not last as bitterness will kick in.

Clear amber color with medium and long lasting head. Nice aroma of caramel, malts and citrus hops. Taste is firstly sweet (caramel and mango) and resin aftewards appears medium bitterness which lasting on the tongue quite long. Very good and very drinkable session beer.

#2000
I was sure Ive reached it on a tasting with Marko and ogivlado a month before this, but well, mods have done its job merging and aliasing both possibly same and very different beers/radlers... Anyhow, a nice way to celebrate my new milestone, had 0.33 l bottle of this at Mali Flek pub, Split, Croatia on June, 25th. It poured hazy copper body with small white head. Fine fruity aroma, orange hops, peach and tropical fruits. Lightly sweet malty, but also slightly bitter hop flavor, makes it simple, refreshing, yet tasty and pretty full bodied brew. Fruity, peaches, toast and orange all the way through with both pleasant and long sweetish finish. A nice surprise, really a good one!
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Fruity flower flavors, cherry, grapefruit, rich caramel, bitter dry finish. Brewdog-style hoppy brew, not the most subtle but quite efficient.

Aroma: hoppy (resin and light citrus).
Appearance: clear amber color, no head.
Taste: nice (resin & pine) bitterness, dry.
Palate: low carbonation, medium body, nice long bitter finish.
Overall: The icon of the style, not outstanding and not disappointing, very nice bitterness, but only one-dimensional.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 Precioso ámbar oscuro. Espuma perfecta, persistente. Con mucho cuerpo a pesar de no tener muchos grados. Intenso aroma frutal y floral con notas cítricas pero sin ser una explosión de lúpulo.  Sabor intenso, amargo, muy equilibrado con el dulce de la malta. Por decir algo negativa quizás demasiado carbonatada.

@ Röhällavägen. Flaska från Kvickly, Helsingör (15 DKK). Bärnstensfärgad med en rejält humlig doft av tallbarr, citrus, fläder och exotiska frukter. Mycket amerikanskt humle i smaken. Medelfyllig med bra beska.

A great red ale. Lots of fruity and floral aromas and flavours. Had at brewdog pub in shore ditch. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Bottle. Dark amber with reddish reflections and a small, frothy, mostly to fully diminishig off-white head. Aroma is fruity, caramel, peach, orange, grapefruit. Flavor is heavy sweet and light bitter. Dry, hoppy, slightly bitter finish. Aftertaste is kinda waterish. Not very exciting.

Bottle. Clear red colour with low steady head and medium body. Nose of aromatic hops and citrus. Taste of intense but mild aromatic hops, light malt, citrus, spruce and grass. Very dry and medium bitter finish. It was as good as expected. Enjoyed it a lot. Maybe it was a little bit too week and thin in character and body.

Once again BrewDog put up big numbers here. Citrus hoppy nose with an interesting clear amber look. Bit thin on the tongue. Slightly bitter end. From start to end full of aromas - reminded me my first London Pride. Very good one for sure.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 Flaske fra polet: Brewdogs ordgyterier har en tendens til å være tøvprat, og mye av sorten. Det som er interessant er at de kjører på med humle: "Simcoe, Chinook, Nelson Sauvin, Centennial. Twist: Loads of late hops and bucket-loads of dry hops", og det gjør virkelig noe for aromaen. Jeg blir allikevel litt skuffet etter de første munnfullene, den er god men har ingen umiddelbar staying power. Skulle vært interessant å prøve denne fra fat. Iconoclastic, my foot. Fra fat på Kooperstiven Nordsiden, Hønefoss: vi kommer rett fra Hønefossrevyen og heldigvis er der plass ved bardisken. Mye fint fatøl å velge i, og denne var en av de vi hadde. God aroma av citrus, blomster og brent sukker. Kraftig smak med middels munnfylde og bitterhet, en fruktig amber ale med noe brent karamell/knekk mot slutten. Kort skum.
A red colored ale. The taste is balanced though is a BrewDog beer so is easy to drink.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2013 Mooie roodbruine kleur. Goede maar weinig schuim. Ruikt, kruiden, hop en iets honing. Smaakt ligt en fris. Lekkere hop tonen. Lekker tussendoor bier.

amber ale escocesa claramente inspirada en las cervezas americanas. mas lupulo que malta, que aunque no sea lo propio del estilo, a mi me gusta. aroma muy marcado por lúpulos citricos, con una pequeña base de malta caramelo. en sabor tambien mucho lúpulo pero poco amarga. aqui si que se nota más las maltas dulces. curiosa.
amber ale, 330ml, 5%. Malté, caramel, bien houblonné, pamplemousse, orange confite, miel, fleur, fruit confit, raisin sec, finale sèche. Minoume
33cl bottle. dark ruby colour with hoppy aroma. taste is bitter and spicy with a long lasting oily dry mouthfeel.

It pours a dark opaque color with a beige head. A nice floral hop aroma with citrus/pine notes and a caramel malt base. the flavor is hop forward, quite bitter & hoppy for an amber ale. I think it is made for people who like IPAs, good but not for me.
Keg @ Beer House, Waterloo. Was never convinced by the bottle, tastes better from the keg. Cold, fruity, hoppy, refreshing.
Pours a reddish brown hazy brown. Nose is malty with caramel. Taste is a well balanced blend of malts and hops, sweet and flavorful. Finishes smoothly with no real lingering . quaff score 7 / 10

Pours an amber orange with a white head and aroma of caramel, hops, and fruits. Taste is well balanced, of sweet malt, hops, caramel, grapefruit, and other fruity notes with a bitter finish. Drinkable, solid amber ale

Very malty as you expect, great balance between hops and malts. A really pleasant drinkable brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330mL. Oh Lordy Lordy, a red ale that doesnt suck. Clear amber-reddish pour with a bubbly white head, sticky lacing. Aroma is a bucket load of floral, citrusy hops. Taste is mild caramel malty sweetness, with a powerful punch of hop textures. Medium carbonation, mild alcohol warmth, medium bodied. This redhead beats a trashy blonde anyday, despite its soul questionability.

Complex aroma of fruits, citrus, hops and malts. Medium, lasting head with good lacing. Dark ruby body. Also complex taste of fruits, malts and hops with very good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Delicious long-lasting aftertaste.

On tap. Ruby-like body, with a low white head that leaves a fair lace. Nothng special on the aroma side really, some malts, but taste is something different. Medium bitter, with notes of hops and caramel, very nice. Medium carbonation, oily texture, medium body. Nothing too special, but a good one.

Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Malt,caramel,fruit,floral and strong citrus aroma ; Clear amber color with smaller lasting head ; Medium sweet and heavier bitter taste ; Long bitter finish ; Fuller body ; Superb ale.

Bottle from Asahiya. Deep, tangy citrus nose, with some dirty loamy notes. Murky brownish color, light tan head. Concentrated grapefruit initial/ caramel and crackers in mid / smooth and tasty finish, with light hop tracks remaining. Medium body. Nicely done. Hops are omnipresent but not overwhelming.

Good beer.  Not the most fantastic from this company.  I think that many other craft beers have caught up with them and made this flavour combination popular, so I felt I had tasted it before.  Light and grassy with citrus hops, a dry finish with a citrus tingle on the tongue lasting for some time later.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours dark copper with a small lacing head, nice color. Fruity aroma. Notes of sweet caramel, citrus. Malts and hops. Not what i expected at the moment but okey ale.
Dark and reddish brown colored beer. Hops aroma. Taste has fruity characters, bacon and smoke.
Pours dark red with yellowish head. Aroma of nuts and chocolate with smells of forrest. Taste is nutty, sweet caramel. Full bodied, med carbonation. Good beer
Grassy hops and citrus in the aroma.  Flavor is rich and nutty, with a dry, earthy finish.  Different while remaining true to the style, and most importantly, really good.

Rich amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of floral hops, caramel malt, & some fruit; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, citrus, some grain, and spice; Finish is dry and slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good - I enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2014 Copper orange clear beer with plenty of off-white head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma has caramel malts sweetness, nuts, resin and piney fresh hops. Taste is caramelly malty sweet, nutty and piney bitter. Finish has lots of bitterness with resin. Little fuller than medium full palate, medium carbonation. I liked this better when I was new to craft beer.

Bottle. Amber colour. Great hops. Berries, sweet aroma. Bitter longlasting taste.

Wow! Very hoppy, fruity, floral amber ale. A lovely amber colour and a great foamy  head. resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, hay, ginger this beer has it all. A nice complex ale due to huge amount a different hops varieties added using different hopping methods. The appearance is amber to red but clear. A nice full bodied beer that is smooth and lively. A great beer from one of my favourite breweries.

12 oz. served into a SA perfect pint glass.

A - Slightly hazy amber with a 1 finger lightly tan head. Some lacing left

S - Toasted bread, caramel malt, golden biscuit crust, honey, bold bready yeast.

T - Slightly toasted caramel malt, golden biscuit crust. Honey rounds it off with a kiss of sweetness. Bright stone fruit, mint, sweet citrus, and some pineapple.

M - Full lush body with creamy carbonation.

One of the better amber ales Ive had. Hits all the marks with flying colors for the style. Yeast is strong but balanced. Excellent malt backbone with a variety of synergized flavors to keep it exciting. I would seek this out for sure.

Serving type: bottle

12-23-2011

330ml bottle. pours a copper/dark red colour. aroma is of lots of fruit, yeast and alcohol. tastes very distinct....of brewdog beer. not sure how to describe but maybe you know what i mean. lots of them taste similar. very fruity with dry finish.
Great balanced between the hops, that little residual sweetness and malty goodness. A great Hoppy Amber to match any Ive tried from over the pond!

Le très bon compromis entre le goût de litchi et lamertume dune bonne bière. Un vrai plaisir.

Aroma: (Passion) fruit,  Appearance: Brown red, fine foam & lacing Taste: Light bitter, (passion) fruit, grass, citrus

1L squealer from ibs. Dark murky amber, med foamy head. Smells ..citrus mandarin, grassy hops and floral dry hops. Tastes.. Grassy and slightly piney hops, mandarin citrus, crisp malts, pretty bitter. Not my fav brewdog.

Bottle nice amber color with not very long lasting white head aroma is malt with citrus taste is malty and hopy with an aroma hops aftertaste very balanced tastesa little bit typical brewdog i like it

Bottle @ home, 8/5 2013. Nice red color, with big white head that quickly disappear. Light hoppy aroma, with a little bit of red fruits. The taste is sweet at first and then goes hoppy bitter, weak malt background.
amber, hazy, minimal head, white foam, hay, roasty, herbs, leaves, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,
red, clear, tan foam, resin, grass, citrus, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, very bitter,

0,33 l bottle BB 25. Feb  13      from Getränke Liebick   
red, clear, frothy, tan foam, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, cereal, hay, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,
One of my faves on draught lovely bittet taste and full of aroma brewdog at there best should be their flagship beer

Fresh citrus, mandarin and grapefruit in the aroma. Its red / brown with a small head but flat carbonation. Also in the flavor it has a lot of fresh hoppy notes with a smoot malty finish. Its very smooth with very good harmony.
(Bottle 33cl) Pours amber with an offwhite head, nice hoppy aroma. Flavour has soldid malts some caramel and a nice hoppyness with grape fruit notes. The best discount beer I have tried from Brewdog
Bottled, batch 40 from the Ellon brewery. A fabulous amber ale. I like it more every time I drink it.

Ppurs a large frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is clear and sparkling, color is reddish brown. Aroma contains lots of hoppy things like herbs, grass and citrus fruits. Next to that there's light dough, geape, raisin, cherry and raspberry and other forest fruits. Flavor starts off light acidic, then goes to sweet and finishes in bitter. It's sour fruits, then more sweet fruits and a sharp bitter ending. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation soft. This beer is one of a kind, but because of the quite bitter finish not really my kind. I love all teh fruits, though.
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Aroma of fruit, grassy hops and malt. Taste with caramel, grassy notes.
33cl bottle from dranken Geers in Oostakker. Dark amber body with large white head. Strong citrus aroma. Nice fruity with bitter finish and good carbonation. *****
2013 - botte 33cl - with Cis & Hans - amber beer, creamy coloured head which fades away soon - amarillo, some bitterness (not much)
On tap at Rogue Wetbar by Seabus in Vancouver. A darkish, brownish amber ale. Malts and dried fruit flavours predominate. Little hop evident. Nice one.
Amber colour. Very refreshing and easy drinkable beer. Very bitter hoppy aftertaste.  Fantastic flavour with medium hop bitterness. On tap is a very good beer !!!

Dark reddish brown beer, medium head
Good aroma of tropical fruit and pine. 
Taste is more subtle with malts and bitter hops in not so good balance.

Pours a nice orange amber beer with a nice frothy head. The smell is awesome. Nice grapefruit smell, fruity. 
The taste is nice. Not very long lasting. Taste is nice bitter.
Very watery and thin texture.  The carbo is nice tho.
