Finally a bottle which tastes like I remember it. 
Clean roasty malt character with piney hops and mahogny color. 
Bottle, Batch 237, BF 230713 - 6/3/6/4/12 - 3.1
Im having difficulties to describe this one, because I cant pick up something that clearly stands out. Aroma of honey, slightly piney, something overripe (plums?) and with notes of vegetables? Muted taste, light bitterness, easy to drink. The color has changed with time. It has become darker and has an unusual color. Some kind of hazy mahogny, but if I hold the glas against the sun it becomes lightly ruby red. Cool! 
This is not my favorite batch. I prefer batches that had stronger piney hop character.

Large beige frothy head and a beautiful mahogany hazy body.

Aroma is dominated by aromatic hops: citrus, tropical fruit and maybe some pine. The taste is also fruity and hoppy, but with some toffee notes too. Finishes a sturdy and peppery bitter,

Light brown beer with a small beige head. Fruity peaches / peach marmelade on the nose. Grassy hops. Body is on the watery side. Could benefit from a bigger carbonation perhaps with a body this light.  Some caramel. Not very complex. Quite a dull beer with decent hops. Not bad but not something you want more. The smell is the best on this one.
Pours a clear amber with a frothy light head o the top. Honey, sweet fruit and some citrus in the aroma. Tastes of grain, citrus and a piney bitter finish. A good ale.

330ml bottle at end of best before. Pop the cap, great aroma of sweet juicy fruity hops. Aroma dies down in the glass head disappears quickly leaving some lacing. Taste is citrus hops but thin watery and muted. Underwhelming, but I will definitely try a fresh one if I find it.
Platt. Luktar honung så det sjunger om det. Det är ju lite onödigt kan jag tycka

Pours a clear dark copper colour with thick creamy off white head leaving phenomenal lace all the way up the glass. Aroma is tropical fruit, and sweet malt. Flavour is mild grapefruit, pine, a nice moderate bitterness throughout without being harsh and overall kinda dry. Aroma is a bit light.

Pours a clear amber with a frothy light brown head o the top. Aroma of huge grassy and citrus hops with a little bit of malt hiding in the background. Taste is pretty much all hops, citrus, some grass and a grape like cab sauv. Finishes dry and kinda champagnee again like a cab sauv. A very interesting take on the style of beer but overall needs more malt backbone or less hops.
Keg @ Jolly Butchers 2013/4/1 Good beer. Lovely colour and aroma but not so much bang for your buck. Find it particularly inconsistent but this was one of the better ones.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 Pours clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Flavour is a fruitfest with grass and nicely hopped. Cool beer.

330ml bottle bought at Biere von Irene in Yuen Long. Batch No. 566.

Cloudy, hazy dull ruby purplish-red colour; Very thin head and residual beige foam which fades in 20 seconds; Minimal lacing with active carbonation; Very fragrant aroma of raisin, floral, plum, dark fruit, light cherry, sparkling wine and sugar; Minimally sweet taste of light malt with light citrus, grapes, cream crackers, pines, herbs and light hops Med to light body, thin but slick palate; Taste profile is initially muted, no taste at all for a couple of seconds, then it hits you with the very light, dry biscuit malt plus light citrus, grapes, spices and herbal hops. All in really light dose. Hoppiness concentrates on aromas, and bitterness is very light, with mild astringency as finish. Pretty dry after taste, very easy to mouth.

Comments: I had high hope for this one before opening it, I wish I didnt. Its fruity aroma is really nice and attractive, but the taste does not match, very muted and flat, and failed to spark my interest. The use of Simcoe and Chinook hops make some interesting piney hoppiness, but its still light. Even Mendocinos Red Tail Ale tastes more exciting than this one. Its overall impression is underwhelming and disappointing. Would another batch be better? I dont wanna bet.
Tastes malty - wasnt really to my taste though

Scent has pine like feel, with some bitterness. Appearance is red with minimalist head. Taste has earth like-qualitys, some pine wood and hints of bitter fruits. Bitterness is in nice balance, not too powerful. Very pleasant red ale.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 The overriding taste is one of bitterness which may be too much for some people, bit too much for me! A lovely appearance of deep red-Brown with gentle fizzing and a thick cream head. Some toffee in the nose. A slight astringent quality which fades into a pronounced bitter aftertaste. Hoppy, basically tastes like a modern, standard hop laden ipa with an extra tartness. Best slightly warmer than fridge temperature- let it warm up a bit!

0,33L bottle.Rich fruity, vegetables, herbs aroma. Soft start. Wierd turnip flavor jumping for few seconds. Like living beer. Very weird. Finish is bt skunky and very enjoyable bitter. Very nice brewing.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2014 330ml bottle. Aroma is piney hops with an underlying sweetness. Lovely creamy head on a dark copper, slightly hazy ale. The taste is hard for me to describe but has sweet and bitter elements, with a viscous mouthfeel. A good robust ale but slightly medicinal tasting.

Red-brown ale with a thick, pillowy light brown head. Fresh, clean aromas of pine and resin. Smooth on the palate with a hint of fruit (cherry?) at the start, subtle smoky malt flavours, and a dominant dry, hoppy, pine finish. Excellent.

11.2oz bottle - pours caramel-scarlet with nice, medium tan head. Sweet caramel notes, cookie, biscuit, touch of orange. Taste is grain, malted citrus, finishes with touch of bitterness. Pretty decent.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with little head. Aroma has hops, flowers. Taste is sweet and bitter.

May 2012 - The guy at RealAle Twickenham told me this is his favourite.  So expectations high Verdict: Not amazing, hoppy, little floral. Disappointing.  Very good rating on ratebeer though, so I may have to give it a second go just to check.
Det här var faktiskt en besvikelse. Humlig aroma med inslag av honung. Tråkig och smakfattig, liten beska och aningen vattnig.

Bottle 0,33L. Hazy dark amber colour, with big beige head. Outstanding aroma is combination of hoppy flowers, pine, herbs, grass and grapes. Heavy bitter taste with medium to full body and lively carbonation. Could be easily treated as IPA.

Bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a dark amber with a thin off-white head. Complex and interesting aroma, with an instant citrus/herby hit, and more subtle blends of cereal and toffee after. Taste is mostly sweet with a light bitterness - caramel and malt at the front, with a more intriguing hay, grass and green veg aftertaste. Fairly lively carbonation, with a lingering light bitterness. A very fine beer, but slightly underwhelming when compared with some of Brewdogs other offerings (it aint no Punk IPA!).

Ale ambrée, houblonnage résineux. Ne conviens pas en bière de soif et ne conviens pas non plus en bière de dégustation car elle manque de corps.
Elle accompagne bien un steak frites le midi.
Bottle. Pours slightly hazy amber with off-white head. Clear hoppy aroma with a spicy note. Bitter hoppy flavour with a spicy note, perhaps coriander. Dry finish. Definitely decent.
Bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Sweet malty base, a little fruity and grainy, with floral hops, and lighter earthy notes. Very drinkable.

33cl bottle at Parkteateret (Scene). Pours deep amber with an off-white to beige head. Deliciously hoppy aroma with pine, fruits, malt and hints of caramel and citrus. Medium body. Sweet and fruity with a nice and bitter finish. Very well balanced. Delicious and refreshing. (2013-02-15)
Very tasty amber. Hoppy nose but a big malty and sugary palate. Light and drinkable, good example of the style and a good hop profile.
Amber colour. Low Carbonation. Very refreshing and easy drinkable beer. Very bitter hoppy aftertaste. Balanced!
Pours deep red with a fluffed tan head. Thick caramel taste with citrus and pine. Malts and a bit of hoppiness.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle. Big pillowy head on a ruby red pour. Citrus hops and bready malts. Solid brew.
February 16, 2013 - bottle shared by BVery.  Brown pour with some head.  Aroma was malty and hoppy.  Taste was consistent with aroma.  Very good for a style that I dont care for much.

Bottle at five bar. Remember this was my first craft beer I ever had a few yrs ago. Great stuff nice citrus, pine hop aromas. Taste is easy going more citrus and caramel malt. Easy going amber ale. Good beer

Pours cloudy amber with a thick tan head.
Scent is caramel....some metallic notes.
Taste is grassy, malty caramel.
Thin and slightly herbal.
Very smooth hopping.

Pours a golden orange with two fingers of white head. Aroma is orange and faint pineapple. Flavour is clean and hoppy, with slight malt on the mid palate and a pleasant bitter floral and hoppy finish. Pretty basic but tasty.

Pours amber with a receding head of a dark off-white head. that leaves good lace.
Aroma of hops and sweet fruitiness.
Taste is initially just roast, quite astringent/bitter, then it leaves a hoppy, dry aftertaste. Medium to light bodied. Quite a lot of fizziness in your tongue.
Overall a good beer, but I would prefer a wee bit of sweetness.
Complex aroma, appealing appearance and a wonderful taste! [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

33cl bottle. Colour is clearly amber with a yellowish small head. Medium body and average carbonation. The smell is typically IPA, so hoppy, citrusy and fruity. Taste is hoppy as well, but the malt is noticeable. Refreshing, easy to drink, and pleasant overall. Very nice.

[Thanks to andregoncalves]. Bottled. Brown colour with a beige head with medium lasting and good lacing. Aroma is malty, toasty with notes of brown sugar. Flavor has notes of bitter orange, brown sugar, traces of citrus hops and a light hoppiness. The final is light bittery with fruity hints.

I saw this beer the other night at Total Wine & More. It was new, so I grabbed a single bottle. I poured it, and it smells incredible. It smells like a barleywine. But then I took a sip, and almost spit it out. It has a very thin mouthfeel, and a weird metallic flavor. I am drinking this ice cold, so maybe that has something to do with it... but I am not impressed by this beer whatsoever. I expect more from BrewDog. Hopefully, as this heats up, more flavors will begin to show up... but ice cold, I will be lucky to finish the entire bottle.
330ml bottle - Amber colour. Wonderful hop aroma, fruity, with sharp grapefruit and a hint of passion fruit. Fairly good caramel flavour bit of citrus hops in there, but a bit of a let down overall.

Pours ruby red, very clear, thin off white head. Aroma is fresh cut grass, fruit, quite bittersweet.
Taste is well balanced, caramel, malt, dark fruits and fresh hops.

Personal favourite.
amber colored beer reminds me of alpha dog from Brewdog, Biter caramell and herbs,good and hoppy.

Amber to coper coloured ale. Sweet / bitter with lots of caramel, malt and some hops in the taste. You describe it as a malty amber ale, because of the caramel and bread tast. Its medium bodied, with a dry ending (use of pale ale malt?). The hops arent dominating but are present. Nice bitterness but in the end a little too astringent in my opinion. I bought it in Belgium maybe if you can drink it fresh, the hops will cause more balance and the bitterness will be less astringent.

Im not usually a fan of red ales because they tend to be essentially red-colored IPAs but drier. BrewDog 5 A.M. Saint definitely does not meet that description, thankfully. Its significantly malty while still retaining a strong hoppy presence. Not an amazing beer by any means, but not the same old red ale, either. 

I poured an 11.2oz bottle into a tulip glass.

Appearance: Murky cranberry/mahogany hue. Forms a fairly large, eggshell, frothy head which retains and laces quite well.

Smell: Slight pine sap and caramel candy, but with a slightly fusel scent.

Taste: While the palate to BrewDog 5 A.M. Saint may not be absolutely delicious, it does have almost perfect balance. Even though my bottle was a little old it still had plenty of hops throughout. Earthy, herbal and grassy hop character is the best way to describe the bitterness here. Pine needles, tree bark and citrus peel might be even more apt descriptors. Caramel maltiness through the middle imparts a mildly sweet, somewhat confectionery taste. Lemon lollipop also seems to be a flavor, though this is more likely an off-flavor than something deliberate (and one I dislike in beer across the board). 

It finishes with a big, dry hop bite and more earthy character as it goes down. The aftertaste is mostly clean, though there is a subtle drying sensation. In the end its a good, satisfying beer but nothing more than that.

Drinkability: Whats most impressive about BrewDog 5 A.M. Saint is the fact its remarkably robust for a 5% ABV beer. It has the full body of something bigger, though it is not a challenge to drink at all. Plenty of carbonation, energy and weight in the mouth followed by an easy finish. This is an ideal companion to food, but one on its own is good too.

Deliciosa amber ale, essa breja eu sou muito suspeito pra falar. Talvez seja a Brewdog que eu mais aprecio. Cor âmbar, com aroma cítrico inconfundível! Amargor intenso, duradouro, refrescante de lúpulo. Muito lúpulo nessa cerveja! Drinkability excepcional!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
5.0% amber colour with a nice head, sweet floral hop aroma, slightly sweet hoppy taste, did not like it.
Smells better than it tastes.  Hops to the fore on the nose, but rather subdued and subtle on the palate.  Nice cloudy amber colour and decideably quaffable.
Bottle. Dark amber ruby colour. Big beige head that persists. Big resin pine aroma. Flavour is more balanced some nutty malt. Piny hop chewy. High carb.
Draught at St Michael, Oulu. Colour is reddish copper. With small white head. Aromas and flavours are bitterness, citrus, fruits and berries. Very dry.

A: Pours cloudy, dark ruby red with a light brown head that leaves moderate lace. Aromas of dark cherries, raisins, malt, and hints of chocolate and caramel. Heavy malt flavor with dried fruit, toasted grain and a hint of bittersweet chocolate. Slick mouthfeel, medium carbonation, light body and a lingering malt sweetness.

Clear reddish deep amber, medium sized beige stable head.
Aroma.. fruity hoppy contrasted with decent maltiness, bit caramel, citrus. Grassy.
Short sweet start with very pleasant bitterness continuation and dry bitter finish. Very nice.
Maybe something is lacking, but as first session beer it was great. He he and its really ment for 5 am watching sunset

Kaatuu lasiin rubiininpunaisena ja isokuplaisella katoavalla vaahdolla. Haju on humaloitu, selkeää sitruunaa ja yrttisyyttä myös tulvii nenään. Parempi puolisko löysi fenkoliakin? Maku on puumaisen humaloitu ja yrttinen, sitrusta hieman taustalla. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen, humalan katkeruus jää kitalakeen. Kokonaisuutena aivan upean hajuinen, mutta maun yksipuolisuus oli pieni pettymys. Aromaattinen tapaus kuitenkin.

Bottle. Piney orange hops and caramel malt aroma. Deep amber with a small ivory head, decent lacing. Resinous piney hops, orange peel, astringent, biscuity caramel malt flavor. Medium body and carbonation.

Smells fruity and fresh, with hints of wild raspberries. The flavour is interesting and complex, with a large contrast between the taste and the aftertaste - first there is a berry-like and mildy sickening sweetness, and then a hoppy and smoky aftertaste kicks in. Beautiful smoke-coloured, with a little bit too little foam. 0.33 is a bit too much, which is a bad sign.

Pours a cloudy amber. Really nice aroma -- almost like a barleywine, with loads of caramel-drenched fruit. The flavor, unfortunately, goes for about a third of a second, then stops quite abruptly -- it just shuts down, and moves to a watery finish. Really weird that it quits so quickly.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish amber with small white head. Aroma is roses, bitter citrus fruits, redcurrant, strawberries, papaya, passion fruit, caramel and hints of soap and hints of licorice. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Body is light oily with fizzy carbonation. Finish is long and bitter with notes of tropical fruits (passion, melon, banana, papaya) spruce, bitter grapefruit, chalk, butter and cream. Complex but easy-to-drink beer.

Pours amber-red with a minimal off white head. Aroma is mild hops, honey & lite malts. Taste is an evenly balanced blend of pine and honey-like syrup with a pleasant lite malt finish. A great session beer.
Red amber color, small beige head . Strong fruity aroma of citrus and lychee, some pine. Bitter and dry taste with malty caramel and grapefruit.

Thankfully this was poured by the barman and ordered by someone else - no chance of having to read the usual infantile twaddle on the bottle; reddish brown in appearance with quite a thick head; hops massively to the fore in both aroma and flavour - pine/floral/grapefruit, the usual kind of thing that they do so well; unlike some other Brewdog beers (DPC, Libertine) this had a decent malt backbone and was much more balanced as a result; a bitter finish, quite dry; good stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2013 0.33 bottle. Seriously amber colored, delicately hazy with an off-white head going into brown. Extremely hop aroma, some citrus... grapefruit for my money, as well as grass and a bit of spruce. Hop taste, medium sweet, medium bitter, medium sour, nicely and equally distributed. Medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation make it easy to enjoy the mouthfeel. Finish also presents a uniformity of flavors. All in all the beer is really balanced, surprises with its consistency and refinement.

Aroma: fruits, little grassy, maybe spruce, some malty notes; Appearance: dark amber, clear, big falling to minimal off-white head; Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, a little bit sour notes; Palate: medium body, little creamy feel, average carbonation, quite long slightly bitter finish;
Overall: great beer, fantastic aroma and drinkability
reddish colour, moderate head; the aroma and taste is dominated by hops with citrus (mainly grapefruit) - apart from its colour, this beer is more like an IPA than anything else...at least for me

11.2 oz bottle (batch 023), Dated best by 22 Jan. 2013. 
Beer is hazy, orange-brown with a moderate head that soon reduces to a durable ring. 
VERY hoppy aroma for style; more like an IPA .. seriously!  The hops remain in the flavor but in a very subdued and mild form.  It seems like Im drinking a different beer than the one I am smelling. Nice. 

Beer is medium bodied and has appropriate medium carbonation, lending a crisp feel.

Nice red ale. Good bitter aftertaste. Could have had more depth. Keeps a nice head throughout. Clear with a bit of haze. Fruity aroma. Hoppy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Head: off-white. Colour: hazy at first, turning into clear amber. Aroma: hops, malt. Taste: hops, bitter. Palate: mild, dry, medium bitter finish. Overall: very nice beer.

Nice amber color with a thin tan head. Hoppy nose. Aromas are hops, malts, fruits and caramel. Rather short finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Underbar. Cloudy brown with a hint of red. Rhick offwhite head. Perfumed hoppy aroma with a sweet flowery taste. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[on tap at BrewDog pub in Edinburgh]
Hoppy, cat piss aroma. Clear amber appearance. Excellent nutty malt flavour balanced by a blast of US and Australian/New Zealand hops. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, nutty finish.

A mid to dark, flame reddish brown coloured beer with a thick, cream coloured head. A strong hop aroma, piney, citrusy, grassy with just a hint of liquorice. A medium bodied mouthfeel. The taste starts off along the same vein as the aroma, piney, grassy grapefruit and orange citrusy hop flavour are abound, genty making way for a more rounded flavour, of biscuity malt and that liquorice element from the aroma. Thats not to say the hops disappear, they are well represented in the finish.
From BandCs. Boldly hopped, herbal and pine. A little spicy tasting too. Nice stuff. Serving: bottle
