Dark mahogany body, spare frothy beige head. Some malt and hops, then you sense the citrus, plum and prunes. So well-balanced taste and very drinkable, still the very characteristic BrewDog flavour...Its hard to describe...

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2013 This amber has a beige head and the beer is a bit cloudy.
Love the smell of this beer, tropical fruit with some light malty notes.
The hops certainly come through on the taste, big but well balanced...if you can say that about a beer. Great beer!

On draught at Oslo in Galway. This brew pours a dark amber-copper color with a medium white head that burns away steadily. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops and caramel. Light body with flavors of herbal hops and caramel malt. Touches of tropical fruit too. The finish is mildly bitter with a fruity hops aftertaste. Decent overall.
330ml bottle. Dark copper red amber colour, frothy tan head, caramel and fruit hop aroma. Tangy dry bitterness, hoppy and sweet, smooth fruity finish. Quite drinkable.

Шикарны& баланс солодов& тела и хмеля. Карамел& кислинк& легкий привкус черносл& винная кислинк& и все это в идеальн& балансе. Рекомен& один минус - аромат из бокала. Мне он почему-т напомин& мыло....

---Rat via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark copper loo with a thin tan head. Malty aroma with notes of caramel and flowerly hops. Medium sweetness, hints of raisins but very subtle, some orange zest and lightly bitter on the taste. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, and a dry mid bitter finish. Ok.

Beige head on top of full chestnut body. Waves of ripe kiwi, smoothness and a flat middle. Then long chocolate nuttiness mixed with mango and papaya.Interesting but not a heart grabber. Lots of clingy head. Character and individuality at the expense of complexity and devlopment.

330ml bottle. Pours clear and amber with a average, frothy and lasting off-white head. The aroma contains very hoppy notes; mainly grape and pine and caramel. The flavours is very bitter and moderately sweet. Its medium-bodied, with a quite oily texture, soft carbonation and comes with a long and bitter finish.
Una cerveza refrescante. Con aromas afrutados tipo mango o melocotón. Espuma volátil. Sabor acaramelado y amargo.
Amber with off white head - nice fruity hop aroma - malt to support the hop with some sweetness, has a nice fruity hop taste along with some dry bitterness - lasting hoppy dry end - this was nice

Draught. Malty aroma, pours dark copper. Medium head. Slightly sweet toffee malt, but not too heavy, then a smooth bitterness with a moderately long finish. Not too heavy on the carbonation. Very nice.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2016 pours cloudy brownish orange with a smallish head, not much retention, good lacing, some slow streams. Aromatic malts, caramel, and hints of tangerine hops on the nose. Buttery smooth creamy entry, silky mouthfeel, tastes of bitter orange peel, sharp fresh lively hops, malts, grapefruit, caramel, finishing boldly hoppy bitter. Medium complexity, medium-high depth, great transitions, great carry, great drinkability.

(2016/10/18 re-tasting as Five AM Red Ale): 
Visual: Pours opaque reddish brown without much of a head, thin ringed retention with a hazy island, clusters of steady streams.

Nose: brown sugar, date, sweet toasted barley malt. (lvl-7)-pungency

Attack: crisp, half-flat CO2

Mid-palate: background stealth grassiness, (lvl-4-sweetness), red berries/red grape, brown sugar toasted barley malt

Finish: residual barley malt sweetness, subtle bitterness

Summary: This has a dull, medium deepness which I find isnt too impressive compared to their other fab brews. Good drinkability and flavour, but not quite rounded and bold enough to be great.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 33cl bottle. It is a very nice red ale with lemon and plum smell, long-lasting  small beige foam. Taste is citric first than thin malt, after these fruitfulness (plum, mint, apple) and some hop, smoke at the end. I liked it very much!

Dark red amber colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma of hops, grass and a hint of caramell. Taste of hops (with a light bitter taste) and some sweet notes. Also grass and some grapefruit. A little watery which gives a feeling of a thin body. But overall a nice beer. Easy to drink but with some taste to it.
330 ml bottle. This is great amber ale, deliciously looking and fruity and tasty. Nice aroma, and great mouth feeling. Dried fruits and apples and caramel are identifyable.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2013 On tap in Dublin. Hazy red amber. Hoppy taste. Bitter finish. I really like it but the taste is not for everyone.  Y

Lovely off-white head. Darker than expected. Sweets, fruits and some dried fruits. Much the same for taste, hops of course, but hint of bread too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Must be at room temp. Great hoppy aroma on opening. Pours a nice amber red. Lovely balanced bitterness and malt profile.
Very nice beer.
33cl bottle. Clear amber color with a nice, not to lasting head. Great sweet,  fruity, mango aroma. Flavor is sweet, fruity , bitter in the end. Great beer

Smells wonderful sweet. Tastes wonderful in the beginning but the momentum taste unfortunately. But I still give this a high rating because it was so good. The aftertaste lingers for quite some time and although it is quite lovely. So far one of my top ten beers I drank.

Bottle from one of the supermarkets.  Gushed all over my kitchen sink!  Poured a cloudy dark amber with a big head that stayed around for a while. Theres a big malty caramel aroma leading into a nicely rounded refreshing bitter taste with citrus notes.  The hop combination works well, but there was surprisingly little bitterness on the palate.  A very decent ale,  but I wont be drinking it at 5am !
bottle. caramel toffee colored pour, fluffy white head. milder aroma of caramel malts and piney hops. Pine hop forward, cannibus, resiny, flavor drops abruptly towards the end. Good amber

Color is amber with beautiful creamy head.  Aroma is amazing, herbs, chamomile, sweetness. Taste is chamomile it reminds me of a chamomile tea I had as a kid, nice memories. A bit watery some hay in it as well. Excellent amber ale.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2012 Fruity. Little disappointing in truth. When I was a young boy folk often talked about a lack of bottle. Well, rings true tonight.  SToP PreSS - had in a bottle on Boxing Day 2012, much better than I remember on tap. Yep.

Subtle aromas of orange and citrus, quickly giving way to mild aromas of caramel malt and dark honey.  Overall a delicate, subtle, interesting nose. The palate remains med-med-light, with fine carbonation, and elegant, lingering notes of citrus, sweet grapefruit, light caramel, and honey. Very mild bitterness, if any. Enjoyable. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...
Hazy red amber colored beer with a massive hoppy nose and flavour. Dry bitter taste, grapefruit and pineapple. Medium bitter aftertaste.

Bardzo dobre wytrawne i szlachetne piwo. zrobipne z 5 odmian chmielu i słodu. Wybornie i goryczkowo smakuje. na finiszu posmak kwiatowo-trawiasty który trzyma dłógo. Zapach bardzo aromatyczny, ziołowy i przyprawowy. Solidne piwo o bursztynowym kolorze. Polecam
On tap at t klooster. Pours a hazy amber with an off white head. Hop and honey aroma. Spicy notes in the flavor. Bitter finish.

This is both one of my favourite beers by BrewDog and in my top beer list. Nice pale ruby red body, quickly dissipating head. Strong fruity and malt fused aroma. Quite a bitter grapefruit taste throughout but highlighted by warming sips. Lovely malty aftertaste.

Bottle. Red amber in colour small head.Aroma of grapefruit. Taste is of grapefruit also. This tastes like a weaker version of a good IPA. Palate is average medium bodied.  Its an OK beer, but not exceptional.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Darker redish color with brown solid head, sticky and lacing. Aroma is sweet, with definately some coffee. So is the taste, coffee and bittersweet, nice beer after all. Aftertaste is dominated by that same conbination, bitter winning the end game. (The Hague, 201209)

Aroma: The smell is very citric, grape-fruit juice and peel, sun-warm pines and some pine soap. Appearance: A clear red/brownish amber, a dark off-white head, leaving rather little lacing.Taste: Initially a toffee sweetness, then grape-fruit and lemon sour- and some bitterness.Palate: Medium carbonation, rather soft, somewhat oily, a light dry finish.Overall: A tiny bit too much soap, but really a good solid amber.Note: Bottle, beer tasting at Linköpings beer expo.. Reviewed 2011-04-09.
Bottle. Amber red color. Smells bready and malty. Slight hop taste but overall a good amber. Surprised brew dog made A five percent one
Dark amber hue with creamy white head, good lacing, smells of sweet malt, bit of a hop front. Medium body, sweetness blends through kind of molasses, very drinkable 3.6
Bottle.  This beer is a hazy brown with a small head.  There is some scotch flavor up front that evolves into a chewy finish.  Interesting and nice to try, but not one of my favorites.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2012 Bottle from a boutique in Arras, France. Pours a lovely clear blood red with a small beige head. Aroma has some really nice pine to it, with inviting caramalts. Flavour is sweet but balanced by the sharp, spicy hops that really shine. Well balanced, and everything shines on its own. Feels very light and almost watery, but in a good way. I could drink this a lot.

On tap. Amber/brown body beige head. Aroma of grapefruit and herbs with some caramelly sweetness and a hint of chocolate. Lots of caramel, a tiny chocolate, herbs and citruses. Very complex, and also very refreshing. My personal favourite from Brewdog.
Wonderful citrus flavour and easy drinking with caramelized note very interesting, great beer.
Easy drinking hoppy amber ale, resinous, pine with a malty caramel backbone. Could drink a few of these cant wait for BrewDog Birmingham.

Slightly beige, slightly spongy foam from caramel, caramel and citrus aroma and resinous hop waving to us. The body of the beer is lighter than expected to hop the waves traveled digs caramel malt taste with a sense of the happier scenes.

Bellaspetto ambrato/ramato con una schiuma beige poco persistente.
Naso intenso, persistente e complesso con note di passion fruit, pompelmo, cedro, resina....
Secca, corpo snello, abbastanza amara, pulita e persistente....finale lungo che rimanda ai luppoli aromatici usati per brassarla....
Ottima......

33cl bottle. As usual filtered, red amber liquid with small dirty white head. Nose ; strong hop notes of grapefruit and pine. Zest. Some little tart with delicate cherry. Sip ; Low carbonation, low density with oily texture. Moderately sweet bread feeling with strong but well contained hop burst. It develops a fine bitterness, like a grapefruit but still not overwhelming like it is with IPAs. The beer is refreshing and tasty. Pity its that expensive abroad.
Red-orange amber, decent head. Sticky, hoppy nose with candi malt. Flavor is similarly juiced with candi malt, some bubblegum, and candied pineapple. Skunked candy finish.
Hazy red appearance, citrusy hop nose. Mildly hoppy, bitter West Coast IPA hop taste which fades into a roasty,malty sweet red ale finish. Mild carbonation pours into a two finger foam head.

Bottle at home. 
One finger light brown foam. 
Reddish brown color. 
Citrus, leather, earth aroma. 
Nice balance between malt and hops. 
Hoorraayy for Brewdog!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours deep amber with a tight cream head. Sweet, bready, fruit caramel aroma. Smooth mouthfeel and a malty finish.

The aroma is sweet with caramel malt and also has plenty of pine - citrus hops. The appearance is hazy amber with a huge head (maybe it is past its prime). The taste is dryer than the aroma and a tad bit herbal and papery. The palate is smooth. Overall I am not sure if it is right or not so its hard to judge but I am not a fan of this bottle.
On tap at Zubaty pes. Pours dark brown to amber color with tan head. Aroma is hops, herbs and licorice. Taste is hops, spices, raisin, licorice. Dry bitter aftertaste.

Medium strong aroma has bit salty caramel, bread, citrus, pine. Hazy mahogany with short head. Taste is bitter sweet and has also dark fruits. Medium body, bit sticky feel, fizzy carbonation, long bitter finnish. A tasty one to be enjoyed.

Virginia Trip  bottle 355ml
Aroma  full set displayed- plenty of everything  various malts, wide range of hops. Very rich. Hint of caramel , rose , woody touch with peppery backing. 7+
 Appearance  nice- dark amber , clear with good depth. Nice beige crown. Lace on glass.
Flavor and Palate : Medium bodied. fairly drinkable. Caramel, mineral notes with leaf and citrus hop hints. Finishing with melon and various fruits. Dry bitter finish. Satisfying.

Draught @ BeerTemple, Amsterdam.
Nice malty session ale, with modest amount of alcohol. Quite tasty, but tends to get a bit on the bready side after a few. Good starter or second beer.

A dark red colour with a thinner head when poured. A wonderful aroma full of complex flavours. Some fruit, grapefruit with a hint of sweetness and maybe even coffee(?). Taste is slightly bitter at first, but finishes off really nicely and not too harshly. Would like it to be slightly more flavorful as the aroma suggests, but still a very drinkable red ale!

Btl from Bottleworks.  Clear, red-orange pour with a short beige head with good retention and leaving moderate lace. Nose has an early whiff of Simcoe and fruit, but then is mostly pine and roasty malts. Medium-light body with moderate-plus carbonation. Mouth is crisp and full, but not plush. Toast, pine and walnuts; light citrus and caramel. Finish is medium and slightly softer - presumably getting you ready for another swallow. Very sessionable and one Ill come back to again if I can find it. Im impressed that its so good this far from Scotland.
The head is ok, the color brown. The taste is sweet, malty, hoppy, different hoppy-fruity but everytime the same intensiv. OK 11/10/11/10/-/10
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 Aroma is piney hops and a slight mustiness/earthiness.  The flavor is slightly subdued citrus hops and a very solid malt backbone.  Well put together and great session ale.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Limpido color ambra scura con un cappello spesso e persistente di soffice schiuma beige. Al naso sentori di toffee, frutta fresca e pan pepato; gusto amarognolo con note fruttate e debolmente speziate più dolci, finale luppolato. Birra leggera nel corpo e nella struttura, un po acquosa ma non scipita, setosa e beverina. Invecchiando emerge un po di più il lato speziato.

A-- Poured a reddish brown with red tints on the side of the glass. Pretty aggressive pour got a good 2 finger light brown head that took a good amount of time to settle down on. Left very thick, sticky lacing on the sides of the glass. Shows medium to high carbonation and good head retention.

S-- Fresh, crisp hops. Roasted and sweet malt. Would swear this is a Western US Amber Ale and not a UK version. Very nice. Mostly pine and grapefruit in the smell.

T-- Fairly large hop bite in the front, grapefruit and pine again, with touches of sweetness and roasted malt. 

M-- Bitterness stays for a good amount of time. Still pretty clean and finishes on the soft side. Still medium to high carbonation. Gets better as it gets warmer and the hops become aggressive as it warms.

D-- Very drinkable. Hops really carry the beer and is well balanced by the right amount of sweetness in this. Not over done one way or another. Really nice example of the better US Amber Ales that are out there. The 5% makes this very drinkable and could have 2-3 of these easily. First Brewdog beer I have liked so far.

I love red ales. Something about them is inherently appetizing and enticing. Its a shame this one doesnt quite make it. There is something inherently unpleasant about a bank of the throat bitterness when you swallow. Mind you, Ill still happily drink it, but I have a sense its changed. I swear it didnt use to be this harsh.

Color is excellent, as is the smell. Its the taste that lets this beer down.

At home from bottle - 05/08/12. This has always been my favourite BD beer and have drank it many times over the last few years including a good half a dozen cask/gravity dispense pints.
Pours an amber russet brown colour with a thin off white head.
Hoppy/piney nose with a whiff of toasted caramel at the rear.
Big piney hops at the start of the taste but mellows somewhat into a sweet caramel malty goo.
Moderate carbonation with a sweet to dry finish and a little bitterness to boot. Always happy to return to this beer!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Very refreshing amber ale. No off flavors. Unfortunately, theres really nothing special about this one, and it comes off as a decent fall-back summer beer or party beer in the end.
Another great beer from Brewdog. Tried this after the Trashy Blond and found it to be much more enjoyable. Some nice flavor and carbonation.
This type of red ale really works for me: a good combo of citrusy and earthy hops, and a malt character leaning more towards caramel than towards biscuit. Id definitely have this again.
bottle @ eataly bologna. pours amber with a good white head. orange hints and good bitterness. dry and refreshing.

Tap - Railway Tavern - (Dalston) - very intense floral hop aroma, active mouthfeel ending with a breaking aroma of orange maltiness, finish is crisp with a coconut butterscotch ending.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

On keg at the barrels, Berwick upon tweed. Pours red brown with decent head, well balanced carbonation. The right temperature as a normal temp would make this too tart. An excellent red ale and maybe keg is the future.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget Sweden.
Semilasting light brown head.  Clear dark amber color, that hits the right spot for an amber ale. Huge hop intensive piny aroma that will wake you up eaven at 5 a.m. 
Hoppy taste that then gives you a little caramell and bitterness. Dry and well fermented.
huge hoppiness on the nose, mostly pine and fruit. sips great. one of the beers that gets brewdog the recognition they deserve. great amber ale
On tap at Mr. and Mrs. Bund, Shanghai. Hoppy aroma, sweet almost Belgian malt. Dark amber colour with nice white head. Very flavourful. Great beer.
Soft and light with moderate bitterness, with a decent hop aroma. Color is somewhat dark brown with some hints of red. Very typical brew dog beer.

Moderate brown color. Huge pine aroma. Perfume and a set of flavors like something that would be uncharitable to mention. Funny finish--rough edge, vegetal. Aroma beats flavor. (tap at Barrels Ale House, Berwick)

One of the best amber ales Ive come across, mainly because it doesnt taste or smell much like a dull old amber at all. Doubt it would pass muster with the style gurus in competition, but who cares? A bronze beer with a thin head. Atypical aroma of toffee apples, passionfruit, cola and lemon candies. Light body. Odd blend of what seem traditional amber ale malts and hops more suited to a pale ale. Tart and refreshing with some gooseberry in the finish. A pleasant surprise. (330ml bottle from Leura Cellars. BB 16/1/12)

Bottle pour. Lots of hops in the aroma. Love the dry hops. Nice balance of citrus fruits and caramel from the malt. Thinner than I thought it would be. I like red ales much better on cask so if I get the chance to try it on cask my rating will likely go up.
330ml bottle. Dark copper color. Small off-white head, stays. Good lacing. Citric hops, some sweetness. Dry mild bitter hops in taste. Somewhat watery.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 Smell like an amber should. Not too strong taste. Mild taste. Looks good. Easy to drink.
Slightly malted aroma on a reddish brown body with a thinnish head. Stronger flavor but not too roasted.
Bottle. Sweet candy like aroma. Brown or amber color with light off white head. Sweet pleasant and smooth body with a nice caramel like flavor. Light bitter and light dry palate. Alright
From the bottle and on tap. Amber colour, fruity aroma, lychee, oranges. Delicious floral qualities. Bitterish finish. A great beer.

3 finger beige head that sinks to 5mm, red-amber body. Nose: Passionfruit, lychee, oranges and pine. Aroma: Lychee, passionfruit, oranges, caramel, the slighest hint of resin and grass. Thin mouthfeel, semi-long, semi-bitter ending.

Hazy reddish amber with a white head. Wonderfully balanced nose of floral hops and caramel malts. Medium bodied, and more like an IPA than an amber or red ale. Citrus permeates the entire palate and some classy hops accentuate the finish.
Quite delicious after the worst stingy carbonation goes off and it warms up a bit. Loads of great hops. sweetish and a bit dry in the end.

(330 mL bottle from Metro - Tuscany Village) The grapefruit hops are beautiful in this one. They could advertise it as a grapefruit beer and 90% of people would believe it. Unfortunately the diacetyl pulls it way down.

very good ipa... with a pretty descent kick and a pretty sweet finish! 
all in all a great beer!

Nice deep red amber in color with medium head and lots of lacing. Great looking beer. Smells of pine, grapefruit, and hops. Taste follows smell with a bitter finish but not too long lasting. Mouthfeel average with good carbonation and dry palate. A decent red ale, if a bit overrated. 

--- Cheers

Backlog, 2010 on tap at The Whiskybar Oslo.
Golden reddisch color, good foam.
Medium body & complexity
Very well balanced, enjoyable
Fig and dark toffee malts, lightly spiced, barely vinous. Soft tan head which lasts well. Biscuitty sweet opening with hop finish. medium fill, light and bit bubbly palate.

11.2oz bottle.  Poured a rich amber color with a big, rocky off white foamy
 head.  Aroma of piney hops and juicy citrus.  Taste has a fairly large hop bite upfront, with grapefruit and pine, and hints of sweetness and roasted malt.  A lasting piney hoppy finish.  Lighter bodied with moderate carbonation.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle is dark red with white head, aroma has notes of grass, caramel, biscuit, yeast, some vanilla, oak, some grapefruit as well, wow this smells really nice even though this is supposed to be an amber?  Taste is sweet vanilla, some odd fruity berry, cherry, some oak notes, tannins, with a touch of orange, finishing with some caramel, toffee, slightly bitter.  Can see why this is one of the best ambers for sure.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 Truly exceptionally rich IPA style amber ale that had my nose and taste buds knocked out straight after opening - a gateway craft beer for me with intermingling hop bouquets so intense I have been able to detect fractions of this beers taste profile fully in other IPAs. Floral, juicy, low on malt yet with a satisfyingly mid-full mouthfeel for an amber ale. -  Found myself going back to sniff the empty bottle days after I had the 2nd of 2 purchased. Probably best drunk fresh, as I can see the amber ale maltiness taking over on the hops in time.  First of 3 Brewdogs I had so far that can fully keep up with the expectations set by its overeager marketing... // Rerate 08/2014: obviously, due to palatial education somewhat less overwhelming, althought I also suspect a change in recipe: far less exotically fruity. instead well-rounded red berry malt aromatics, and strangely also some abv fumes. Very easy drinkig still, just not the initial orgasmic experience of ere, without having grown jaded.

Grifo. Vaso de Pinta. Notas de dic´11 muchas botellas han quedado vacías antes y después-. Color cobre con tintes anaranjados profundos. Capa amarillenta, copiosa y cremosa. Bonitos collares y redecillas en las paredes. Maltas caramelo y lúpulo intenso tanto en sabores como aromas. Trazos de levadura y pan fresco en nariz. Los lúpulos aportan un amargor contundente, astringencia fuerte, matices de limón y aceites oleicos y resinosos. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Resinas y toque de madera en el retrogusto. Refrescante y de fácil asimilación. Sabrosa.
On-tap. Pint glass. Notes from dec´11  many bottles have been emptied later & before then- too. Deep orangish copper in color. Yellowish , copious, creamy head. Nice collars & webs on sides. Caramel malts & intense hoppiness both in aromas & flavors. Yeasty, fresh bread, to the nose too. Hops provide sharp bitterness, strong astringency, lemony hints & resiny oils. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Resins & woody touch on the aftertaste. Refreshing  & easy drinkable. Flavorful.
Nice head with a very inviting colour. A nosefull of flowery hops and a hint of butterscotsh. A round balanced taste that would allow .
Bottle. Amber colour with an off-colour white head. Hoppy aroma with hints of caramel. Slightly bitter taste.

4 euro. Moeder Lambic

A - red orange brown. Clear but dark SRM of 30. 2 finger creamy head. Off white slight brown

S - great citra dry hop. Minor caramel malts. German malts? Columbus hops?

T - delicious dry hopped citra and Im guessing centennial. Citra for sure! Backbone is dark malts. Caramel and oak. Smoked malts? Its hard to tell the hops dominate the beer taste.

M - 25% carbonatin. Light body. Very watery body. Dry hops on the finish.

O - This is an okay attempt at a west coast IPA. Not great but just okay. 85/100

Total Wine, Chantilly 11.2.oz ($): Pours a darkish amber with an off-white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, with a nice caramel backbone. Very well-balanced. This beer has none of the amber ale lameness. The hops are not extremely bitter, but they have plenty of flavour. This is not sweet at all like many ambers, which is pretty nice.

25th November 2009Clear amber beer, frothy creamy head. Striking fresh hop nose. Light and slightly soft palate. Very light toffee in the malt. Nice base for light hops that are grassy and fruity but not too bitter. Finshes light and fresh and hoppy.
Deep brown colour, great aroma, tastes of grapefruit followed by citrus and hops, a great great beer
Sugary caramel, malt and bready aromas. The taste is bittersweet. Nice amber ale
Very well done moderately hoppy amber ale. Flavors in the body are toffee and caramel. One of the best of the style.
Very fruity hop flavor and balanced in bitterness. Not as soap / detergent-tasting as many BrewDog brews can be.

25 cl. draft / cask (?) @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas // dark amber with a tanned head// nose carries a very American hop profile, plenty of pine, bitter fruity with some american grapefruit, spices & underneath some counterpoint spices // bitter amber caramel malts upfront, definite counterpoint malt presence here, touch sweet upfront, bitter fruity, hops work well in the finish, pine heavy with a slight floral edge // body has definite caramel malts in it but overall still medium, perhaps touch too light even // excellent standard beer, if this is widely available at a good price point but even now still, lovely, a good standard from BrewDog

A treat to both the eye and palate. The aroma is very interesting with strong presence of hops and intense flowers and honey. The taste follows through as expected but the overall impression is unexpectedly good. I imagine fields of flowers, woods, buzzing bees for each sip - There is a whole landscape hiding in this bottle. Any saint not to mention the 5AM Saint is such a misrepresentation for this excellent Beer. I have a better one - Monet of the Highlands . Cheers

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2012 Bottle: Clear cobbery colour, with à nice creamy yellow head. Aroma is dominated of lots of fruits , Flowers. Flavor had a nice sweet mouthfeeling
Of malts, and à bit Thin dry fruitynes, flowery finish. Thin to medium body!

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2012 For starters this beer is hoppy and dark. It reeks of IPA with the stank of simcoe hops. It almost matches the varnished hue of my teak desk, like you could build clipper ships with it. Tastes bitter like an underripe grapefruit or pine sap - yes, it tastes like a tree. Solid malt back for balancing what must be 60 BUs. I am the 700th rating? Excellent. Its fairly astringent, but nowhere near as dry as the Punk. It features the brewers usual philosophical rant, and is the 9th best amber ale eve made according to RBs discerning cono-sewers. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

330ml bottle. herbal, citrus, fruit aromas. Pours reddish copper, with nice white head, some persistent, some lacing. Light body and lively carbonation. Taste is hoppy, fresh, soft acid, malty. Good dry and hoppy finish. Really enjoyable.

Finally had a chance to try some Brewdog. Deep red, pours with good suds, good carbonation. A great red, best Ive had in a long time. Almost a ruby colour in the light. Good tracing. Has a pale ale profile with a little honey and a little bitterness in the end. Floral hops as well. Bottle at The Rhino.

Framboos, kruiden en iets herkenbaar onherkenbaars in het aroma. Smaak is bitter met wat rood fruit, erg verfrissend, en een bittere afdronk. Voor het aroma nog maar eens proberen op een warme zomeravond.

Nice light summer ale with a hoppy bitter aftertaste. Taste is not so huge. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tropisk frukt, citrus, karamell, bra balans mellan malt och humle med en trevlig beska med pepprig klang. Riktigt god och med en trevlig karaktär.

(draught 0,5l @ Netopýr (Brno))
Strong hops aroma, floral, herbs. Dark amber-red color. Huge white head. Light sweet, very bitter, some hoppy (floral) taste. Medium body. Very long very bitter finish.

Bottle- I really enjoyed this beer, one of the best amber ales ive had. Nice balance of hops and malts. Great hop aromas, with anise malt taste up front and then finishing off with a yummy hop bitterness.

Bottle [330ml] at Rhino. Pours a deep ruby with a large lasting frothy off-white head. Nice aroma of caramel malt, a good amount of fruity hops along with resin and piney hops, some pepper and pumpernickel. Spicy, malty flavour with a good amount of hops along with some fruit and bread. Surprisingly spicy. Decent bitter finish.  Average bodied. For an Amber Ale this is really good, I quite enjoyed it.

-- Rated via Beer Buddy.

Redbrown with good yellow foam. Nice flowery aroma with a hint of orange. Malty taste with a nice fruity taste. Strong bitter aftertaste that lasts somewhat. medium to light mouthfeel with good carbonate. Overall a great beer
Floral, grass, herbs, amber, red, medium bitterness, Lots of late hops and dry hops.
Sample at de paas.  Clear amber pour with a big tan head.  Aroma of hops, fruit and spice.  Same aspects in flavour but sweet with a bitter finish.

Do i recommend it?: yeah, well if you want a quite funny beer to drink with alot of taste and sweetness ok. But it does not fully fold into my taste. 
Will I drink it again?: probably not in a couple of years. Maybe ice cold (god forbid) a warm summers eve

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Impressive Amber ale. Drinks smooth. Good one to share with larger louts and may convince them that craft beer is the future.

-- raided in the wild
Smells like coffe and hops. Brown hazy color with a creamy tan head. Tastes like toffe and coffe. Palate is bitter from beggining to end. Overall is a fine beer.
bottle . clear ruby brown with beige head . strong aroma evident even when pouring - floral hoppy spicy herby . taste is mainly floral with a bitter hoppy finish   medium carbonation and body
lovely beer soft on the palate lacked a bit of boddy but besides that a great beer
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Reddish color, white head. Nice bitter taste with citrus, grape. Excellent brew.

Oh this is good. Incredibly complex. Rich aroma tinged with dark fruit and spice. Taste is similar but finished with masses of hop character. Hard to think of another 5% or less beer that is better than this. Almost certainly the best of its kind. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2012 Great looking beer. Deep red gold with a tight beige head that lasts. Malt, caramel and light floral tone on the nose. The taste is nutty caramel overlaid with some assertive hops that lend a nice sour note. Won?t be for everyone, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.
A nice amber red ale.  I smell and taste caramel, hay and grassy hops.....a bit of citrus!?  Small bitterness in the end.

A good ale with hops. A nice amber beer with copper reflection, a nice medium head. Smell as hops and orange.First taste : flowers and orange, aftertaste : hops but for a court period. Really interesting beer!
Foral and citrus hops dominate the nose while the palate reveals the same with a strong lemon-peel bitterness. It was not bad. A decent, drinkable beer.

Flaska 33 cl, köpt på Systembolaget som BrewDog Mix 4-pack. Underbar öl! Stort gräddigt beigt skum som ligger fluffigt ovanpå den rödbruna ölen i en evighet. Ljuvliga dofter av apelsinskal och honung, med en stickig beska. Stor kropp, med skön efterbeska, där knäck, grapefrukt och en hel trädgård av sommarblommor slåss om dominansen. Ska jag säga något negativt om denna ytterst goda öl är att den är aningen, ANINGEN, vattnig. Men det är en randanmärkning.
330ml bottle from Brewdog. Really nice amber colour with medium head. Aroma is fruity, hops. Flavour is caramel, hoppy, bitter.
Reddish color. Wonderful piney-malty, even woodsly, aroma. Well balanced body, overall probably the best commercial us-style red ale ive tasted.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. 

Nothing really stands out on this beer. Just very well balanced and easy to drink. 

No real strong smell but a little malty. Pour a redish brown color with a white head. Taste is very clean drinking. Would buy again.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep red colour with a medium light beige head. Aromas of sweet malt but also with fruity hops. In the mouth I find berries, black crowberries, bisquits, rye, and some leather and fruity hops. A slick and a little bit watery mouthfeel, with light bitterness. An easy drinking beer but is still pretty tasty. The hops are significantly more dominant in the aroma than in the flavour.
Amber colour with an off white head. Fruity and hoppy nose. Hoppy grape flavour with a solid malty background.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

Bottle. Light to moderate malt notes of roasted and caramel, moderate pine and grapefruit peel for the hops, light soap for the yeast, with pepper and hints of dark dried fruit. Head is small, frothy, orange-beige, with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is murky but eventualy clears, medium orange/red. Flavor starts faintly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is medium, watery with a lively carbonation. A full array of everything that is good in beer, this Amber Ale is on of the best Ive had.

Draught at Beer OClock 2, in Bucharest.
Dark amber colour.
Long fine beige head.
Aroma has notes of blueberry, cherry and elderflower.
Taste is medium bitter.
It has an abrupt bitter finish.
Im really impressed by this beer!

Medium amber colour with a lasting creamy white head. Smell of malt, caramel and strong fruity citrus hops. You can smell that this will be sour. Orange peel, grapefrut. Medium thin body. Sweet start of malt with a citrus greapefruit hoppy finish. Lots of dry hops, not too different then other Brewdogs but nice nontheless.

330ml Bottle, best before 16 Jan 2012, drank and reviewed on 16 Aug 2011.

Before I start the proper review: Im not a fan of the way these brewers seek notice, but Ive had a few of their beers and although not seeking them out, dont shy away from them either. Ill try and be objective, not subjective.

This bottle is to be poured into a Back Forty Beer Co straight sided sleeve glass: got to be fair, it looked good, true amber body, clear and inviting, on top an off-white head that was full and creamy on the mouth.

Malty molasses filled the nose when taking in the smells, not roasted or toasted, burnt or otherwise, just an over-riding aroma of semi-sweet molasses.

The taste and mouthfeel were/are one of smooth maltiness without the over-sweetness sometimes found in other malty brews. A rich, almost creamy Mild (UK Dark Mild that is) sort of feel to it.

Would love to complain or bitch about it, but I enjoyed this beer: I prefer the slightly sweeter, maltier beers to the hoppy bitter ones normally and this slotted into my tastebuds well.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Bottle from Morrisons.  On the reddish side of amber. Very hoppy aroma. I like this combo of amber ale malts and aggressive hopping.This is more earthy than fruity to me, bitter, finish perhaps could be bigger. Good.

Rerate, keg in Draft House Charlotte. Maybe served over cold but felt a little thin and didnt have mouthfeel or finish of the best amber ales, still nice enough but taken rating from 3.5 to 3.3.
Bottle at Illegal Jacks. Pours pinkish-orange-red, thin bubbly head. Big hop aromas, tropical and herbal. Bready bitter flavours, intensely vegetal. Nice and fizzy.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish amber with a pretty big white head that quickly disappears leaving a small amount of lacing. Aroma is citrusy, grassy, and resiny hops. Flavour is quite hoppy with a bitter finish.
Veru nice refreshing amber ale. Light and very easy going down!

red brownish color. Nose is really really hoppy for a amber, lots and lots of dry hopping going on here. Big malt backbone but really hoppy and bitter. Not your typical amber ale by any means.. More like a really well balanced IPA.. really lovely
Pours red to amber, small head. Fruity aroma, pears and honey. Much fruit appears in the taste as well. Nice hops, but short. Mouthfeel rather thin.
Pale amber with a medium white head. Fruity with citrus tones. malt, fruits and bitterness. Medium body with a balanced , dry finish.

Pours a dark red, with a tiny head (Most probably because of the glass). Aroma of fresh hops, some caramel from the malt, citrus, floral tones.
Nice smooth palate, goes down easy. Flavour of green, spicy, floral hops, with a nice smooth bitterness and maltyness to it. Medium bodied. Awesome amber-ale!

Bottled.  Poured medium amber with a well-retained, sticky off-white head.. looked good in the glass.  The aroma picked up soft bread and fruity malts with more fruit and grassy hops around.. soft and entirely pleasant.  The flavor found similar stuff.. bread and biscuity malts at the core, with light grass, pine, and grapefruit bitterness around.. light earth and citrus bitterness over biscuity malt on the crisp finish.  Light-bodied with moderate-plus carbonation on the palate.. very dry.. not as bitter as expected, but it worked.

Brainstorming to find jokes about "what smells good but doesn't taste good" is more interesting than this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Quite unique. Very aromatic, like olives and citrus fruit and cream and sour cherries and peach and honey, among other stuff. 

Mouthfeel: Creamy and medium body. Some carbonation.

Taste: Gently but firmly sweet, like strawberry candy and honey. A tiny bit of sourness on the tongue, too.

Finish: Ends tart, spicy and dry.

Overall: Superb, stuff. Very drinkable. Very appetizing.

(12oz bottle from Provisions. Batch 329).  Pours a clear amber-red color with pillowing eggshell head.  Moderate carbonation.  Aroma has some resin, pine, hard candy, pumpernickel.  Taste is sweet malts with some sharp bitterness that starts up front and moves to the back of the throat.  Lighter bodied with a somewhat dry, but balanced finish.  Nothing earth shattering in these days of extreme beers, but something that Id consider sessioning if it were available at a reasonable price.
Pure class from Brewdog. Hoppy, malty, long on the tongue, after bitterness that lingers. Top.
Bottled. Amber with a huge white brown head. Smells grassy hoppy. Tastes dry bitter and hoppy with a similar finish.

330 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear amber with a frothy rust red / white head that leaves some trace and lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet, bitter and hoppy with caramel, peaches, mango, pine, grass, wood, resin, grapefruit juice and very small hints of sulphur and other unknown chemicals. Taste is bitter with grapefruit, orange zest, pine, grass, bread, wood, compost and hints of caramel. Mouthfeel is dry, tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is dry, bitter and tiny sour with grapefruit juice, orange zest and bread.

Bottle from Sb cons 2013-03-03 Göteborg
Ar: grape fruit, pine - simple as that
Ap: amber body, wee beige fizzy head
F: fizzy, loaded with bitterness/ grape fruit, mango, pine,dryness and metalic (undefined) bi-flavor

Ambrata. Aroma floreale, luppolato con qualcosa di conifera e di agrume e una venatura di uva. Al gusto si presenta subito amaricante, ma mai esageratamente, con un ventaglio di luppoli molto ampio. Pompelmo, resina e erba sono i sentori che si notano di più. Finale pulito e prolungato. Rinfresca e costringe a compiere il sorso successivo.

Bottle. It pours cloudy amber with an orangy head. The aroma has some plum, raisins, citrus and pine. The flavor is very fruity with peaches, plums, bread and a hint of brown sugar. It has a nice bitter finish. Pretty good amber definitely on the hoppy side.

330ml bottle. Thin head but quickly dissipated to a narrow rim with a few lace-like elements. Pours a dark red clear glass. Floral aroma, tastes of treakle weaness and lasting bitterness. Medium to full bodied, smooth luxury finish, light carbonation. For me one to linger over and enjoy.
Bottle. Pours a beautiful red copper with thin head. Nose is spicy with banana hints. Slightly thin body. Malt-caramel finish with hops and some fruity notes. Interesting.

Bottled:Deep amber colour. Dense head. I like the aroma: hops, ripe fruit, a little bit of shampoo, a little bit of licorice. Very bitter with thin mouthfeel. Pine, wood and hops. A bit rough and simplistic.

Bottle, from Morrison Scunthorpe. Hazy brown, thin but sustained off white head and moderate condition. Big hop resin nose with hints of tangy brett and a gentle floral soapiness, restrained hop bitterness with a chalky powdery note and solid resinous citrus notes, lingering hop resin and bitterness in the finish

Trevlig doft, fast smaken är besk och lite gammal stekpanna. Tydlig humle och malt men lite enformig. En svagare version av punk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber with a grey dense head. Fruity aroma with notes of pine, grass, peach and sweet liquorice. Sweet flavour with a citric and bitter finish.
Pours a reddish brown with a white head. Hops, caramel and malt on the nose.  Caramel and pine flavours.
Blommig doft av rosor och maskrosor. Smaken bjuder på en dimension av ruby red grapefrukt. Kroppen kunde varit lite maffigare..men man kan inte få allt.  Eftersmaken och beskan varar länge. God.

Very hoppy aromas of grape, tropical fruits and some honey. It seems like a very dry hopped one...
If aromas was great than taste wasnt what i expected. It is low carbonated it has some level of sweetness but almost no palate at al. Not satisfied with this one.
UPDATED: APR 4, 2012 Pours a cloudy dark amber. Aroma is fruity. Some grapefruit, some caramel... Planty of aromas. Flavor is hoppy and fruity. Bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Amber/copper in color, a one inch off-white head which diseappers quickly but leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is  very hoppy, tropical fruits, citrus, peach and some hints of malt and resin. Taste has base of caramelly sweetness, the higher notes consist of some fruitiness from the hops but not as much as the aroma hinted of. A lasting medium bitterness. Medium body and low/medium carbonation.
Pours a cloudy dark amber. Aroma is slight caramel malts with a strong fruity citrus hop scent. Taste is very hippy with tropical fruity hops and bitter hop finish. Not too shabby.

Bottle.

Dark amber with a medium white head. Fruity aroma with hops. The taste was fruity with notes of caramel and grape. The finish was dry. Descent beer.

33 cl bottle from a 4-bottle mix pack my brother got from Systembolaget in Umeå. Sampled on March 1, 2012Batch 548, BB 13-12-12Clear brown color, yellow head. Very hoppy, fresh open hop bag scent. Sort of mineral and hoppy taste. Short aftertaste. A bit thin mouthfeel. Medium dry bitterness.

11.2oz bottle from Armanettis. Pours a lightly clouded, deep amber-brown colored body with a huge, over-carbonated, very dense and foamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a sticky lacing. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with a caramel and toffee malt backing. Orange and citrus pines, spruce, big mangos, peach, and tropical fruits. Flavor is slightly chewy toffees and caramels up front with lots of fruity hops. A touch of toast with the mangos, peaches, and citruses before this finishes dry with a medium, resiny, piney, spruce bitterness and a light amber malt sweetness. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a higher, creamy and lively carbonation. Overall, a well hopped amber. Nice toffee and caramel malt backing with lots of fruity, fairly assertive hops. Over-carbonated, but not bad.
Bottle, pours clear amber with medium head. Aroma is hoppy with fruits, mango and some malts, smells nice. Taste is fruity hoppy with some caramel notes. Smooth and easy to drick.
UPDATED: MAR 13, 2012 Bottle. Reddish amber colour with an off-white head. Hoppy, fruity, perfumy aroma. Hoppy, fruity, perfumy flavor. Faint caramel notes. Bitter, dry & a bit astringent finish.

330ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours dark amber with a light off-white head. Nice hoppy, fruity aroma. Bitternes in the palate, not as much fruits than in the aroma. Dry aftertaste.
33 cl bottle - Pours deep hazy amber with an off-white head. Nose of peach and grapefruit. Taste is very fruity (peach again). Medium body with medium carbonation. Long dry finish. Refreshing. Nice

looks very nice, with an amber body and small white head. smell is US hops, loads of fruit and grapefruit. aftertaste is long and grapefruity. body is dry and very easygoing.

Love it!

First one out of four in a sampler pack. Good start it was. Pours amber with fairly small off-white head. Aroma is very hoppy, with grape, citrus and tropical fruit notes. Very enjoyable. Some malt and caramel in there as well to balance it. Taste is not as hoppy as I would have expected from the smell, but still clearly present from the start. The malt is more present here, with a very sweet and bready side to it. Fairly long but not overly powerful bitter finish. Mouthfeel is light to medium, somewhat creamy, with low carbonation.
Bottle. Dark amber with a huge, foamy head. Lovely look! Smells like grapefruit heaven mixed with malts. Sweet and bitter. Quite simple a lovely red ale with a fresh hoppy edge.
a tasty brew that feels stonger than its 5%, pours a deep red, very fruity with a lingering fruity aftertaste, very enjoyable and easily drinkable

Om jag får välja en sak att lukta på innan jag dör så hade jag valt en flaska 5 a.m. Saint från Brewdog. Den är helt enkelt ljuvlig. Smaken är något försiktigt men fruktig och frisk med en passande beska. Kroppen är också den lite försiktig men ändå väl anpassad till ölen. Slutsats: ölen är bra och god men man hade nästan lika gärna bara kunnit sitta och dofta på den.

Appearance: deep clear ruby reds, garnets, and glints of polished mahogany. Pours with a sparkle, settling under an off-white head which fades with bubbles. A solid layer persists atop a slow stream of lazy bubbles.

Nose: dried peaches and apricots. Melba crunch. White and pink grapefruit. Lemon peel and lemon zest. Orange peel and orange zest. Lime. Crunchy caramelization.

Palate: bitter up front with lots of zippy rind, peel, and zest of lemon, lime, orange, and grapefruit  ohmy! Sweetness underneath is crunchy caramelized apple skin and melba toast goodness. Vegetable bitterness atop the middle of my tongue, then its gone. White and pink grapefruit in the finish  fresh and unsweetened with tingly acidity. Parching and thirst inducing at the same time. Lemon and lime zest.

Final Thoughts: yes! A session beer withwait for itflavor! They really can and do go together. I promise. The 5 A.M. Saint from BrewDog out of Aberdeenshire, Scotland comes in handy 6packs, perfect for ones session needs, whether they be at 5 A.M. or later.or earlier. Whatever is your pleasure. I know what mine is and yes, I will have another.

Bottle: pours a nice coppery amber with a healthy head. Aromas of flowery citrus. It has the flavors of a wonderful citrusy bitterness that is smacked in the face by a sweetness that balances it out well.  Great beer.
Fully hoppy aroma. Very flower with a nice bitterness. This beer has a very full body, I would have expected it more water considering the alcohol content, but this beer does not disappoint.

I had this in a bottle, but something tells me I need to one day seek it out on tap. As far as amber ales go, I would put this up against some of the best and more complex of its kind. Easy to drink or down quickly, the 5 A.M. Saint has plenty of kick for being such a toned-down-in-potency ale. BrewDog is most famous for its high volume, rare beers, but out of the few that you can find regularly (if you have a decent liquor store nearby) this is one to try out. Not a bad choice for accessibility if you are having a gathering.

On draft.
Nice amber color with a good foam that quickly fades away.
Amazing hoppy aromas. 
Taste is smooth and easy going. Perfect body balance. Nice beer to have on tap. .

botted. sure enough, amber with a lasting thin white head; decent aroma of pine and deodorant; some butterscotch well balanced by a green grassiness and butterscotch. a very good amber ale: not words i usually put together
Amber colour. Citrus hops and bread in the aroma. Taste is hoppy caramel. Slight bitterness.

Strong hop character on the nose.  Smells like some north west hops, fresh smelling.  Plenty of pine almost smells juicy.  Off-white head, tan slightly grey color.  Cup isnt clear, cant comment on the color but pours pretty dark.  Mouthfeel is slippery and solid.  Taste has plenty of grassy notes, some pine and citrus.  Bursting with flavor at 5%.  Im afraid that this bottle is skunked, the aftertaste is quite tangy, I cant imagine this is what the brewer intended.  It originally was cold, it warmed up, and I cooled it down in ice... maybe that ruined it.  Solid effort, but ill have to re-rate.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a light rust color.  Faint aroma of hops, caramel.  Flavor was heavy on the malts - toffee, caramel, citrus.  All in all, this was good.  Perhaps a little watery for my preference.   The ridiculous message on the bottle begs for a snotty review, but the beer stands on its own, despite the narsassistic rumblings on the bottle.

Had ad bottle a Bottle Screw Bills in YYC while rushing for a Red Arrow bus. Hazy, medium amber body with a good-sized, off-white, fully lasting head that covers the glass in lacing. Good start! Super fruity aroma that is all hops, for the most part grapefruit, but there might be some pine and resin there as well. Despite the hoppy aroma the taste is initially light sweet, thats a nice touch! Then the finish comes, and it is of course aggressively bitter and delicious. A subtle sweet malty caramel flavour is followed and partially mixed with a firm grapefruit flavour. Medium body, soft carbonation, quite dry feel. Its a bit like a more complex, more interesting, beefed-up and hoppy version of an Amber Ale. Fucking doctors strike again.

Bottled. Pours deep amber with a head that goes fast. Immediate release of a pungent, floral, hoppy aroma which is the most striking feature of the beer. Overall the beer has hops in abundance from start to finish, but bitterness balanced by malt sweetness. Yet another good one from the Brew Dog stable.

Half pint at Euston Tap, Euston Road, London.  As is typical of the BrewDog range this has a strong, fruity aroma mixed with hops - berries this time as opposed to some of its more tropical fruit-based label mates.  It doesnt smell like you expect beer to smell, which is either a good thing or a bad thing depending on your sensibilities; for me its the former.  The taste is a big surprise - definite hints of cocoa mixed in with the fruity hops.  A little fizzy in the mouth so perhaps not as smooth on the palate as it could be but still rather good.

(Bottle) Pours dark amber red with a pale sand coloured head. The aroma is clear hoppy with notes of strawberries, sweet pink grapefruit, orange juice and some white flowers. Doughy and bready undertones with a hint of caramel. The flavour is dry, medium bitter and tiny acidic. Metal/copper tones up front with grapefruit citric undertones. The mouthfeel is empty with a soft carbonation. Abrupt finish, only a touch of bitterness lingers. Light to medium bodied.

The aroma is amazing, really juicy, loads of blackcurrant, grape and other ripe fruits. Some pine and citrus. Taste has lots of the same fruity notes, more pine, resin and zingy citrus flavours. Malt backbone is there but Im not getting as much as I expected. Way better than punk as i find its getting too much like lilt! Top!

5 A.M. Saint pours a clear reddish dark amber.  A huge two finger head is poured and sticks around for ages.  When I was done with this brew, it left a ton of lacing throughout.  The smell on this one is lovely.  Full of citrus and piney hops with a little bit of a grapefruit aroma.  I believe this one has 4 kinds of hops in it.  Chinook, Simcoe, Nelson Sauvin, and Centennial.  A really nice mixture.  A nice backbone of caramel malt

Bottom line on the taste is that its one of the best sessionable tasting beers Ive ever had.  I noticed more of a ESB kind of taste then I did in the aroma.  Still Id say this is Red Ale.  A really nice drop hopped taste up front.  Citrus and grapefruit.  But the dry hopped part of the beer just hit the spot for me.  Mixed in their is the caramel malt a nice sweetness.  The beer ends with a slight bitterness.  Its a very hoppy and clean taste.

The mouthfeel on this one is very slick and maybe a little watery.  Light bodied with medium carbonation.
Rich color and aroma. A very flavorful beer, good malt base with an unexpected amount of hops.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Veramente ottima! Unaltra birra della BrewDog fantastica!!! Anche piu buona della punk ipa, forse perche lho ritrovata anche meno amara. Si presenta subito bene con uno splendido colore ambrato una schiuma color crema e non persistente, lodoro e simile alla punk ma meno intenso e piu gradevole il sapore e meraviglioso floreale, erbaceo e anche un po futtato, il finale e leggermente amaro! La migliore della BrewDog!!!
Bottle. The best thing about 5 a.m. Saint is its appearance - a beautiful red to golden body. Hoppy to the hills - very tasty.

330 ml bottle cellar cool. Pours dark red with an offwhite head. Immediate grapefruit aroma and taste, like the Punk IPA, and the first mouthful delivers a lot of citrus/tropical fruit. Then, in the lingering aftertaste, there are some satisfying caramel malt notes, followed by a bitter hoppy finish.Really good beer.
Draft at Euston Tap, London. Great dark ale, perfect hopping over dark, green body. Malty and rich, buttery and touch medicinal. Really terrific.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2012 Color:Amber
Aroma:Hopy fruity, some caramel
Body:Hint of nuttyness, some sweetness, citrus hopps
Finish:Unpleasant bitter
Over-all/Mouth-fell:Charp

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 2014-10-31
Pours clear amber with tan head. 
Aroma citrus, grapefruit, caramel, dark fruits, dark sugar, butterscotch. 
Taste caramel sugary sweet, strong hoppy bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
One of my favorites. 

2012-06-16
33cl. Bottle.
Poors clear amber with creme/white strong head.
Aroma is fruity, dark fruits, citrus, dark sugar. 
Taste has a good strong bitter, hint of sweet.
Mouth-feel thin.
Its an amazing beer.

2012-01-26
Aroma: Nice fruity aroma.
Appearance: Clear amber with almost white strong head.
Taste: Good bitter, little sweet.
Palete: light body, thin feel, lively.
Overall: Lovely delicious amber ale I love this beer!

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 33cl bottle. Pours deep copper red with thin off white head. Tons of pungent fruity hops and caramel malt on the nose. Deep fruit & pine flavour, bit of fig, plenty of caramel malt. Wonderfully satisfying finish, long aftertaste - a storming amber ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from cervezalandia, Spain. Brown and amber color. Thin head. Low to medium carbonation. Low sweetness, high bitterness and dryness. Hop and fruit aroma.

Cerveza color ambar, con cabeza mediana que presenta regular retencion.

En el aroma al igual que la Trashy Blond y la Punk IPA, aunque con menor intensidad, tiene notas de frutas tropicales y notas citricas caracteristicas de las India Pale Ale, ademas tiene notas de malta y de caramelo; en resumen es una aroma excelente con un gran balance.

El sabor es exquisito, con un gran balance entre malta y lupulo, es referescante, cremoso, de cuerpo medio, con nivel medio de malta y medio-alto de lupulo, con notas citricas, de frutas tropicales (mango, maracuya, piña), y de caramelo. 

Brew Dog me ha sorprendido gratamente con su linea base de cervezas, ya que todas poseen un gran balance tanto en aroma como en sabor; simplemente deliciosas. El unico problema es el precio, pero esperemos que en cuanto su demamanda aumente (que estoy seguro de que lo hará), se importe un mayor volumen, y por lo tanto se redusca el precio.

5 AM Saint really lives up to the holier-than-thou,  pretentious notes that accompany this beer on the side of the bottle.  Simply put this the sheer taste of this amber ale has catapulted it into one of my top beers of all time.

Nice to see that Brewdog can walk the talk.

Though it must be noted I preferred this in the cask over the keg.  Unfortunately it seems as though Brewdog have stopped using casks altogether
Bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Big hop aroma and flavour well balanced with malt. Very close in style to an American IPA. A great beer.

Brewdog Tent Bottle@ Berliner Bierbörse 2010. Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar 2012 I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.
2012 - 01 - 20 300ml bottle. red-amber colour. small white head. light fuity, heavy hop in aroma. bitter taste.
Smell of hops and spices. Brownish red, tiny white head. Heavy aroma of hops. Fruity.

Bottle from Jumbo, Batch #118 In the glass shows a hazy reddish amber color with a big fluffy off-white crown that diminishes slowly. Aroma is nicely hoppy and fruity, IPA like. It shows notes of apples, pine, resin, hay and lemongrass. Great! Taste is quite bitter, intense and fresh. Hints of resin, lemon, mango and grainy, caramel notes from the malty backbone. 25 IBU my ass! Feels dry hopped and with at least 75 IBU. Dry finish, very drinkable and with good carbonation. Long aftertaste of hops. A rich, bitter amber ale with loads of character.

Bottle 33 cl. Dark amber with a fluffy off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel hops and grapefruit. Sweet taste of malt, caramel and grapefruit. Great hop bitterness from American hop varieties, great dryness and a long bitter hop finish

11.2 fl oz bottle. Best-by date: 5-8-12. Nice, darker clear amber color, with a good, thin but persistent creamy light tan head. Some splotches of lace. Very tasty malts here, with a distinct spice that I cant name that lends a unique sort of smoky nutty taste. Subdued hop balance. Carbonation is a bit stronger, but the texture is dry and smooth. A tasty and unique amber ale.
Bottle from Beer planet web shop.Amber color with huge beige head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine. Taste, mango, grapefruit, pine, floral hops. Dry floral hoppy finish. Very good beer.

Served in a half pint glass.
Crystal clear, brown with red golden glints.
First aromas are cedrat and litchi that remind me Cascade hop-like flavours.
Unfortunately the bitter and fizzy unbalanced mouth as well as after taste of rubber and malt disappoint.  
This amber ale would be too boring as an aperitive but could be drunk with a meal.
Bottle. Amber red with white head. Hoppy nose. Malt flavour with over riding hops. Nelson. the amber ale tag seems almost unfair with the depth of hop flavour. A great utility beer.

Very hoppy, floral aroma with notes of muscat.  Golden brown color with small amount of head.  Taste is sharp, quick and hoppy with a dry finish.  Not overly complex but still quite tasty.  Tastewise seems to fall almost into an IPA category, for which is it is average.
Frissítő, gyümölcsös aroma. Száraz komlós keserűség. Mindkettő elfért ebben e csodálatos nedűben.

330 ml bottle. Deep red/amber with a yellowish/cream head. Heavy on the hops - grapefruit strikes through, as do lemons and tangerines. Bitter on the tongue, but it opens out some nice roasty sweetness. Settles down into a nice length bitter and mid-dry finish. Delicious!

A - caramel and citrus
A - dark amber with thin frothy head
T - sweet with roasted finish
P - mid to full and soft
O - great

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2012 Bottle. Pours with a small airy head. Darker amber colour. Striking aroma of hops, also some citrus fruits, notes of wood, roasted. Medium to heavy bitter, light sweet  taste. Hops is dominating. Lingering, but pleasant bitter finish.

Nice mahogany red colour. Quite a tart aroma but nothing to rave on about. Little initial taste - masked by "pricklyness" of the beer, but settles into a hoppy toffee finish. Pleasant, but Ive had better.

Bottle from Morrisons. Pours dark amber, almost brown with creamy and frothy beige head. Darker than I remember actually. Aroma is quite hoppy, bit pine, but cat pee, and a bit of fruitiness too, some orange, and lemon. Little bit of stink too. Taste is initially bitter, but this fades into sweet toffee maltiness with just a hint of bitterness. Bit of a prickle in the mouth. Pleased to drink and enjoy the bottled version again, as previous to this I have had it on keg in a couple of pubs and been disappointed. Presume that the Brewdog bar wont have this problem.

Bottle. Pours a copper brown/amber brew. Small head. Fruity aroma, with notes of yeast and grassy hops. Wonderful flavor with lots of piny/grassy hops up front, then a solid bitterness and semi-sweet caramely malt flavor in the finish, and finally it goes full circle and ends in with more of the initial hop flavors. Light body, easy to drink, perfect carbonation. Pretty great!
bottle.  interesting - didnt enjoy as much as I thought I would - however, for an amble ale, about as good as it gets.
11.2 oz. bottle from Dawsons.  Nice amber pour with small tan head.  Strong grassy aroma.  Very hoppy up front with a nice smooth finish.  Great amber.  One of the best Ive had.

Keg at Brewdog Camden, London on 10th December 2011. Amber with offwhite film of foam and partial lacing. Intense herby/grainy aroma; taste in-mouth is grassy herbiness, fine grapefruit and hemp. Rich and intense. There follows a lasting finish of intense hoppiness and a slight soapy note. Zingy and engaging texture and a very dry finish.

330ml bottle pours a pale amber color with about a finger of white head which leaves some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is mild caramel and citrusy hops.  Taste is light caramel sweetness balanced nicely with citrusy hop bitterness and a hint of nuttiness.  Medium body and nice carbonation contribute a nice mouthfeel.  A pretty enjoyable amber ale.
Bottle. Dark reddish coffee colour. Creamy head. Full and balanced fruity aroma. Fruity and bitter finish.

Iconoclastic amber ale (c) áåç ñîìíåíèÿ ÿâëÿåòñÿ îäíèì èç ñàìûõ ïîïóëÿðíûõ ñîðòîâ, ïðîèçâîäèìûõ øîòëàíäñêèìè «ïàíêàìè». Îòëè÷íîå «ñåññèîííîå» ïèâî.

Flaske 0,33l fra Alko Muonio. Drukket hjemme 19 Sep 11. Gyldenbrun. Høyt luftig skum som fester seg til glasset. Veldig pent. Heftig IPA-aroma. Sitron. Aprikos. Lite kullsyre. Smaken avdempet fruktig. Litt parfymepreg. Litt bitterhet langt uti ettersmaken.

From Key keg. Amber golden color with an average creamy off-white head. Caramel malty aroma with lots of aromatic fruity hops. Flavour is balanced between caramel and lots of citric fruit hops leadign to a dry bitter finish. Lovely.

Saint pours a stunning mulberry colour, summer in a glass.  You can instantly pick up a bouquet of raspberries, oranges.  Dry and slightly tart in the mouth with a creamy white head which retains well.  Medium carbonation which compliments the flavour mixture and texture very well.  Quite hoppy with burning caramel and nuts coming through as it warms up slightly.

I like this a lot.
A finger of pillowy head on this terrific amber ale.  Smells of caramel and roasted malls, with citrus and pine.  This is a great example of this style!
Forse la migliore di casa Brewdog. Ottimo equilibrio tra gusto e corpo. Per me, la Brewdog ha fatto centro con questa birra.

pours red/amber with a pillowy off white head. lovely aroma of fruit fruits and caramel. taste is light, flowery/fruity, with high carbonation, and a dry hoppy bitterness. its possibly a bit thin, but I enjoyed this ale a lot.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2011 Pours dark amber with good resinous aroma up front and tropical fruit. Pine, toffee and oatcakes. Good fresh hop bite and sweetish finish with grapefruit and resin.
Ratebeer app fails again. Nice amber colour. hop. floral and honey aroma. watery feel which i feel most brewdogs have.

11.2 oz bottle, best before 8/12.  Just clear brown with crimson tints.  Thin but clingy beige head.  Nose is peach, nectarine, red berries and candi with a touch of pine.  Medium body; resiny, oily and sticky with a tingle.  Is this the same beer i just smelled?  Slight caramel sweetness then lemon peel, quinine and dried apricot.  Brash but never quite over the top.
Donker amberkleurig met witte kraag. Vol in de mond met lekker veel koolzuur. Hop en lychee overheersen de smaak. Fris bitter. Wederom een lekker bier van brewdog.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2013 In this style, as a refreshing session ale, this is a favourite of mine. Looks great - amber with a decent foamy head. Nice upfront hoppy aroma with a well balanced malt taste that follows through nicely. Very refreshing and drinkable. If I was socialising in a traditional cask ale pub and they had a keg of this on, Id  be drinking it all night.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2011 0,33l bottle from Csakakjósör, Budapest. A very beautiful amber ale. Dark amber and red colour. Epic hoppy aroma. Its fresh and fruity. It smells a bit like delicious herbal. Its taste is spicy bitter and fruity. Orange and grapefruit. Sweet hoppy palate. A really nice, beautiful, deliciuos ale. It worths its prize.

A - Pours a slightly hazy copper-red color with a finger of frothy off-white head atop. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is full of sweet toasted caramel malts and lots of piney/earthy hops. Bit of citrus mixed in there as well.

T - Starts off with some huge piney hops with some strong bitterness. Bit of toasted sweet caramel malts as well. Through the middle, some more bitterness comes through with a bit of bready malt character. The finish is a mix of piney bitterness and some light citrus that ligners.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a strong pine resin feeling left on the tongue. Quite dry as well.

D - Very drinkable. Fairly bold flavors for the 5% abv. The bitterness and hop flavor is nicely balanced by the malt though.

Bouteille de 330 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de caramel avec une pointe dhoublons. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence damertume dhoublons en arrière goût. (Rating #3989)
Bottle. Amber coloured.  floral, citrus, biscuit aroma, very bitter with a nice and long finish. slick feel but fun and fizzy.  A great beer to have, would love a steady supply of it.

330ml bottle, dark amber-copper color, with a bubbly beige head, sweet fruity, toasted, caramel, biscuity malt nose, with some toffee, nutty, brown chocolate, light sponge toffee notes, with a faint bran muffin, fruitcake accents, within a mild floral, leafy, grassy, piney, citrus orange, lemon peel hop aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice earthy sweet grainy toatsed, caramelized, biscuity, bready malt character, with a good flowery, leafy, grassy, piney, minty hop backbone, and with a light citrusy, lemon, lime, grapefruit peel undertone, and a faint toffeeish, nutty accent, leading towards a caramelized, toasted maltiness, lingering piney, grassy, leafy, minty, citrusy hop bittering finish.

Sarà ma io questo tipo di birre, le berrei in continuazione, non mi appesantiscono e vanno giù che è una goduria, lasciando anche una bocca pulita e appagata. Buona dal colore, allaroma frutta-caramello, al palato asciutto.

Thanks Slovaksniper!!! Pour amber brown with a beige head decent lace. Aroma caramel, earthy, resiny hops, citrus, light pine, fruity. Taste toffee, chocolate, caramel, earthy, citrus, hops, fruity. MF medium body mild carb. Tasty easy drinker nothing special or overly memorable.
Bottle, great beer, tasty, drinkable, lovely colour, loads of aroma, solid taste

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2016 Bottle. Amber body with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, orange, chocolate and cherry. Flavour of lychee, toffee, spun sugar and dark chocolate. Thin body with an oily texture. Light fizz. Complex in flavour, with the fruitiness and bitterness complementing each other perfectly. An excellent beer. Still one of BrewDogs best.

Bottle. Hazy amber with a not too lasting head. Aroma is malt and a fruity-foresty mix of hop aromas: grapefruit, white grapes, mango, plums, pine and resin, plus some tea and faint honey. Great, dry taste, despite the rather weak body. Very light and at the same time aromatic beer with quite a strong and lasting bitterness given the only 25 IBU. Aftertase of tropical fruit and pine forest with some liquorice and nuts. A truly great, aromatic hop bomb!

Appearance: Dark red/amber, clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Sweet, fruit, caramel.
Taste: Sweet, fruity with some hops. Also some malt.
Info: 330ml bottle, 28/10-2011

Bottle bought at Sainsburys in South Ruislip. An amber/red coloured pour with a small beige head on top. Excellent fruity, American hop aroma. Tastes hoppy, malty, caramel, fruity and slightly dry. This would make a great session ale. A really good American inspired ale from Brewdog.

THOUGHTS: Very full and flavorful for a lower ABV beer. But not flavors that I really want in a beer. Mightve been a little skunked. Also a few months past best by date.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a very dark brownish amber with a huge, foamy, sudsy and rocky, tan head that very slowly diminished and left excellent and very clumpy lacing. The aroma had moderate to heavy caramel and hints of tea; light to moderate grassy and metallic hops; lighter pine hops; toffee and cola. The initial flavor was light to moderately sweet and lightly bitter; while the finish was lightly sweet, moderately bitter and light to moderately sour with a little longer than average duration. There was caramel malt, grassy and metallic hops and a little sour fruit. The medium body was a little syrupy, but also somewhat oily with lightly fizzy carbonation and a metallic and slightly chalky finish.

Bottle (33 cl) from the Cracked Kettle, Clear amber, medium off-white head. Hoppy and slightly caramelly aroma with notes of citrus, goose berries and pine needles. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium to high bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2011 Bouteille de 350ml. Batch 192. Bière ambrée avec une mousse brune et compacte. Le nez est de caramel, de houblon frais et de sucre brun. La bouche est dans le même registre, un amalgame sucré-amère de caramel grossier et de houblons américains. Lamertume en fin de bouche est bien marqué.

Bottle: Poured a clear amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of dry caramel malt notes with some light floral citrus notes. Taste is a well balanced mix between some light caramel malt notes with some notes of light citrus hops. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not bad but more bland then what I was expecting considering the brewer isnt the most conventional one.
Bottle, huge fruity aroma, deep red amber with a white top. Initial great taste becomes slightly cloying, reducing drinkability.

330ml bottle.
Pours a deep amber, white head.
Very hoppy aroma - spruce, pine resin, grapefruit peel - with notes of ripe fruits, caramel and malt.
Off-dry, medium body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, hoppy taste, grapefruit, spruce, caramel, apricots. Very drinkable. (2011-10-06)
Another great beer from Brew Dog.  Pours deep reddish copper and features a piney bitterness that complements its slightly sweet finish.  Tried at the Bierspeciaalcafe de Paas in the Hague.

12 fl oz bottle from Bieropholie, served cold in a tulip glass. 12OC11. 
App.:  Clear deep copper with a nice tan foam.
  
Aroma:  Slightly medicinal, some nice fruity malts, a touch earthy and nutty, slightly peppery, nice C-hops, caramel, a little dark dried fruit, nice.
  
Palate:  Medium body, reasonably lively effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Brown sugar, earthy, a little fruity, pine an C-hops, caramel, toasted, a touch vegetal, nice again; dry with good bitterness, with a brown sugar/caramel and resinous C-hops finish.

Best 5 AM ever.

16/09/2011 33cl @ home - BB: 22/12/11(2011-442) 
Pretty cloudy copper red to almost pink coloured beer, aery yellow to beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet fruit, raisins, strawberry candy, peaches, passion fruits, dried plums, fudge, bit of milk chocolate, pepper. Very complex and interesting! MF: soft carbon, light to medium body, cit creamy texture. Taste: bit sour start, red currants, some citrus, sweet caramel hint, fruity hops, bit floral even (thinking rose petals and chamomile here). Aftertaste: sour touches with bitter hops, lots of grapefruit.

Bruin amber bier, beige schuimkraag. Caramel, citrus, dennenaalden en wat kruidige aromas. Moutige smaak, zoetig, bitter, caramel, citrus met een mooie hop in de achtergrond. Fris en drinkbaar. Gekocht bij de AH.
From bottle in vines bar. Pours an amber red with thin head. Complex hop aroma and light refreshing taste. Very drinkable.
Most refreshing, complex tasting beer Ive had in ages.  This is beer that really hits the spot with me; its completely satisfying! :-)
Very good red ale! Well balanced, tasty and enjoyable in all means. Another gem from BrewDog.

(33 cl, batch 192)  Dark amber ale with a sheet of foam.  Some lacing.  Nose is filled with toasted malts, grapefruit, raisins, mango and more.  Very nice fruitiness.  Maybe some leafy hops.  Not so sure about that.  Anway, taste is moderalty sweet with some delicious and bitter hops.  Very pleasant palate : body is medium, carbonation is moderate to soft and texture seems to be oily.  Nice lasting smooth bitter finish.    Overall, very drinkable stuff.

Brownish ruby red, slightly off white head. Aroma of caramel, spice, pine needles and some citrus notes. The taste begins malty, caramelly, citrusy and finishes piney, bitter, with citrus notes in the background. Long finish. Interesting and refreshing beer.
0.33 l bottle from Alko. Reddish amber color. Citrusy hop aroma with some tropical fruits, onions, toffee and dark caramel. Citrusy, caramelly and toffeish flavor with dry, salty and bitter finish.

Scharf bitterer Antrunk mit trockener Säure. Der blumige Hopfen steht dabei eher im Hintergrund. Holzige Noten kommen im Mittelteil hervor, die Säuerlichkeit wird ein wenig stärker, die Bitterkeit lässtwässrige Noten durchblitzen. Rundes und volles, dazu süffiges Bier. Super Erfrischung! 11/12/12/11/11/12

Bottle. Pours a medium red. Fluffy head, reasonable carbonation. Hop aroma is stunning, full of floral aromatic character. The taste follows suit with a blast off sweet hop, then an almost chewy malt sensation. Not as bitter as I remember, lovely beer.

Clear brown, no bubbles. Light beige head with lacing.
Malty red fruit aroma.
Fruity, malty with a lasting/building pepper/bitter aftertaste.
Big fan, but the hoppiness can overpower the rest of the beer, stops it scoring higher.
330ml bottle. Dark red amber, white little brownish head. Aroma has some clear pine. Lots of hops and taste ends with bitterness. Since I like it I guess I am so called hophead then?

Pours a rich red, topped with a rocky light beige head. The aroma is heavy with caramel, some earthy spice and a touch of smoke. Taste is piney hop bitterness overwhelming the sweetness of the caramel malt. Thin bodied and increasingly rank as drinking continues.

Tastes like hops but not in a good way - pellets and all that : pleasant but the hop overpower

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2012 330mL bottle, pours a deep redish copper with a small offwhite head . Has a gargantuan aroma of pine, mango, toffee, caramel, tropical fruit all mixed in together and they complement each other so well. Taste is grapefuit and pine  with the sweet toffee malt. Overall this beer floored my taste buds, so much flavour in this beer and its only 5%! I could drink it all night.
Cloudy orange color with white head and very active carbonation. Fresh piney hoppy aroma with some orange. Big mouthful of sweet hops with notes of butterand almonds.

11.2 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy amber with a massive tan head that recedes to a film by mid-glass and leaves partial lace.  Its a little difficult to get a sense of the aroma; the head is so huge.  What I am getting is crystal malt with some notes of pine.  The flavor is malt followed by a strong dose of bitter piney hops.  Medium bodied.  A bit over-the-top for me, but one Im sure the hopheads will enjoy.

This one will not go down as one of my favorites. Absoluety worst looking beer I can remember. I really can not get past the look.  Cloudy and muddy looking brew. As far as flvornit has tons.  Similar tasting to a pale ale. Overall, not my favorite.

Bottle. Amber colour with little head. Aroma of lychee, malts and other fruits. Flavour really returns the lychee, making it sweet with a bitter start and finish. The bitterness might startle a bit, but I got used to it now. Nice.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear reddish brown colour, some white head. Grape fruity hoppy aroma with some caramel malts. Sweetish malty taste has grape fruit. Quite bitter for an amber ale.
