330ml bottle. Pours dark amber red with a nice frosty head. A clear hoppy aroma with that distinct BrewDog scent. A very nice well balanced product. Not Bad.

one of my very favourite beers.
whats bad about it? nothing although the colour is not really to my taste, dirty brown being the best description.  but hey, im not raving for the colour.  Its all about the aroma and the flavour - wow! bags of smell: citrus hops really smash through, in the mouth there is some earthy and grassy notes.a little sweetnes - toffeeyish is balanced by a little maltiness.
i could drink this all day and still find nuances in it.
everyone should have one in stock for when they need cheering up!
Dark amber, thick frothy head.  Sappy hop aroma with mostly bitter flavors mixed with light fruit and a touch of malt.  The finish is bitter and "dry" - a bit of resin.
Bottle, pours a nice amber, the smell is very bit yeasty. Can taste the typical amber malts and there some carmel in there. It was a pretty decent offering
Bottle @ home. Dark burnt orange appearance with a big foamy tan head. Piney, earthy hoppy, toasty amber malty aroma. Toasty caramel malty flavor with an earthy hoppiness.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20110122.
Pours clear amber colour with medium beige head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, resin, syrup, grass and some caramel. Flavour of fruits, grass, malts, mild caramel and some metal at the end. Bitter palate which turns a bit too harsh at the end.
3514

33 cl, bottled. Pours clear red with a nice creamy head. Aroma: Hops, berries, grass, fruits. Tropical. Taste: Fair bitterness, grapefruit. Balancing sweetness. Hints of mild licorice in aftertaste. Spruces. Palate: Medium body, a bit thin. Noticeable carbonation.

Reddish amber pour with 1/2 finger head that fades to a skin.  Aroma is disturbingly similar to Alpha King, huge caramel and toffee backed up by a massive dose of pinecone-y resin.  Taste is mellow toffee, bright citric hops, then caramel, then resin on the finish.  Body is light-medium average carbonation, creamy, dry finish.  Overall, a little light on the body, taste doesnt come together as intensely as the aroma lead me to believe.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of light-moderate caramel, faint chocolate (sort of tootsie roll-ish), and a touch of fruit.   It pours murky reddish-orange with a one finger soapy khaki head that leaves behind some spotty lacing.  Theres no way the picture on the side of this page contains a bottle that is filled with 5 A.M. Saint.  I cant see through the beer in a clear glass...never mind a brown bottle.  The flavor starts with light caramel.  The finish has light-moderate fruit with some earthy/floral hops, and a hint of nuts.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.  Overall, I find the aroma a little lacking but the flavor makes it a solid session brew.

Wonderfully fruity hops aroma with hints of tropical fruits such as apricot and peach. The taste is just as delightful fruity and it also has spicy nuances that makes me think of crayfish broth. Certainly there are hints of malt as well, but flavors are mainly about delightful fruity and spicy hops!
Bottle. Amber body, decent head. Flowery aroma of hops. Taste is hoppy and mildly malty. A bit thin palate. Finish is dry and seawatery. Apart from the aroma its nothing special.
Keg at Port Street Beer House, Manchester.  Lovely Red Ale, nice head on Keg.  Also nice from the bottle.  One of my favourite Red ales at the moment

Bottle from BQ, Milano
Fresh aroma of hoppy citrus, cookies. Clear copper w offwhite creamy head. Taste of lemon and piney bitterness. Palate is light-medium w oily texture. Medium carbonation. Nice, especially considering that the abv isnt higher.

12 oz. bottle, bought 7/10 @ Binnys, $3.30. "Best before 19/01/11," but this may still be interesting. Or so i thought, before opening it to get a big gusher! Following some quick toweling. its a quite cloudy brown ale, so I guess I stirred up some yeast. Bubbly tan head. Smell still offers lots of hops in different varieties, so Ill give it that. Taste has some brownish crystal malt with an odd backing of carob. Not puckered up with hops, but still a good mix with some earth, pine and orange peel. Finished dry and a bit hoppy. Goes down fast, interesting layer of sludge on the bottom.
Bottle. Poured dark amber with little head that retained. Light body with hint of amber/crystal malts. Not a lot of hops present.

Bottle. Strong resiny piny earthy hop aroma. Hazy amber, golden cream. Metallic grassy, earthy, hop entry, a bit of vegetable, mango, citrus. Medium body, slightly sticky mouthfeel and leaves a metallic note on the tongue. Strikes me as too unbalanced.

Enthusiastic beer, quite a gusher when I open the bottle, even though it has been lying quietly in the fridge for about a month. Amber colour beer, off-white head. Aroma of hops, unmistakeably nelson sauvin comes through. Very floral, citrus, grapefruit, some passion fruit. Malty background. Flavour quite bitter, malty, citrus, some caramel. Body rather light, but not too thin. Finish sweetish, bitter and somewhat cloying. 
(From 33cL bottle)

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2011 330ml bottle. Rich, fruity, floral aroma, citrus flavours. Pours a dark amber with a medium head. Taste is fruity, sweet and caramel, followed by a lightly bitter citrus flavour, medium carbonation. Very pleasant beer which flavours linger after drinking

330 ml bottle. Clear reddish coppery colour, thin but persistent off-white head. Lovely citrus-fruity, floral-hoppy aroma. The flavour is toasted, caramel-malty, with an aromatic, grapefruity hoppy finish. Good stuff, especially considering the low alcohol content.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 On tap at Allt om Öl Festivalen in Eskilstuna. It poured an almost clear brown-golden liquid with a light brown head. Lots of hops in both smell. Nice beer with a complex hop aroma.

33 cl bottle @ Ämmälänkylä, BBE 14.07.2012. Rated on 27.08.2011
Aroma has nice, fresh hops and resin. Resin-like hops and sweetish malt are in balance in the flavour. Very good amber!
Pours amber with a high off-white head. Aroma is malts, fruits and hops. Flavor is malts, caramel, fruits and hops. Great.

Dark copperbrown beer with a almost medium and dark beige head. Aroma is stunning, peaches, tropical fruits, some pine needles and fructose. Taste is also tropical fruity, caramel, some roastiness, short and almost watery aftertaste. Medium bodied and quite harsh to drink. Stunning aroma, but taste is only average and slightly harsh, frustrating.
Really quite nice.  Bright floral and grapefruit hops, balanced by dry caramel malt.  Great balance.  Pretty aggressive bitterness on the finish.

En riktigt färsk flaska som doftar rejält så fort kapsylen kommer av. Bärnstensfärgad åt rött och en fantastiskt doft av persika, ananas, passionsfrukt och tallskott. Riktigt lätt kropp gör att humlen får spela huvudrollen. Visst känns det som att mer kropp hade behövs men nu blir den torr, frisk, lätt, drickvänlig och just humlefruktig istället. Det funkar väldigt bra det med. Medelstor lite sträv beska åt färsk tallkotte som får munnen att dra ihop sig lite. Lysande!

330ml bottle from Alko
BBE 14.07.2012 - Pours amber red with a small foamy head. Excellent fruity aroma with notes of citrusy hops and malts. Taste is also quite fruity with notes of fresh hops, malts and some bitterness. Smooth, slightly bitter finish. Medium bodied and carbonated. Great, easy to drink and tasty amber ale.

Bottle.Not one of their strong ones but packed with flavour.Floral and fruity with hops present  as well. A lot of body considering its fairly low strength. Another winner from this brewery that demonstrates that you can have lots of flavour without overpowering strength.

Bottle. Pours a red brown, with a finger thick head. A pleasant hoppy aroma, with notes of roasted malts, biscuits, caramel and syrup. Taste of lightly burned malts, with a good bitterness sticking through the finish.

Draught at White Horse on Parsons Green. Hazy ruby-amber with a smallish lasting creamy beige head. Aroma a bit like arrogant bastard - "red" malt, slightly sour, plenty of resin hops. Taste follows, even more sourness, moderate alcohol - thick body, longish dry tart malty finish. Solid - not a summer beer.
Al naso è un pò fruttata e un pò tostata. Al palato è piena, morbida discretamente amara come il lungo finale. Ottima.
Bright red - great colour for a beer. Extremely hoppy, fairly well carbonated with a hint of nut. Really great beer.

Bottle, batch 258, best before 17-09-11.  Sweet crystal malt nose with punchy orange citrus and a caramel backbone.  Very hop-heavy for an amber!  Even getting some light melon.  Pours an ugly cloudy brown with a pretty, rocky, pillowy tan head.  Dryish taste, a little scratchy with healthy bitterness.  Earth and light toffee, dark caramel that doesnt contribute much sweetness, and rasping paper and woody, earthy nettles from the hops.  Definitely has a very organic feel going on, which is groovy but a bit depressing without any bright zings to perk up the top end.  Medium body.  Goodish?  But really didnt do it for me, and dont think I want to buy or drink another.

Draught at BA V:a Hamngatan
Deep amber with a large, tan head.
Some vereal a a lot of butterscotch in the aroma.
Pretty sweet in flavour with perfume-ish notes.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2012 Bottle.
Clear deep redish amber with a big creme coloured rocky porous head that leaves lots of patterned lacing.

Huge hoppy resiny aroma. Except from that there is grapefruit and mango, but its a main hoppy aroma that is dry and resiny.

Taste is very resiny hoppy and dry with dry caramel in the back ground. 

Medium to a bit thin in body with mushy soft tickeling carbonation.

A quite one dimensional beer for the ones who like dry resiny hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
cerveza de color ambar ,con fuertes aromas a frutas y uva,interesante,pero no siempre esta en su punto!

This is kind of a rough review since I drank out of the bottle while camping. Nevertheless, certain traits of this brew were discernible. Nice citrusy hop aroma with a little roastyness. Taste matches that. Clean, medium bodied, nice mouthfeel. A little yeastiness. Cant wait to try more BrewDog!

[Bottle] Lightly hazed reddish amber hue, decent head formation. Caramel and mild toffee malt nose, plenty of citrussy grapefruit. Smooth sweet chocolate and caramel malts at first, before a strong grapefruit bitterness kicks in. Not overpowering rather well balanced between the malt and the hops. First brewdog Ive tried and distinctively American for a Scottish brew.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a slightly hazy amber with good-sized off-white head.  Lovely aroma of citric hops and fruity, toffee-ish malts.  Flavour has a nice grapefruity hop presence but with a strong malt backbone and good body.  Almost creamy mouthfeel.  A lovely amber ale.
Totally typical red ale from Scotland, being in a bottle its a bit fizzier than a cask ale.
Bottle: pours a cloudy, dark amber with a big frothy head, aroma is very hoppy, taste is hoppy, dry finish.
Very sweet, almost burnt caramel scent. Nothing like that in its bitter flavour. Bit odd.

I think they mislabeled this one. It tastes like an IPA. Pours brown from bottle with a thin white head. Theres some floralness on the nose but also a slight metallic thing as well. Taste is pure bitterness without much malt or hop flavor. Most of the reviews Ive read seem to be describing a different beer.
Great beer, great color, great foam, great brewers, with a very good image.

Bottled. Amber color with a beautiful tan creamy head. Aroma is grassy and hoppy a bit like trashy blonde, but with a malt backbone.  Flavor is hoppy with a nice bitterness, quite watery but with some sweetness on it. Mouthfeel is quite bitter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Lovely hoppy aroma, red grapefruit and maybe peach. Getting citrus and bitterness.

Glory amber beer. Smallish off-white head. Sweet malty aroma. Rhubarb. Incredible head. Full malty flavor with a little bit of malt and sweetness. Fully satisfying for an amber ale. A style thats difficult to satisfy for a hop head. You can easily enjoy this brew. So do it.

Aroma: citric, lemony, grass, straw, a bit like trashy blonde, but with a thicker malt backbone. 
Appearance: Amber colour, medium creamy off-white head. 
Flavour: I do not like Nelson sauvin, to me it has a quality thats like burnt rubber in the retro nasal action. Otherwise this beer is fruity with blackcurrants and a good bite. 
Mouthfeel: Average.
Total: This is a true quality brew, but nelson sauvin spoils the experience for me..

{thoughts} Cloying hops rain on an otherwise fine parade of juicy malts.

{elements} Clear, amber hue; short, white froth. Caramel and oranges / grapefruit plus mint / rosemary. Moderately sweet, low to moderate acidity, moderate bitterness; caramel and toasty malts with a clingy bitterness and resinous aftertaste. Moderate carbonation, medium body, watery texture. 25 cl draft @ OHaras.

Where to begin... Hazy, muddy, ruby color with a cream colored, full, creamy, dense head which settles to a thin lasting layer and leaves thick, drippy lace.  The nose is simcoe mostly with passionfruit and rustic, but also smaller notes of pine, pink grapefruit, kiwi, and faint spice and floral.  The flavor is a bit of a let down with not enough malt presence or bitterness to match the intense hop flavors; less than moderate bitterness, light toasted caramel, still some rustic, light floral, and pink grapefruit.  The palate is medium, soft to lively, slightly dry, and a bit watery.  The beer finishes slightly dry, toasty, piney, rustic, and some grapefruit lingering.  Certainly the hoppiest table strength beer I have had to date, as much hop flavor as many imperial IPA.  I would like to have a bit more bitterness and strength (ie an IPA or imperial pale) because the hop flavors worked very well in this one.  Nice one.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Dark red, massive tanned head. Aroma of citrus, zests, grapefruit and grass. Also some earthy notes. Taste has some sweetness and a malt body that feels to thin and weak to match the aroma and finish. Feel is quite oily. Finish is very hoppy and bitter. Nice hop tones of grass and citrus

Bottle 33cl, a clear amber beer with huge head. Nose is very hopy, IPA like. Aroma is on lemon and hops resin, body is watery, malt can only be tasted at the finish. Very less complex, just hopy, a bit boring, finish is on peppery notes, less honey notes, even the Spitfire is better.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with large creamy light brown mostly lasting head, Hoppy aroma with flowery notes. Bitter flavor.

12oz. bottle from distributor rep, poured into tulip glass. Pours yellow straw in color with a white somewhat bubbly head. Sits in glass a hazy light brown/tan color. Aroma: Big floral hops, citrus, lightly toasted. Taste: Lightly sweet at first for a short time, soon to be balanced by the hops, then finishes quite bitter. Cereal, oats, lemon, and grapefruit. Palate: Big carbonation mouth feel but smooth, heavy bitter aftertaste on finish. A pretty good amber...I would suggest it for those looking for one, but not really for me...a bit too hoppy for my taste.

Gyönyörű bronzvörös szín, szép kapucsinóbarna hab.
Zeller + bodza egy kis citrussal.
Íze szénsavas, kissé édeskés de erősen citrusos amerikai komlós, laza. Van itt még egy kis hamus/fémes felhang is.
Fasza sör.
Bármikor.

Bottle from Sainsburys.  Dark orange colour with an off-white head that leaves good lacing.  Aroma is floral, herbal and summer fruits with a touch of caramel.  The tast follows the aroma - lots of sweet, caramel malt nicely balanced by the hoppiness.  Light palate and a long, fruity, bitter finish.  A winner.

Another great amber ale. Had the pleasure of tasting an incredibly fresh bottle from mogwais fridge. A clear amber coloured beer with a nice white foam. Aromas of mango, blackcurrant, bramble and flowers. Simcoe and Nelson Sauvin is really noticeable in the nose. The taste is dry and quite floral. Hops and grass is noticeable with a nice hoppy background. A really crisp and delicious beer.
Delicious refreshing beer. Strong malt backbone, fruity tropical hops. Well carbonated. Citrusy like a beery 5alive

Hazy russet colour, mocha caramel head and a slap in the face of full, grassy aromas, caramel, in your face hops and ginger tart. This is sensational in that its a sensation, fantastic in that it is in the realm of fantasy, awesome in that its smell leaves me in awe. This is one of the best smelling beers I have ever had.
I was expecting it to be creamy and sweet and then a riot of hops. Instead it was fresh, light and then a cool flow of hoppy grassy bitterness that swills around the mouth and lingers on the palate. While it does the malt character makes itself known with a polite cough. What I like about this beer is that it promises one thing, delivers another, but it delivers. Its a beer that makes you thin about what youre drinking. A beer that Ill be recommending in spadefuls.

Bottled. Amber coloured. Unlcear. Dense beige head. Aroma of caramel, sweetness, grass, flowers. Flavour is grassy and piney. Has caramel, grape and herbs. Medium to full bodied. Sweetish caramelly bitter in the end. Very nice and for 13 kr. quite a bargain.
From a bottle I brought back from pre-ZBF in 2010.  Pours amber with an off-white head with lots of lacing.  Smells of caramel and some fruity hops.  Slightly bitter taste with a crisp finish.
Quite ok dark amber color. Smells a little like an IPA, fruity and a little bitter. Firm body for a beer only 5 ABV. Taste pretty good as well. Nice one!
My all time favourite beer, I love it.  The aroma is stunning, just a gorgeous hoppy Amber ale, packed with flavour.  Cant fault it!

12oz bottle from the Bayou 
Appearance: Clear amber with a medium sized off-white head and good lacing 
Aroma:  Caramel and floral 
Taste:  Caramel, dusty, floral and grapefruit 
Good, clean and crisp

Poured out a thick white cap with weak lacing, the beer is a clear reddish amber. Sweet peachy aroma, heavily hopped, caramel, light floral which is very good and somewhat mysterious. The taste does not hold up to the same level as the aroma and I find that this beer lacks a well defined balance. Light spice, mellow malts, dulled out citrus. This is ok. Medium bodied. Finishes decent but I do not need other.
Pours a deep murky amber with foamy off-white head. Aroma is very outdoorsy with pine, grass and floral hops. Pine and strong hop flavor but little bitter aftertaste.

Poured almost red, with an off-white lacing head. Delicious aroma of pine, citrus, caramel, candy, melon, nicotine and hops. Medium bodied and carbonated, oily as it should be. Bitter taste with a dry bitter aftertaste. Really well done, an excellent ale!

Bottle from Tesco. Amber - light brown with white head that dissipates.  Aroma - Strong grass, pine, resin hops. Taste - Again, very grassy, piney hops, bit of a slight sweetness initially then crescendo of hops resulting in an aggressive, very bitter, rather astringent, grassy resin hop finish. I dont find this beer all that interesting. Body is thin, good carbonation. Definitely one for the hopheads. Not one my favourites from BrewDog.

Aroma: Grassy-ish pine, grapefruit, tropical fruit. 

Taste: Grassy pine, grapefruit.

Mouth feel: Sessionable, crisp, high quaffable. 

Overall: Plethora of hop aroma and taste without the bitterness. Amazing. 

This and Ruth by Hair of the Dog are some of the finer session ales Ive tasted to date. 

Interesting that nelson sauvin hops are used - with after-the-fact knowledge of this, can discern faint goose berry aroma.

Red-amber colour with medium tan head. Aroma of fresh hops, flowers, herbs, citruses and some blackurrant. Very mature but still refreshing. Rusty bitterness and smoothe fruit notes in the taste. A great beer experience!

Hazy, medium amber body with a good-sized, off-white, fully lasting head that covers the glass in lacing. Good start! Super fruity aroma that is all hops, for the most part grapefruit, but there might be some pine and resin there as well. Despite the hoppy aroma the taste is initially light sweet, thats a nice touch! Then the finish comes, and it is of course aggressively BrewDog bitter. A subtle sweet malty caramel flavour is followed and partially mixed with a firm grapefruit flavour. Medium body, soft carbonation, quite dry feel. Its a bit like a more complex, more interesting, beefed-up version of the BrewDog Trashy Blonde. Another good one from the f-ing doctors! 
[33 cl bottle, batch 378, from SuperBrugsen, Brønshøj Torv, Copenhagen]
Interesting beer, comes across like an IPA up front but without the bitter finish.  Has almost no aftertaste.   Interesting, but not amazing.  Looks great, nice body and decent woodsy pine aroma.
I love their style, i love their beers and this is another great one. Very nice colour, hop in the smell and in the taste. Nice mouthfeel and good body.

Sampled at Texas Beerfest.  Pours a cloudy amber with a thick creamy beige head that lasts awhile leaving sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is strong floral and grapefruit. Medium mouthfeel with a bitter hop and light malt with a nice lingering dry finish. A very good amber from Brewdog.
Tastes lightly malty and sweet with a good bit of red fruit hops, bitter and slightly spicy. Thin body and good carbonation.
Amber colour with thin lasting head. Aroma of mayoranus and some fruity scent. Sweet fruity start with bitter finish. Medium carbonation.

Bottle; pour is naturally, golden amber, with a nice fluffy beige head that does retain well. This one does indeed have bucketloads of dry hops present on the nose, as well as the tongue ; the hops are piney and slightly astringent - the malts are slightly sweet, but give way to the bitterness of the hop profile. The body is on the light side, and that is quite alright. This is a decent drinker for me, at least.
Bottle. Sweet plum aroma. Malty caramel with a strong bitter hop finish. Palate is long and lingering bitter. Lively carbonation
Bottle at home. Healthy lingering head over amber ale. Sweet malts fall back on a solid hop presence. Great mouthfeel & amazing palate.
@CBF. Pours Deep mahogany wit a nice tense tanned head leaving lace. Aroma is caramel, pine, citric and malty. Drinkable, good session. Flavor is same as aroma. Finishes bitter sweet.

Tasted on 5/29/11 from a 330mL bottle at Lush West Town, batch #052.  Pours clear light amber with a thick beige head that slowly recedes to an even, thin blanket of lace.  The nose is full of rye-bread malt, some caramel and brown sugar, along with a bit of citrus and resin hops.  The flavor is, once again, more malty than anything with rye-bread, caramel, brown sugar, and the hops coming in on the back of the palate with some resin and citrus hops.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a long resin bitter hops finish.
Draught at The Local Taphouse (Sydney, Australia). A treat this - a real mix of aromas and flavours. Kind of lolly-like, but in a good way.
330 ml bottle. Copper color, off-white head. Strawberry aroma (huh?). Dry, bitter flavor with fruity notes. Medium-full body, very low carbonation. Nice flavor, interesting beer.

Brilliant name. Lovely reddish amber colour, thick head that lasts quite long. Quite carbonated, but not overly so. Hoppy! Very hoppy. Nice and hoppy. With quite citrus-y textures and a hint of caramel. Very complex taste for £1.65 a bottle. A favourite everyday beer, happily available in Leeds Morrisons, of all places!

Fine 
head, lasting, light brown
Fine hoppy nose with citrus caramel and spruce
Fullbodied with some length
Caramel, sweetness, and a fine dry finish
Welcomposed

Bottle rating. The beer is quite red with a generous head that lasts. The nose is dominated by hops with the palate also being very hoppy with a curry-like quality which Im guessing is from the yeast?

12 oz. Big caramel, resin and citrus nose. Flavor is similar with some nice toasted nut and oak notes on the finish as well. Nice looking amber with a lasting sticky head. Medium body is smoothly carbonated, dry and astringent. Very nice; really more of a red IPA.

Bottle.Pours nearly clear amber with a small off-white head.Fresh hoppy aroma, piney and peach. Taste is first and foremost fruity and flowery fresh & crisp hops, good balanced against the moderate sweet malty body. Watery and clean mouthfeel. Aftertaste got some light mint as well.

330ml bottle from Superbrugsen: Aroma of hops, pine, malt, and a slight hint of fruit. Amber colour with a big, beige slowly diminishing head that lasted throughout. Clear and sparkling liquid. Flavor is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Tastes of malt, caramel, pine, slight citrus, light resin and weak hops. Medium body.  Average carbonation. Medium sweet, light to medium bitter. A nice beer

0.33l bottle. Pours a clear reddish amber body with a big lacing beige head. Aroma is sweet malts and there is no doubt that there are a lot of fruity and grassy hops in here. Also notes of peach, strawberries and pineapple. Body is medium, watery texture and lively carbonated. Theres a almost burning bitterness from the hops, but its nicely balanced by the sweet malts. Ends slightly watery with a mild burning bitter aftertaste. I would imagine that this could be a really great beer to have available in 6packs in the supermarket. Unfortunately I live in Norway - the country where the taxes easily passes the costs of the beer itself AND since this is over 4.7% abv it wouldnt be allowed anyhow.. Nice thought though, and a really nice, refreshing amber.

17 May 2011, bottle. brown reddish, clear, no bubbles. citrus rind and astringent hop bitterness. med body and fizzy. for a seriously hopped amber ale it has enough nutty malt to balance the beer. pretty good.

Fra flaske, dufter super dejlig af simcoe humle! flot amber med lyse brunt højt skum, smager super skøn af simcoe tør humle. frisk.... humle eftersmag
En rigtig dejlig øl!

Sampled at WCBF with brother bob.

Nice clean amber pour with a nose of various fruits and hop.

A nice caramel malt taste blended with fruit, peach, orange peel and pine. Decent dry finish. Well done.

Tükrös rézszínben mutatja magát ez a főzet, melynek közepes méretű, sárgásfehér habja szép csipkét hagy maga után.
Illata édeskés, virágos, gyantás.
Csípősen, édes, karamellás ízzel és szirupos testességgel indul a kóstolása, melyet aztán nagy adag gyantás, citrusos komló követ, narancshéjat ill. mézes cukorkát idéző ízekkel.
Lecsengése hosszan tartó és száraz, melyet fűszerek és citrusok kísérnek.
Remekül kiegyensúlyozott, finom és emiatt igen könnyen csúszó egy ser

Csak a jó sör, Budapest
Érdekes, halvány vöröses, vérnarancshoz hasonló színe van, habja vékony, tört fehér és igen gyorsan elillan. Illata igen átható, rendkívül gyümölcsös, piros grapefruitos, fenyő gyantás és kissé még éretlen szőlőhöz hasonlatos. Ez a kissé éretlen szőlő és vörös grapefruitos íz nyílik ki először, aztán jön egy óriási adag gyantás komló és lehengerel bennünket a maga gyümölcsös kesernyésségével, amit reménytelenül próbál ellensúlyozni egy kevés maláta és kissé csípős és fanyar élesztő. Könnyű teste van és a csípősségben rendesen szerepet kapnak a benne lévő, apró kis buborékok is. Utóíze gyümölcsösen édeskés és mellette igen száraz, hosszan tart. Különleges és érdekes főzet, számomra olyan volt, mintha egy gyümölcsös komló lekvárba kóstoltam volna. Ha lenne ilyen, szerintem ilyen íze lenne.
Bottle. Amber with medium off white head. Nice clean aroma of grapefruit, pine needles, mens shower gel. Flavour is lovely and hoppy, nice hop bitterness.

small frothy offwhite head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark amber body. aroma: caramel, harsh hoppy, grass, orange, cha mate com pessego, rosas (when twirling the glass). if and ff: light sweet heavy bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation chalky finish. Lembra mate, delicioso amargor lupulo com casca de laranja. Bem mais forte que outras amber ale, lembrando IPA. 120s
Bottle from Super Brugsen. Clear amber colour with a medium off-white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, malt and caramel.

Poured a dark amber hue with a tan head that had good retention and nice lacing.  Aroma was a mix of caramel malts and grassy hops.  Flavor had a nice bitterness to it similar to an English ale. Malts were mostly sweet but did have a nice toasted bread note.  Finish was slightly dry.

Bottle: &nbsp Fiery amber, large finely bubbled head, tannish, very nice lacing. &nbsp Super citrusy powdery nose, smells just like Tang. &nbsp No joke! &nbsp Unfortunately, well maybe fortunately its not like Tang. &nbsp Its also not like any other Amber I have had. &nbsp Does appear to have some earthy/soily notes as well, on the nose and on the tongue. &nbsp Really, tastes like dirt was added. &nbsp Tiz malty, but has this powdery sweetness that I associate with kool-aid, pixie stix, and in this case... Tang! &nbsp Way too early/soily for my tastes. &nbsp Yeah, this just isnt working for me.
Servida en La Cerveteca (Barcelona). Entra suave, ligeramente amarga y un ligero toque floral. Muy buena ale.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 33cl bottle. Pours a murky brown ale, not amber as expected, its hard to see if there are bubbles but there is a nice head. The nose has pine and pineapple pith. The taste is soapy with pine and more grapefruit pith, then some earthiness and then clean again. The palate has decent texture and structure, then there is a low earthy note in the middle though there is a fresh ending. Overall, a great beer apart from that low note three-quarters of the way through.
11.2oz bottle. Poured a dark copper color, medium sized off-white head. Aroma was caramel malts, hops. Flavor was sweet malts, eh,. an alright beverage, very session-able, though pedestrian.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 Red amber colour. Red berry aroma. Flavour is sweet, juicy at first with some peach syrup in there. Becomes dryer and more bitter in the mouth. Good balance of hop and malt.

Bottle, 355ml. Pours a clear amber/copper colour with a reddish hue and a great offwhite head. Aroma is all about the hoppiness. Taste has dry fruits, roasted malts and heavy hop flavour. Great finish.

bouteille 33cl. batch # 185
ambre avec belle mousse ocre.
Pour moi, un arôme qui approche une IPA avec un bon profile citronné et fruité, pin et herbeux qui mettent bien en avant les houblons, laissant juste de quoi au malt pour se faire présent.
En bouche, un profile qui donne plus de place au malt dans des tons grillé et torréfié avec un peu de noisette ainsi que du houblon citronné/pin qui tend tjrs à dominer le tout. Jaurai souhaité un peu plus de vivacité du côté du malt.

Tap. Fluffy light tan head, coppery brown color.  Great lacing. Lots of hops in the aroma; touch of pine, citrus, and a light sweetness. Chocolate, toffee, caramel, and a good deal of hops all feature in the flavor.  Touch sweet and bitter at the same time.  Little sticky in the body, but lightish.  Sessioner.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2011 Made the mistake of drinking this after Hardcore IP and couldnt taste anything at first! Anyway, pours red, with nice clarity. Smell is citrous and fresh zesty lemons. Flavour is grapefruit and pine with some fruity ale-ness in their somewhere. Palate is quite soft and mellow. Retried at Wholefoods Market Tasting. Rating up from 3.7.

Bottle. Pours a hazy copper to orange-ish colour with a light tan head. In the aroma, gingerbread like malt and a hint of caramel. In the taste, gingerbread and caramel like maltiness and a nice small hop. A small hop bite and medium bodied mouthfeel, with a small dry caramel aftertaste. Nice small presence of caramel in a red ale.

A very nice looking red amber colour with a finger & a half sized brownish white head. The beer is still and clear, looking excellent with good head retention that eventually settles to a thinnish lacing/head & leaves some lacing on the glass too.

A pleasant, fruity combination of grapefruit & pine with maybe a little mango in the middle. Definitely a good smelling, summery beer.

Starts off very fruity to begin with a grapefruit dominating along with a citrus flavour before easing out in the middle then finishing with the pine mentioned in the smell. Well balanced overall & finishing with a warm, mildly bitter aftertaste.

Medium bodied, smooth and easy to drink making this a nice session brew. The carbonation is good too.

This is a very pleasant, fruity beer that goes down well & would be perfect on a warm summers day. Not the best Brewdog offering but still a nice brew. - - - - 

More reviews & 1001 Beer Challenge at:

Single bottle purchased from Kensington Wine Market sometime in March, 2011. Colour: Clouded orange with generous heaps of orange-tinged pillowy head. Nose: A dominant blend of hops and Lindt milk chocolate. After some time and swirling, raw mushrooms and fresh lawn clippings appear. The rich milk chocolate stays constant even as it opens up. Taste: Medium light sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Not nearly as sweet as the nose would have you believe because the chocolote is now bittersweet. Emerging fruits come on, dark cherries and kiwi. Hops act as a blanket around everything though, as they pulsate in all areas of the palate. This is the most extensively hopped amber I have ever tasted, and it works like a young married couple. Brilliant.
From bottle @ Beerexpo, Lkpg, Sweden. Pours dark amber. Quite robust. Offers nuts in bouth aroma and flavor. Quite herbal like hoped.

Wow what a beer!  This has taken over the top spot on my list for lower ABV beers, surpassing the old number one: San Diego County Session Ale by Stone/Kelsey Mcnair/BP

The aroma of hop perfume and caramel starts this beer off right.  Not the strongest aroma, but a pleasant one.

Look is a orangey-golden hue, with red tones.  Dense, tan head.

The taste is out of this world.  At only 25 IBU, this beer still imparts a strong hop taste.  The essential oils of the hops were heavily extracted, but the bittering alpha acids have a much smaller influence.  This yeilds a strong hop sensation, without being a resinous palate-buster.

The strong hop character balances a caramel sweetness of the malt bill, which is, simply put, out of this world.  The Maris Otter variety of pale malt gives this beer a distinctive English ale taste, with a rich mouthfeel and wonderful flavor.  There must have been considerable amounts of unfermentable sugars in the mash, because the beer has a noticeable sweetness. This also comes through better because of the low bitterness and low alcohol.  I love this beer because the balance between the malty sweetness and bitterness is perfect, but it isnt a strictly noble hop taste.  Its almost like a cross between an English pale ale and and an American pale ale.  It has the American style hop presence, but the English malty sweetness.  

The mouthfeel was a medium to full feel with a soft carbonation that is certainly enough to give the beer life, but not prickly by any means.  

Overall its pretty much the perfect session ale in my book.  This is a winner, and an excellent value.  If you find it on the shelf at your local beer store, you absolutely must pick it up.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2011 Bottle. Amber to copper with a porous tan head. Aroma: peaches, pineapple, resin, caramel. Taste: fresh hoppiness, pine, citrus, resin, berries, caramel, some grass, medium bitter. Medium-bodied. Very refreshing and drinkable, would be a great summer beer.

330 ml bottle. Batch #40. BB 29/03/2011. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark hazy brown colour with small light tan head.
Dark bitter woody and piney hops, bready malt and dark fruitiness in aroma.
Flavour is fruity bitter hops, wood, bready malt and bitterness.
Surprisingly short and mild bitter aftertaste. Soft carbonation.

cask. Dark amber body, khaki head.Aroma has lots of fruist and sweet malt with apricot and some strawberry combined with grapefruity background. Very dry, lots of grassy, earthy hopiness with smooth bitterness. Some piney flavour. Beer has really nice depth and complexicity with harsh bitterness and balanced fruity and malty notes. Proves a good point - all beers doesnt have to bo 10 ABV to excel.
Amber with a lightly tanned head. Green hops and caramelly aroma. Caramelly but still dry, with a hoppy bitterness.

04/04/2011 330ml bottle. Ambrata scura con riflessi rossicci, schiuma bianca sporca, non molto persistente. Al naso è una esplosione di luppolo. Laroma è intensissimo, fruttato, con note agrumate e floreali. In bocca è un trionfo damaro, con note agrumate ed erbacee. Non molto bilanciata, a mio modo di vedere, e un po troppo estrema per una amber ale. Corpo medio, carbonazione corretta. Un po grezza nel complesso, ma di carattere.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 Time for a re-assessment of this beer, which I rated the first time almost five years ago only two months after joining RateBeer. Availability has strangely diminished since then as the beer was pulled from Danish supermarket shelves in 2014/15. This one comes courtesy of a keg at Taphouse Copenhagen. It was poured at fridge temperature into a big shaker glass and allowed to stand for twenty minutes while I consumed a dark saison and a cheese and ham panini. Looking at the beer it is strangely more hazy than I remember it. It used to be possible to see the underside of the foam cap when looking through the glass and all I see now is a cloudy, dark amber body. The head is largely subsided after twenty mintues but there is still solid, off-white film and some decent lace. The beer shows decent regeneration when swirling the glass but alas the head fades after 10 seconds. The aroma has some fruity soda pop impressions but its a bit hard to detect the Nelson Sauvin hop in this pour. I get a bit of fruit juice but its more of a subtle undercurrent than an overpowering in your face expression. The flavour has the familiar caramel and fruit character but it seems less harmonic than I remember it. On the palate there is a medium body with soft carbonation, oily texture and a caramelly sweet finish. Its an okay beer but not as great and supremely sessionable as I remember it. Also now its 8 euro for 40 cl...
App: 3/5 Aroma: 7/10 Pal: 3/5 Taste: 7/10 Overall: 13/20

Re-rated on November 26th 2011: Girlfriend says: "Its the perfect beer."
App: 5/5  Aroma: 9/10   Pal: 5/5  Taste: 9/10   Overall: 19/20

April 2nd 2011: (on bottle, 33 cl from SuperBrugsen) Pours a slightly hazy deep amber with long-lasting, tall and frothy off-white head that laces the glass. Intense, complex aroma of floral hops. Taste is rich with what for me is the perfect balance of intense bitterness and a certain malty sweetness. Full-bodied, oily with average carbonation and a long, dry and bitter sweetness. Something close to the perfect beer for me - and at less than two euro its a steal. 
Aroma: 9  App: 5   Taste: 10   Palate: 5   Overall: 20

SCHIUMA:
non abbondante, bianca, scompare in fretta
COLORE:
ambrato con riflessi rosso-arancio
INTENSITA / FINEZZA / AROMA
molto intensa, si avverte già al versare la birra nel bicchiere. È una esplosione di note fruttate, dominate da una componente di frutta esotica (direi frutto della passione) che si mescola per bene con note citriche/agrumate e un tocco di vegetale. Ce sicuramente spazio per  un piccolo contributo dei malti - caramello, tostato - però rimane schiacciato dal profumo fruttato. 
GUSTO / RETROGUSTO / PERSISTENZA
i profumi si convertono in sapori proseguendo per la stessa strada. In tal caso, peró, il frutto esotico tende a convertirsi più che altro in pompelmo rosa, sulla spinta di un amaro consistente dal carattere erbaceo/citrico. I malti fanno fatica a farsi notare, dando qualche nota caramellata e di frutto secco che si mischia con il fruttato iniziale, ma il finale è tutto per i luppoli con un retrogusto erbaceo persistente.
CORPO / CARBONATAZIONE / CONSISTENZA
corpo medio-basso, carbonatazione media; in bocca da una sensazione di fluidità e freschezza.buona, piacevole e sorprendente - allnizio - poi, a dire la verità, le note fruttate tropicali stancano un po e comunque rendono la birra di difficile abbinamento a tavola (una birra da aperitivo estivo?). Per fortuna gli amaricanti dei luppoli evolvono attenuando i toni piu dolciastri del fruttato iniziale. Concludendo, una birra originale, ben fatta e ben costruita su luppoli di prima qualita; il resto è questione di gusti.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Unclear orange-red beer with a white foamy head. Extremely hoppy scent of grass and pine. Very bitter taste with sweet malt notes, citrus, grass, pine. Relatively long finish.
Huge off-white lasting head and a clear dark amber body. Hops in the nose, aroma of grass, citrus, pine and some caramel as well. Thin texture. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Bitter and dry finish.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2012 Clear amber colour with a light brown head. Intense bitter hoppy citric aroma with notes of honey. Bittersweet flavour with caramel and a great bitter finish. Awesome. (9/5/8/5/18)
Dark amber body with a huge off white head. Incredible aroma of pine, grapefruit, lemon, orange, tea, caramel, mint, honey. Bittersweet, slightly unbalanced flavour with caramel, mint and grapefruit. Really great.

Világosbarnás-vöröses szín, egy nagyon kitartó kissé piszkosfehér habbal, amiből végig marad egy pár milliméternyi a tetején. Illata nagyon kifinomult, rengeteg gyümölcs, kevés bodzavirág, mandula és vajkaramell. A karamell és a rengeteg gyümölcs az ízében is megjelenik, továbbá erősen komlózott, méghozzá a gyümölcsös érzetet adó fajtából, össze is lehetne keverni egy IPA-val, nagyon hasonló. Lecsengése gyümölcsösen keserű, közepesen testes és kellően száraz ale. Ezek a skótok baromira tudnak.

(sample)  Red amber color with no to little head.  Has a very assertive hoppy quality in the nose.  Taste has a light hoppiness, much lighter than the nose.  Nutty caramel malt taste.  Light body, thin texture, soft to average carbonation and short bitter finish.

Bottle 33 cl. Poured ruby in colour with white head. Aroma bit fruity and 
something that I couldnt point out, something sharp. Very dry taste 
with ashes and burnt wood. Harsh finish.

Pours dark amber/copper with a large slightly tan head. chinook and simcoe are very evident on the nose with a pine floral and fresh grass aroma. slight taste of caramel with an real kick in the face(good kick in the face) from the hops, a lovely bitter after kick. On the palette bitter and hoppy a must for any hop-head. Overall a fantastic amber ale with a real hoppy kick.

330ml Bomber  Gravity Beer Market  Olympia, WA 
Amber in color with a thin head.  Nicely balanced aroma between the hops and malts.  Malt bready flavor with a hops flavor that gives off a fruity flavor.   Very tasty beer.

Tasted 3/22/11. 12oz bottle. Pours a deep filtered hue of bronze and amber. Brainy ring of tan head. Aromas of brown sugar and lemony citrus. Cut grass and green apples. Mild brownie malts and fruity esters. Very nice aromatics! Medium bodied with a bright effervescence and a very bitter grapefruit finish. In the middle is an odd, thick malty flavor of flat cola and soggy sugars. It has a long and complex palate, but its not all in a positive light. It hops from bitter to sweet to sour and lingers on the tongue. The lemony bitter, acrid, sour component is, unfortunately, also the longest lasting. Its got a lot of hop character, but the delivery is tainted.

Color daurat rogenc. Lescuma (i no dic crema) és de color mantega, no gaire densa. Al principi pareix molt estable, però com passa amb les cerveses amb bona retenció i poca densitat, aviat es produeix un "iceberg" o "cràter" i les vores baixen a un ritme molt major que el centre, creant una illa descuma daspecte no gaire atractiu. Malmet una mica laspecte general de la cervesa. Tot i que visualment poc agraciada, perdura fins el final.
En nas, els llúpols arriben de seguida, molt intensament. Resina de pi i cítrics en clau daranja... aquesta ale mira cap a més enllà de lAtlàntic! Són aromes potents i agradables i perduren fins el final molt estables. Quan la cervesa guanya uns graus de temperatura, van destapant-se  (o evolucionant) altres aromes fruitals més madurs, però queden aclaparats pel caràcter resinós que domina.
La 5AM, al meu parer, on fa aigües (literalment) és en boca. És aiguada i, això, no lliga ni amb laspecte ni amb laroma ni amb lestil no estil. A més, és una sensació de decepció que marriba tan bon punt faig el primer glop, ja que en els aromes es defenia molt bé i feia goig. És també vivament carbonatada i això no dóna joc tampoc. Junt a laigualiment, amb el glop, marriba un regust àcid lleugerament proper a la llimona que no sé ben bé on situar. És amarga, però no tant per la intensitat com perquè lamargor perdura molt, però és seca i bastant plana. Poc a poc va destapant-se i es torna més afruitada, però el llúpol tan marcadament americà no acaba de combinar amb la resta.
Jo, no li trobo la gràcia a aquesta cervesa. Em sembla que no està ben arrodonida i té alguns defectes marcats com la sensació daigualit.
Una pena.

18-03-11 bouteille: Ambrée trouble avec une très légère effervescence et une légère mousse couleur crème foncée. Les premiers aromes sont puissant aux notes dhoublons. Suit différentes notes de fruit, comme la pèche, la poire et les raisins verts. Également des aromes de malt biscuité. Légèrement sucrée avec une bonne amertume qui sestompe en finale. Saveurs de hoblons fruités. Corps moyen avec une texture légère et raffraichissante. Légère carbonisation. Finale moyennement houblonnée et maltée avec de peties notes de caramel et de biscuit.

Deep amber with a beige head, nice looking. Hoppy aroma with a of of pine and floral notes on top and some caramel and butterscotch underneath. More of the same in the flavor but with some additions if pineapple. I love the fact that its medium sweet and rich in the middle but have a dry long lasting end to it. A ending that is only low to medium bitter but still lingers for quite a while. Very interesting beer for being so drinkable.
Tasted 2011-03-18. Pours amber with off-white head. Aroma: Pineapple, grass. Taste: slightly sweet, malty. Good.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 33 cL bottle from Morrissons in Bracknell poured into a Karmeliet glass.  Very dark amber/brown with very little head and strong hop/fruity aroma.  It smells fantastic, vibrant.  Pleasant first taste, not as dry as expected, hoppy but a bit more.  Its complex and certainly worth a taste, well done Brewdog (and for the strange beat you up and then lift you up message on the bottle, made think of Trainspotting, but thats probably the ignorant Englishman in me).  This is good, have a go.  The range of hops used makes sure its not overpowering.  Gets a bit dry towards the end of the bottle but thats hoppy beers for you.
Amber/red color, beige head. aroma is a lot of fruits; pineapple, grape fruit and crisp hops. The flavor is lot of grape fruit and medium bitter/woody end.

Pours clear cherry-brown, with a big puffy beige head, fine clinging lacing. Big hop aromas, pine, grapefruit, grass, as well as sugar cane, toast, and some fruity esters. Medium thin body, velvety, lightly dry, and crisp. Mildly sweet, a hint of tartness, then finishes medium-bitter, with a bitter dry aftertaste. I really enjoy hoppy ambers.

330ml brown bottle. Pours dark amber, hazy, holds a small cramy white head. Aroma is sweet with a bit of floral hops and caramel. Flavour has caramel malt below citrusy lemony hops. Light bitterness. Leafy, grassy hop aftertaste. Light body, fine tingly carbonation. Decent session amber.
Freakin good for an amber ale. Super drinkable with a good hop profile, nice smooth body and ultra clean finish.  Id session the crap outta this if it wasnt $4 a bottle.  grab one, its tasty.

Bottle from Brewdog bar Aberdeen. It pours hazy light brown with a foamy off white head and high carbonation. The nose is wood, orange, pineapple, mango, apricot and some grape. Its medium bodied and the taste is wood, smokey, nut, orange and lemon rind, caramel, astringent and some sourness with a bitter-woody finish. I will have to re-rate this at some point because it has tasted a lot better on keg and cask previously.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber body, with a huge off-white to light tan head. Aroma-taste: pine, citrus, resinous, balanced with a slightly metalic-tea, caramel finish. Not as bitter or flavourful as what the aroma might suggest. Medium bodied.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2011 Red-Brown slight haze. Medium fruit hop aroma and taste. Very balanced. Fine bitter-sweet finish. Good brew.
Hazy copper ale with a fine, tanned head. Intense hoppy aroma with bitter notes and some pine, hay, juniper and spices. Heavy flavor with quite a lot of hops, hay, spices and acid.

Dark brownish red color with a large head.  Strong hoppy aroma, predominantly pine and dank.  Plenty of biscuit and caramel malt notes.  A metallic and grainy flavor up front.  Very bitter, but quite an abrasive bite without a lot of flavor.  Dry finish

Bottle at home. This beer has become my standard PA since my local supermarket started selling them.
Pours amber red with little head.The aromas of american dryhop reaches the nose almost instantaneously. 
Very grassy, citrusy nose. The carbonation is medium-high and the mouthfeel is delisiously dry. The malt-flavour is at a minimum.  A faint caramel flavour balances the aromahop dominated taste. 
A bit watery in the aftertate with a medium-low pleasent bitterness.

Very good in with a danish lunch (rugbrød med leverpostej, æg, pølse (godt med løg til det hele)) . 

Cheers!

Bottle from Utobeer, London. Aroma has some hints of roasted malt, some tropical fruits and citrus. Pours a dark amber with a thick foam that leaves a lot of lacing. Taste is quite bitter on the onset and some roasted notes from the malt as it rolls over the tongue. Great mouthfeel, just right carbonation.

(bottled)  I liked the propaganada on the bottle blurb;  Vibrant hops (no shit, it is brewdog) but the types of malt used have an assertive personality, kinda cloying , which mixes cool with the hops.  Very plesant.
Poured nice deep amber color with thin offwhite head. Aroma was Pine and citrus with some earth thrown in. The taste was sharp with carbonation followed by tart pine and caramel. Finished smooth..

The beer in the glass is beautiful amber-colored with a lot of medium, brown foam. Very hoppy, aromatic smell of american hops. Cascade and Amarillo ruled! The beer starts very hoppy-bitter, with the pleasant aroma of the amarillo and cascade! The aftertaste, is more aroma hoppy than bitter, drawn very short. The further course is hoppy aromatic with a slight bitterness and a good spice. Dry Finish!

Bottled. Pours clear amber with a medium sized off-white head. Good lacings. Nose of pine, citrus and with peachy notes. Medium sweet flavour with caramel, fruits and dry hops. Medium bodied. Watery texture. Lively carbonation. Nice bitter and dry finish. A crisp and smooth brew.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2011 Bottle into glass at Holyrood 9A. Pours a dark copper with a bubbly white head, some retention. Aroma is pine, sweet berries and caramel. Medium carbonation. Bitter with a nice sweet malty note. Tasty and rich with a nice sticky bitter finish.
Update - this has become one of my go-to beers. That nose is amazing! Definitely a grower, possibly my favourite amber ale.
loved the colour.  was super surprised by the maltiness and hoppyness.  late hops, dry hops and a generous helping of malts.  sip, chew, swallow and enjoy.

Pours an amber hue. Ample off-white head that dies down to a 2mm layer. Leaves plenty of lacing. Smells of huge hops and citrus. A slight vegetal aroma - almost like an earlier adopter of homebrewing would have (I know, Ive had it in mine before). Thats about all there is in the nose, hard to get past the hops. Big bitter bite on first sip. A slight bitterness on the back end as well. There is a watered down malt taste. A little bit of sweetness pokes its head around the corner, but hides pretty quickly. 

This seems to be a watered down IPA with some amber coloring thrown in. Not a bad beer, but there really isnt any character past the hops.

0.33L bottle, small stable head, clear copper darkish red colour, aroma of herbs, pine and nuts with a hint of fruit in the back, flavour of bread with some tobbaco and a medium flowery metalic bitterness, Fair, but nothing spectacular.

Bottled 330ml. -Shared with Marko. Batch No. 326. Red amber coloured, small off-white head, pleasant agrumey hoppy nose. Moderate malty, agrumey hoppy and mild caramel with notes of fruits. Slightly herbal and a bit short finish. Nice beer.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Pours a hazy amber with a nice beige head. Aroma is heavy on the hops with sweet malts and citrus. Taste is mainly of pine, hops, caramel malts. Very good. Very popular at out store. Price makes it more inviting

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 30.4.2011: Bottle. Pours amber with a small head. Aroma is strongly pine and juniper with some berriness in it. Taste is pine and especially juniper with some juniper berries. No fruitiness or tones of red berries that I enjoyed before. A disappointment.

23.1.2011: Cask @ Gallows Bird, Espoo, RAF2011. A very nice amber color with a small head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, hops, a hint of berries, perhaps strawberry? Taste is a lot of pine, some grapefruit. Palate is excellent, fairly light and carbonated.
Clear golden colour with a medium off-white head. Aroma is heavy hopped with some citrus notes. Flavor is heavy hoppy and fresh. Moderate soft sweetness.

Bottled 33cl. It pours a hazy amber beer with a creamy, nicely lacing light beige head. The aroma is quite inviting, reminiscent of white wine, crystal malts, caramel, grapefruit and hop resin- spicy and rather strong. Medium bodied. Leafy. Good balance. Slightly peppery on the swallow. Caramel and grapefruit in the finish which makes you eager to take another sip. Flawless and pleasant.

Aamuyön pyhimys näyttää kuulaan vaalean ruskealta ja omaa vaalean vaahdon. Sen tuoksussa on karamellia ja monimutkaista humalaisuutta. Oluen maussa on selkeä humalan puraisu ja katkeruutta on sopivasti. Napakka, hieman karhea maku ja ihan sopiva runko tämän vahvuiseksi olueksi. Brewdogin oluet eivät todellakaan jätä kylmäksi.
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel and hoppy - peach. Flavor is rather sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. 181210

At first i was like, jeeehh i like this, but then again after a few zips the boredom is there again. I dont know, it seems like Brewdog isnt really my type of brewery. However I really apriciate theire style, courage, looks and so on...

roasty, basement aromas, citrus,
red, brown, brown, hazy, 
rocky head, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter,
Bottle from the Offie, Leicester and hand pulled at the Criterion, Leicester - on the SAME night! Delicious rich hop. Some berry. Deep, crisp, perfect length and balance.

Bottle at Patricks Irish Pub, Ljubljana. Poured a lovely red body, slightly tinged with amber. Off white thick head that went away slowly.  Intense passionfruit-like and herbal sweet aroma, nice! Candyish dry taste, aroma hop, a bit herbal. Sweet and not really refreshing but definitely enjoyable.

12-oz. Pours a murky dark amber with a dense and creamy light tan head. Loose stringy lace. Sharp spicy hop nose, garlic, onions, almost like hot swimming pool toys. Maybe a bit phenolic? Something burning out of the yeast? Certainly a lot of hop oil and acid knocking around. Creamy medium body. Toast, caramel, swimming pool toys, and an ashy char on the mid-palate. Lots of garlic and onions. Hot, dry, peppery finish. Having a hard time making sense of this one. Usually I enjoy beers that deliberately throw different styles together, and this one seems like an amber/IPA/saison hybrid in some ways. But its hard to get around the garlic/onion thing with this one.

Bottle: Wow, when BrewDog doesnt go overboard on cramming a bunch of alcohol in a beer, they can brew some nice drinking stuff. Best amber ale I can remember, with chewy hop flavors, very cohesive brew that is just a cut above the normal flagship amber of most breweries. Huge head, lots of nice lace.
A bottle at Jack Browns in Va  Pours amber with a bubbly tan head.  It leaves a coat of lacing. A roasted note and citrusy taste underneath.
Bottle @ Maltainen Riekko, Helsinki. Poured abmber color with a white head. Aroma is grapefruity, flowery hops. Flavor is fruity as well, very bitter. Finish is very perfumy and dry. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 Bottle:  Aroma is first very fruity, notes of sourly berries, red currants. Then very hoppy, herbs, citrus. Flavor is also very fruity, berries, some malt, well hopped (herbal). Medium bitter finish.
Bottle. Intemsively grapefruity and lemony pale ale with light and dry body. Refreshing, bitter palate. Slick and hoppy palate.

An amazing orange to red with a decent beige head, aroma of pine needles, lemon grass and a touch of bread and butterscotch, balance of straw to bread maltiness and piney hops with a fairly lemon acidity and low sweetness, finishes with a long tea, tobacco and bitter-sour aftertaste, medium bodied, quaffable great beer.
33 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK. Medium caramel amber colour, bright cherry hop aroma. Thick with a bitter hit then a long dry building finish of clove and pepper with some citrus balancing it out.

Bottle. Hazy orange amber, ropy, lacy off white head. Aroma is full of citrus and tropical fruit and pine. Flavour is the same, with a nice toffee malt base. A very flavorful amber, a top session beer to be sure. Right up there with Stone Levitation and Rogue American Amber.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: E la mia preferita tra le Brewdog. Ha unaroma delizioso, molto agrumato dove già spicca lalto contenuto di luppolo. Al palato ha un gusto che spiazza, perchè la si attenderebbe più amara ed invece riesce ad essere ben bilanciata, e abbastanza morbida,  caratteristica per me importantissima, dato che le estremizzazioni sono contro la mia filosofia di birra. Comunque grande birra!

This is probably one of my favorite BrewDog beers and on Cask it is so friggin good! I have never even had it in a bottle.

A - Poured a beautiful red amber with orange hue when held up to light. A cream head that was only thin because they fill your glass here in the UK.

S - Citrus, specifically lemon Lime and an even mixture of grassy hop bitterness.

T - Fantastic blend of Citrus hop bitterness with malty sweatness. a bit of berry fruits and a clean aftertaste. Just a wonderful beer.

MD - Smooth and easy, mild carbonation (on cask) medium to light heavy bodied, but not heavy on the palate.

Everytime I have this I love it more than the last.

Cask (Euston Tap, London)
6- Very sweet fruity caramalty aroma.
3+ Clear rich copper, sparkler head.
5- Raw mashy taste, horribly underattenuated. Grassy.
2 Sticky palate, carbonation low. Finish grassy.
8 Ugh, bucket-loads of not good.

It pours a hazy amber color with a a 2 finger off white head that tends to linger around. It has an abundant of lacing on the sides.

On the nose I am getting some light carmel notes and a hop spiciness.

The flavor is a nice well balanced profile. I am getting carmel,toffee,pine,citrus. It is a little sweet at first but the nice dose of hops evens it out. 

It finishes with a nice light dry bitterness. This has to be the best amber ale I have had. There is something that just makes you keep reaching for another. I could easily session this. Well done guys.

Provata alla spina: birra ambrata con schiuma bianca. Al naso sentori di spezie soprattutto fruttato. Allassaggio soprattutto malto e il luppolo. Il finale è caratterizzato dallamaro del luppolo che caratterizza gran parte delle birre BREW DOG. Molto beverina anche perchè poco gassata . Da provare.

Bottle, thanks to hobbersr. Pours clear amber, thick off-white head, great lacing. Nose is fucking excellent! Fabulously rich and layered hops; pine, spruce, grapefruit, just outstanding aromatics. Flavours are nicely bitter and balanced, with a solid caramel base, and mouthwatering bitterness throughout. This might be my favorite session ale ever!

Bottle. A very fruity aroma, some vanilla and malt, later on a little bit more bitter. The small pale beige creamy head has a normal duration, the body is dark orange. The taste is quite bitter, light fruity, some hops, very nice. The body is light, dry and creamy with a soft carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt and fruity hops. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
flot rødlig i glas med flot længe stående skumkrone.. lys bitter i smag.. vel lidt sodavandshalløj på min ... ok..

A really awesome beer. Wasnt expecting this to be as amazing as it was. The pour is bright golden amber with hints of ruby. A thick two or three fingers of beige head. Aroma is very hoppy with a sweet caramel malt. Light toffee and sweet grass aromas as well. The middle is sweet and malty with hints of toffee, caramel and light nuttiness. The finish is a prolonged bitterness akin to a pale ale or IPA. Very drinkable and extremely enjoyable beer.

Bottle.  "best before 23-06-11."  The description on the bottle (which is different than that shown here) is very reminiscent of Stones "arrogant" line.  Pours a hazy honey amber with a nice, dense, rocky off white head.  The aroma is awesome--sticky doughy, caramel malt, and plenty of spicy hops to boot.  VERY well done.  The flavor, although good, is less impressive.  Its a bit thin.  The amber malt and hops are certainly there, just not in the rich level that they display themselves in in the aroma.  It is weak on the palate.  Its very low carbonation, which is what i normally like, but it is just watery thin.  Not light bodied, but thin somehow.  Overall: still a very good beer, but shows the potential to be a great beer.

Cloudy amber colour with a huge head off white head. Aroma is very strong fruity and sweet. Taste is very malty with a huge hoppy bitter finish. Its common for BrewDog to ram as many bitter hops as they can into each bottle and I guess its an aquired taste. For me its a bit too much.
Clear red beer, thin head, overwhelming hop aroma, hints of nettles and citrus, not as overhopped as one would initially imagine, balances nicely with the first hit of malt, a great, bold beer.

(Cask at Gallows Real Ale Festival 2011) The beer poured reddish brown and clear. Its head was small and white. Aroma had hops, malts and white bread. Palate was medium bodied and dryish. Flavours were malts, saltiness, hops, boiled cabbage and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter and salty. The cabbage flavour was bit too weird. Otherwise nice brew.

Pours a dark cloudy amber with a nice tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, and other sweet spices. Taste is sweet caramel malt with some good amount of hops, some light fruitiness. Palate is nice medium body, with very good carbonation. Finish is sweet caramel malt followed by some hints of corriander and slight citrus notes and  a good amount of bitter hops to add balance. Overall a very nicely balanced and drinkable amber ale.
An in your face iconoclastic orange amber ale, this beer is not for the timid lagerboy... heavy malt and hop aroma and taste, nicely balanced, dry bitter finish. Love the rhetoric on the label!

I have been hoping to try some Brew Dog beers for a long time. This beer certainly did not disappoint. It had a thick pour with a powerful aroma and good head The taste was of bold malting with some high finishing hops. Nice red ale.

Tap @ OHaras.
Pours a reddish brown colour with a frothy, lacy, white head. Aroma of nuts, toasted malts with floral notes. Flavour of good bitter hops, toasted malts, flowery and also citrusy. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel. Bitter finish with some sweet notes too. Well balanced and very easy to drink.

Looks great. Pours amber with a thick foamy head. Excellent aroma, complex hops mingling in a delightful way. I love the smell of the chinook hops. In the flavour I taste more of the simcoe which is not my favorite hop. Big hops!  Very little malt flavour. this brew is dominated by hops. bitter and citrus, great balance. Great beer.  I love this beer. It is fantastic. with a very complex hop profile. And I love the blurb on the bottle. The Fucking Doctor is in.!!!!
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2011 (Bottle 22/01-11) Pours with a decent head but it fade quickly. Great hoppy aroma, could use a bit more malt body. Easy drinkable hoppy amber ale.

Rich flowery note dominates with interesting spiced vanilla tone, some lemony tea note here as well. Medium bodied. Flavor is rich as well with flowers and grassy hops, lemon and bitterness here. Aftertaste is grassy still, some tea note here too.
Mild nose with slight notes of blackcurrent and some sweetness. Pale head. Dark coppery reddish colour. Dryiish slightly coffeyish slightly sour taste with some berries. At the end hoppy bitterness.

Bottle. Too good to be an amber ale. It is Red (ish) with a thick lasting head that sticks to the glass. Big hop aroma you dont have to sniff for. Citrus with some woody notes. Thick malty juicy ESB. Dirty malty IPA. Lotst of malt. Lots of juicy citrus in thick sticky malt.

Huge, hoppy nose just bursting with fruit, rose petals, cheap perfume and camphor. Cantaloupe, mango, guava and grapefruit bleed into the olfactories along with some licks of caramel and earth late, a very interesting aroma but not all together truly enticing. Muddy amber chestnut with a tinge of orange coming through when held to the light. Head a no show, a little white on the meniscus. Pretty raw and untamed in the mouth. Again nothing but hops, so Ill have to cast aside my definition of an amber ale. Raspy and floral, very piney, quite vinous in the swallow (Sauvin is well defined!), with a lot of fruit esters to keep it from getting out of hand. Bitterness is high but controlled. Long linger of vine-clippings and pine, fruit esters dissipate quickly. No body or malt definition for balance, quite a soft, watery mouthfeel. Expected more oomph, some crystal or cara wouldve been great, maybe better use of the Marris Otter so as it shines on the palate. Highly drinkable, just a little too one-sided for my taste! (33cL, batch 124, BB 20/05/11, The Beer Store Morley)

Bottle at the Salthouse in Galway. Appearance: Dark orange with a decent sized white head. Aroma: deeply hopped, mango, a little cat pee with cedar & malt hiding in the background. Flavour: wow, decently hopped, pine, honey, cloves, spice. Just wonderful. A long bitter finish. Delicious.
Bottle. Great aroma of oranges, or citrus. quite bitter to the taste though. not bad.
funky candy like aroma..cloudy brown amber with quarter inch head..absolutely awful flavor like its stale or spoiled or something,moldy sour and sweet couldnt finish it down the drain it goes yecch

Pours dark amber with a fairly small head. Intensely bitter aroma with sweetness from malt and passion fruit. Flavour is full, again with some passion fruit sweetness and a biting bitterness. A very decent beer.

Bottle. Amber pour with some tan head. Slightly aged hop aroma and flavor tones, aroma is only hinting there now. Herbal, grassy, and light citrus flavors linger, even if they may have been more vibrant months ago.

Pours out a gorgeous clear amber, but the light tan head was a bit rocky and not too appetizing.  Left great lacing though.  Aroma was enticing: malty, subtly hoppy, but after a while I smelled some copper.  Not sure about that.  Taste was somewhat metallic, with a note of pale malt, with a very light grassy hop character.  I wasnt so upset with the medium body as I was the taste alone.  The taste could have really saved this, but it was kind of lackluster.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a murky brown with an off-white head. Aromas of caramel, pine and soap. Dry malty beginning, fruity in the middle  a dry bitter finish; almost metalic. This is okay...tastes like a hoppy Scottish ale.

Bottle at my uncles! Very fruity, flowery hop nose with a touch of sweet leather. Red Amber colour,crystal clear, off White fluffy head. Light fruity mouthfeel with sweet honeyed fruit to start with and finishes with quite a whollop of botanical steely hop bitterness. Full on, very rounded flavour!

Rating #381, bottle from Kvickly  

A brown-red beer with okay head. Aroma was the most delicious part about this beer, with bunches of blackcurrant, other berries, flowery hops and a bit of wet malts. Flavor was butter, a bit berries, flowers and hops, definately delicious but somewhat abrupt, as the taste dissapears quickly in the mouth. Palate was a bit thin, but elsewise a very fine beer, and a very delicate amber ale.
Bottle: Pours a brown color with a beige head. Nice hops aroma with caramel malt. Taste is a metal hops biter with a sweet malt.

Pours hazy copper with a creamy head and gentle lacing. A sweet aroma of honey, caramel, floral hops and a bit of saurkraut. Lightly carbonated and smooth. Taste is malty hoppy sweetness with a slight bitter finish. Smells a little better than it tastes.
Aroma ottimo di luppolo. Allassaggio risulta molto secca (il malto Crystal nettamente in secondo piano) ed amara (25 IBU ?? x 2?). Sicuramente una birra beverina, senza grosse pretese.

Bottle @ Brugsen, Odense. Pours amber with a creamy white head. At first lots of fresh hops peaks through in the aroma.  Peach and Pine. As the beer warms up it gets buttery. Diacetyl/Butter - Unfortunatly. Smooth palate.
Bottle shared with the in-law. Rich amber color, hops in the nose and a nice blend of hops and citrus in a bitter blanket that lasts through the aftertaste. Very nice.
Bottle - Clear. Off white (slightly toffee coloured) head. Average carnonation and body. Caramel malts. Loads of aromatic hops. Peachy nectarine flavours with a good bitterness. A great beer!
Bottle. Citrus, hops and vanilla in aroma. Amber colour with a red tone and beige head. Plenty of hops, fruits and some nuts in flavour. Dry, spicy and bitter finish.
Pretty hoppy for an amber. Nice balance, sweet and bitter, with a medium body and smooth finish. Its excellent for an amber, though it reminds me much more of a pale ale.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 
Dec, 2010 Bottle. Whats an Amber Ale? Its a pale ale brewed with a proportion of crystal malt to give the beer an amber colour. The Americans use the term, the French do as well. We used to use the term in the UK, but havent really done so for many years. None of the beers that are generally termed Amber Ale fit this beer, so Im not quite sure what the BrewDog guys are thinking of. This is in the American IPA style - its rather more hoppy than an APA, though the abv is more in keeping with that style. However, the use of crystal malt has given this a certain dryness and a rough edge and a depth of malt character that is interesting. Usually brewers like to balance big hops with a lot of clean, sweet, juicy pale malt, so this is a little different. It is, though, more of a take on IPA than on Amber Ale - perhaps Imperial Amber Ale? Anyway, it often takes me a while to appreciate BrewDog beers and big hoppy beers, so I dont expect to enjoy this on first visit. And my expectation was fulfilled. Its drinkable, but its not my thing. Too dry, and too filtered and lifeless, and too much relying on hops. Beer is about the malt - the hops are a flavouring.  [2.6]
Dec, 2014 330ml dark bottle. 5 A.M. Saint 5%.  Filtered. From Grande Wines, Woolston. Dry red beer, filtered, with hops. Lots of amusing hype on the bottle that some people like and others hate. Most brewers do it. Generate a brand loyalty. This is not a brand image I personally buy into, and I dont like boring lifeless beers which generate their only interest from throwing in excessive flavourings of one sort or another. And hops are one such flavouring. I love beer when magic occurs between the malt and the yeast. Theres no magic here. Its drinkable, but its not my thing. [2.7]
Bottle.Dark amber colour with small white head.Aroma is fruity and malty with taste of pine and citrus hoppy and floral with slight bitterness,well balanced and crispy finish.

First things first.  I love Brew Dog.  Seriously.  The guys cant make a bad beer.  From a Slightly citrussy, toasty nose of grapefruit, honey and figs this moves into an incredibly tasty brew with a rich, round mouthfeel, notes of nutmeg, honey and more citrus, and a long, thirst-quenching, gently bittersweet finish.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Bottle, april 1st 2016. Dark red body with a small tanned head. Aroma of fruity hops, pine, toast. Taste of caramel, spicy hops, peach. Easy bitterness with a refreshing end. Quite nice.

Bottle:
Batch 312:
White head on top of a clear dark orange beer.
Smell lots of hops, flowers and a slight hint of fruit and malts.
Taste is bit watery but a nice mix of fruit and hops: pine, citrus, lemon, grape fruit, flowers, bitter.
Mid to full carbo with a tingling mouthfeel, light watery body. Interesting beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Smell of yeast, floral and citrus with earth tones. Tastes the same with caramel hints. Good and smooth mouthfeel. Very good amber ale.

11.2oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours ruby/amber with a cream-colored, lacy head.  Aroma strong of hops, floral and citrus, and some earthy notes in addition to caramel malts.  Flavor of light malts and earthy yeast has a smooth hop undertone with the bitter notes in the finish.  The beer has a slightly better texture than most.  Pretty good for the style.  Worth trying.

From a 330ml bottle on 15/12/2010. Batch 4D (best before 29/3/2011). Has a pronounced and impressive floral and citric hop aroma. More citrus fruit and floral notes follow when you take a sip, along with some caramel malt. Has a nice long hop finish. Seems more like an APA than an amber ale to me. A well made brew.

A nice amber beer and nicely carbonated for this brewer. Aroma was pretty good. Caramel and toffee. Pour was a bubbly dark amber/near brown with a 2 finger off white head. Taste was very earthy and full. Strong roasted malt character with plenty of bubbles biting the tongue and cheeks. The malty sweetness carries through to the aftertaste where there was a hint of grassy hops. One of the better ambers out there.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 oz bottle. Healthy lingering head over amber ale. Sweet malts fall back on a solid hop presence. Great mouthfeel & amazing palate.

[cask at Cloisters, Edinburgh] Pours a beautiful dark amber colour with a thin puffy white head. Enormous bitter hop aroma, sharp pine needle scent with some malty whisps coming through as well. On the palate its bitingly bitter, but has the required amount of sweetness to balance. Good crisp finish. I know BrewDogs ethos is to favour keg beers, but this is amazing on cask [03122010]

Nice dark reddish pour. Big bubbly head with good retention. Hoppy, earthy aromas hit the nose first, then followed by the malts. The flavor has a good amount of malt character to it, but also has some dried fruit qualities to it as well. Well balanced and easy to drink.

I expected much more from this Brew Dog offering. Too hoppy without a reason. The mixed malting did not play well with others. Turned out to be a bit of a mess. Undeterred, I shall seek out other examples from this brewery.

Draught keg @ Cloisters. Bright red, stable head and lace. Aroma of cannabis seeds. Light on the tongue. Quite balanced actually, with big fruity malts to back up the substantial hop palate. Has an American character, especially as it is served so cold from keg and has assertive carbonation. A nice change of pace from what wed been drinking lately. Good stuff.
Bottle 330ml. Color amber with medium head. Aroma hop, grape, sweet. Taste hop, sweet, bitter, dry.

Pours a reddish-amber with some copper highlights. Nice tan head and a good amount of lacing as it goes down. Smells immediately of hops; definitely some pine and resin. Taste is quite a bit maltier with some dry amber malt going throughout. Mouthfeel is light to medium--definitely toward the hoppy-amber end of the spectrum. Drinkability is nice. Flavorful but not at all overpowering.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-18-2010

33cl bottle.
amber colour.  Good white foamy head.  nice beer :-)

Ruby red pour with a off white head. Aroma is semi fresh hop pellets (centennial), slight caramel like maltyness and forest honey. Taste is, just like the aroma, very unrefined and taste a lot like sucking on hop pellets. I get flavors of pine, grapefruit peel, roasted malt and mild sweetness. Like a pine forrest in the autumn. Very nice carbonation and mouth feel. Long bitter aftertaste. Very far from perfect and have a curtain home brew feel to it, but still quite ok.

Great amber, chestnut colour with a quality frothy toffee head and lace. Floral hop aroma. Fruity and very pleasant. Crisp bitter texture and very refreshing. Initial hop bitterness which soon changes to an earthy flavour. I cant quite put my finger on it. Nice beer, but I wouldnt call it an amber ale.

Bottle.  Pours clear amber with a large, frothy beige head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, straw, cereal), heavy hops (earthy, pine, herbal, woody), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of peach and pineapple.  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, straw, cereal), heavy hops (earthy, pine, herbal, woody), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of peach and pineapple.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry and biting finish.

This beer is phenomenal! I drank some while in a bar in London, "the Rake" it was. Well, I was truly amazed, the color, smell and flavor, made me want to stick with this all night, but with the selection in the bar had me trying all kinds. So long story short, I loved this one, everything these guys touch turns to magic in my mouth, yeah I said it, and Im not ashamed, I would cup the bottle, push it to the back of my throat and swallow the suds! No lie, good stuff.

330mL bottle, pours clear amber with an off-white head. Great aroma of piney hops, caramel malts, and spices. Flavour is more balanced with the malts revealing themselves first, and spicy hops towards the finish. Great amber ale.
